properties.name: A.R.A. San Juan
properties.proposer: Servicio de Hidrografia Naval, Argentina
properties.history: Named from the Argentinean Navy's Submarine A.R.A. "San Juan", lost on November 17th of 2017. The wreck was found at depth of 907 m on this feature on November 18th of 2018.
properties.comments: This feature has a V-shape and a steepness of 15%.

properties.name: Abrolhos
properties.history: Named from the nearby Abrolhos Archipelago. The specific term Abrolhos which means "open eyes; to stare" was used by the ancient Portuguese navigators when arriving in this shallow area with many coral reefs.

properties.name: Aby
properties.history: Named after the nearby Aby Lagoon.

properties.name: Aconcagua
properties.proposer: Hydrographic and Oceanographic Office  of the Chilean Navy (SHOA)
properties.history: Named after the Aconcagua River.

properties.name: Adana
properties.proposer: RA. Sevket Gucluer, Turkey
properties.comments: Formerly, Adana (or Cilicia) Trough.

properties.name: Adare
properties.proposer: Steven C. Cande, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after the nearby land feature Cape Adare, which was named after an officer of the Ross expedition in the 1840s.

properties.name: Adieu
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named after the adjacent Cape Adieu.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Ceduna."

properties.name: Admiralteystvo
properties.proposer: Galina V. Agapova, Geological Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences (GIN RAS)

properties.name: Admiralteystvo
properties.proposer: Galina V. Agapova, Geological Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences (GIN RAS)
properties.history: Named after the nearby Admiralteystvo Peninsula. This is the Russian spelling of "Admiralty", which was the former name of the Russian Navy.
properties.comments: Russian survey data was used for supporting contours. Track control and track density was not available. Contours similar to those on IBCAO sheet. Average spacing of soundings in this area was 5 km. This feature was discovered/surveyed by Russian icebrea

properties.name: Aegis
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Name given by Dutch scientists, AEGIS is the name of a Dutch Research Vessel.
properties.comments: Outmost portion of Berthois Spur/Meriadzek Terrace system.

properties.name: Aguila
properties.comments: SCGN/10 was of the opinion that this feature might better be classed as a Ridge.

properties.name: Agulhas
properties.proposer: Eric S. W. Simpson, University of Cape Town (UCT), South Africa
properties.history: Named from the nearby Cape Agulhas, in South Africa, the geographic southern tip of the African continent and the beginning of the dividing line between the Atlantic and Indian Oceans.

properties.name: Aiguillon
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: L' Aiguillon is a small town located on the Atlantic coast, NW of the city of La Rochelle, on the west coast of France.

properties.name: Aix
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Aix is a small island located between the city of La Rochelle and Oleron island, off the western coast of France.

properties.name: Akademik Fedorov
properties.proposer: Heinrich Hinze, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named after the Soviet Research Ship "Akademik Fedorov" which worked in this area in 1989.

properties.name: Akademik Kurchatov
properties.proposer: Aleksandr V. Zhivago, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.discoverer: Russian research vessels "Akademic Kurchatov" and "Dmitriy Mendeleev"
properties.history: Named from the Russian R/V "Akademik Kurchatov" that closely investigated this feature.

properties.name: Aki-No-Nanakusa
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: "Aki-No-Nanakusa" means "the seven flowers of autumn" in Japanese.
properties.comments: The Aki-No-Nanakusa Seamounts encompass the following features: Fujibakama Seamount; Kuzuhana Seamount; Kikyo Seamount; Ominaeshi Seamount; Nadeshiko Seamount; Susuki Seamount; and Hagi Seamount.

properties.name: Al'banov
properties.proposer: Galina V. Agapova, Geological Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences (GIN RAS)
properties.history: Named after Valerian I. Al'banov (1882-1919), Russian navigator on the ship "Svyataya Anna" and leader of the expedition of G. Brusilov (1912-1914) in the Arctic. Al'banov and fourteen sailors left the drifting ship near 83N-60E and after three months re

properties.name: Alaminos
properties.proposer: Jose Luis Frias Salazar, National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI), Mexico; and Lisa Taylor, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named after Texas A&M Research Ship "Alaminos".

properties.name: Albert de Monaco
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France; and Portuguese Hydrographic Office (Instituto Hidrografico)
properties.history: In recognition of Prince Albert 1er of Monaco's work improving the knowledge of the Azores region.

properties.name: Aleutian
properties.history: Named from the nearby Aleutian Islands.
properties.comments: Maximum depth at 5051'N, 17711'E.

properties.name: Almirante Camara
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Named from the Brazilian Navy oceanographic vessel "Almirante Camara" that discovered this feature. The vessel name is a tribute to Admiral Antonio Alves Camara Junior (1891-1958), who was an important promoter of Brazilian hydrography.
properties.comments: This feature has a sinuous shape. It has been mentioned in many scientific papers, publications and studies on the Brazilian continental margin, such as Viana et al (2002), Schereiner et al (2008), and Almeida & Kowsmann (2014).

properties.name: Althoff
properties.proposer: Sonja Guetz, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named after Friedrich Althoff (1839-1909), German lawyer and patron of the 1899 Valdivia Expedition led by Carl Chun.

properties.name: Althorpe
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the adjacent Althorpe Islands, South Australia.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Ceduna".

properties.name: Alula-Fartak
properties.proposer: Anthony S. Laughton, Institute of Oceanographic Sciences (IOS), UK
properties.discoverer: Research vessels of the International Indian Ocean Expedition (IIOE)
properties.history: Named from its location as this feature extends from the Ras Alula, Somalia to the Ras Fartak, Yemen.

properties.name: Amami
properties.history: Named from the nearby Amami Island, Japan.
properties.comments: Summit very irregular and feature extensive.

properties.name: Amami Sankaku
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named after the nearby Amami Oshima Island, Japan ("Sankaku" means "triangle" in Japanese).
properties.comments: This feature is a right-triangular shaped basin, with the right angle corner located at the southwest end. The basin is characterized by flat seafloor bordered by seamounts and ridges.

properties.name: Amazon
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Named from the nearby Amazon State, Brazil, and Amazon River.
properties.comments:
The name Amazon Channel is well known since the 1970's and has been mentioned in
many scientific papers and publications, such as "REMAC Project - Geomorphology of the Brazilian Continental Margin and adjacent oceanic areas" and "Morphology and Structure

properties.name: Amazon
properties.comments: Formerly, Amazon Canyons.

properties.name: Ambalena
properties.proposer: Colombian Hydrographic Office (CIOH)
properties.history: "Ambalena" is an Indian name.

properties.name: Amirante
properties.history: Named from the nearby Amirante Islands, Seychelles.

properties.name: Amirante
properties.proposer: I. M. Belousov, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.discoverer: Russian research vessel "Vityaz"; and British vessel HMS "Owen"
properties.history: Named from the nearby Amirante Islands, Seychelles.

properties.name: Amlia
properties.history: Named from the nearby Amlia Island, in the Aleutian Islands, Alaska, USA.

properties.name: Amonhana
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.comments: Taken from the Bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse bathymetrique de l'Est-Caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93; compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: Amphitheatre
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Amphitheatre Escarpment.

properties.name: Amphitheatre
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from its shape as this feature resembles 2 amphitheatres side by side.

properties.name: Amukta
properties.history: Named from the nearby Amukta Island, in the Aleutian Islands, Alaska, USA.

properties.name: Amundsen
properties.history: Named after the Norwegian Polar explorer Roald Amundsen 1872-1928, who led the expedition that first reached the South Pole in 1911. He also was the first to fly over the North Pole on a airship in 1926.
properties.comments: Shown as "Fram Basin" in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Amundsen
properties.history: Named after the Norvegian Polar explorer Roald Amundsen 1872-1928, who led the expedition that first reached the South Pole in 1911. He also was the first to fly over the North Pole on a airship in 1926.

properties.name: Anakena
properties.proposer: Daniel Scheirer, Brown University, USA
properties.history: Named from Anakena Beach, on the nearby Easter Island, Chile, where the first settlers landed.
properties.comments: 100% multibeam coverage (Seabeam 2000) and GPS navigation.

properties.name: Andrew Bain
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA; and Christopher J. H. Hartnady, University of Cape Town (UCT), South Africa
properties.history: Named after Andrew Geddes Bain ("Father of South African Geology": A. du Toit), a mid-1800's field geologist-mapmaker-stratigrapher who noted similarities between fossil plants of Falklands-South Africa-Australia, in a sense anticipating Gondwanaland.
properties.comments: Shown as Bain Fracture Zone in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Anegada
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the adjacent Anegada Island, British Virgin Islands.

properties.name: Anegada
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA; and Advisory Committee on Undersea Features (ACUF) of the U.S. Board on Geographic Names
properties.history: Named from the adjacent Anegada Island, British Virgin Islands.
properties.comments: Replaces Sombrero Passage which appears on some nautical charts.

properties.name: Angola
properties.history: Named from the nearby State of Angola.

properties.name: Anguillita
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby small rocky island of Anguillita, part of Anguilla Island, British overseas territory.
properties.comments: Taken from bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse bathymetrique de l'Est-Caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93 compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: Anita Conti
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named after Anita Conti (1899-1997), a renowned French oceanographer. She is well known in particular to have drawn fishing maps of the West Northern Africa (Morocco, Mauritania, Cote d'Ivoire).

properties.name: Antarctic
properties.history: Most likely named after the Norwegian whaler "Antarctic" sent out in 1984-1995 to investigate reports of commercially profitable whales.

properties.name: Antigua
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Antigua Island, Antigua and Barbuda.
properties.comments: Taken from bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse bathymetrique de l'Est-Caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93 compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: Antipodes
properties.proposer: Steven C. Cande, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Antipodes Islands, New Zealand.

properties.name: Anton Bruun
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after Dr. Anton Bruun, the eminent Danish marine scientist who was the first Chairman of the IOC (elected 27 October 1961, died 13 December 1961).

properties.name: Apitoka
properties.proposer: Daniel Scheirer, Brown University, USA
properties.history: "Apitoka" is a Pascuense term for "fresh lava". This ridge is surrounded by young lava flows, imaged by side scan sonar.
properties.comments: 100% multibeam coverage (Seabeam 2000) and GPS navigation.

properties.name: Apodi
properties.proposer: Helenice Vital, Geology and Geophysics Laboratory of Rio Grande do Norte Federal University, Brazil
properties.history: Apodi is the name of a city and a river in the region. The term "Apodi" is an indigenous word that means highlands or plateau.
properties.comments: This feature has a steepness of more than 50. The name first appeared in 2015 in a scientific paper from Almeida, N., Vital, H., and Gomes, M.: "Morphology of submarine canyons along the continental margin of the Potiguar Basin, NE Brazil".

properties.name: Arafura
properties.proposer: Muriel S. Grim, U.S. Geological Survey
properties.history: Named from the Arafura Sea where this feature is located.
properties.comments: Arafura Seachannel is the most prominent feature on the Arafura Shelf and is a seafloor feature of the Arafura Sea. Shown as Arafura Channel in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Aramis
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named after Aramis, one of the famous musketeers, born in the nearby region of France.

properties.name: Arcachon
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Arcachon, on the southwestern coast of France, in the Landes region.

properties.name: Ardencaple
properties.proposer: Hans Werner Schenke, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named from the nearby Ardencaple Fjord which carves the coast of Greenland at about 74N-20W. The term Ardencaple has been derived from a Scottish clan.
properties.comments: This feature was discovered by R/V "Livonia" during a "Gloria" survey.

properties.name: Areia Branca
properties.proposer: Helenice Vital, Geology and Geophysics Laboratory of Rio Grande do Norte Federal University, Brazil
properties.history: Areia Branca is the name of a nearby coastal city and also that of a structural fault which is located at the head of this feature. Areia Branca is the Portuguese for White Sand.
properties.comments: This feature has a sinuous shape and a steepness of 25 to 35. The name first appeared in 2015 in a scientific paper from Almeida, N., Vital, H., and Gomes, M.: "Morphology of submarine canyons along the continental margin of the Potiguar Basin, NE Brazil

properties.name: Argentine
properties.history: Named from the nearby State of Argentina.

properties.name: Argo
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the U.S. Research Vessel "Argo" of the Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO) that recognized this feature during Lusiad Expedition, 1962-63.
properties.comments: The feature was mapped in 1968, during Circe Expedition.

properties.name: Arguin
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Arguin Bank.

properties.name: Arguin
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Arguin Bank.

properties.name: Arkady Karasik
properties.proposer: Garrik E. Grikurov, All-Russia Research Institute for Geology and Mineral Resources of the World Ocean (VNIIOkeangeologia)
properties.history: Named after Arkady Moiseyevich Karasik (1930-1987), a Russian Doctor of Geology and Mineralogy, and winner of the USSR State Prize. He made a great contribution to the study of the Central Arctic bottom relief and geological structure.
properties.comments: Formerly, Karasik Valley.

properties.name: Arkhangelskiy
properties.proposer: Natalya N. Turko, Geological Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences (GIN RAS)
properties.history: Named after Academician A.D. Arkangelskiy (1879-1940), a renowned Soviet geologist, petrologist, tectonicist and stratigrapher, and author of many publications. He was also a famous Academic who worked on the sediments of the Black Sea in the 1930s and 1

properties.name: Arkhangelskiy
properties.proposer: Sevket Gucluer, Department of Navigation, Hydrography and Oceanography, Turkey
properties.history: Named after Academician A.D. Arkangelskiy (1879-1940), a renowned Soviet geologist, petrologist, tectonicist and stratigrapher, and author of many publications. He was also a famous Academic who worked on the sediments of the Black Sea in the 1930s and 1
properties.comments: Shown as Samsun Ridge in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Ars
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the village of Ars (en-Re), located on the Western coast of nearby Re Island, off the Atlantic coast of France.

properties.name: Aru
properties.proposer: Muriel S. Grim, U.S. Geological Survey
properties.history: Named from the nearby Aru Islands, Indonesia.
properties.comments: Shown as Aru Channel in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Ascension
properties.history: Named from the nearby Ascension Island, UK.

properties.name: Ashmore
properties.comments: Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer in 1996. This name has subsequently been removed from the ACUF database because it is a "claimed" territory of Australia and that the feature breaks the surface of the water.

properties.name: Astrid
properties.history: Named after Queen Astrid of the Belgians.

properties.name: Athos
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named after Athos, one of the famous musketeers, born in the nearby region of France.

properties.name: Atlantis II
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the U.S. research vessel "Atlantis II" of the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (WHOI) that discovered this feature in 1976.

properties.name: Atlantis II
properties.history: Named from the U.S. research vessel "Atlantis II" of the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (WHOI).
properties.comments: Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer in 2004.

properties.name: Atoba
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history:
Named from the Atoba (Sula leucogaster), a typical bird of the nearby Sao Pedro and Sao Paulo Archipelago. Its plumage is coffee color with white belly. Puppies are completely white. It feeds
on fish. The archipelago is a refuge and breeding ground for t
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape.

properties.name: Aubert de la Rue
properties.proposer: Roland Schlich, Ecole et Observatoire de Physique du Globe (EOPG), France
properties.discoverer: French research and supply vessel "Marion Dufresne"
properties.history: Named after Edgar Aubert de la Rue (1901-1991), a noted French professor at the Musuem National d'Histoire Naturelle (Paris) and geologist who, between 1929 and 1967, published at least 27 papers on several aspects (petrology, sedimentology, glaciology)

properties.name: Aucklands
properties.history: Named from the nearby Aucklands Islands, New Zealand.
properties.comments: Taken from NZOI Bathymetric map "Macquarie".

properties.name: Audierne
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Audierne, on the western coast of Brittany, France.

properties.name: Audierne
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Audierne, on the western coast of Brittany, France.
properties.comments: Bordered by Audierne Levee at its base.

properties.name: Aveiro
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from the nearby Port of Aveiro, Portugal.

properties.name: Avon
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.comments: Taken from Allen J. R. L., Nigerian Continental Margin: bottom sediments, submarine morphology and geological evolution (1964).

properties.name: Acores Este
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France; and Portuguese Hydrographic Office (Instituto Hidrografico)
properties.history: Named after the nearby Azores Archipelago.
properties.comments: Old name [See Laughton A.S. et al. 1975. Mid-Atlantique Ridge to South West of Europe, Sheet 3 (scale  400 000 at 41 N) (C6568). Also J. F. LUIS et al. 1994. Earth and Planetary Sciences Letters, 125: 439-459. Also R. Searle, 1980, ESPL, 51: 4156439 (fig

properties.name: Acu
properties.proposer: Helenice Vital, Geology and Geophysics Laboratory of Rio Grande do Norte Federal University, Brazil
properties.history: Acu is the name of a coastal city in the Brazilian State of Rio Grande do Norte. It is also the name of the most important river in this area. The term "Acu" is a Tupi indigenous word that means big, bigger or huge.
properties.comments: This feature has a steepness of 25 to 50. The name first appeared in 2015 in a scientific paper from Almeida, N., Vital, H., and Gomes, M.: "Morphology of submarine canyons along the continental margin of the Potiguar Basin, NE Brazil".

properties.name: Babeldaob
properties.proposer: David K. Idip, Jr., Territory and Boundary Task Force, Office of the President, Republic of Palau
properties.history: Named from the nearby Babeldaob Island, the largest island in Palau.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape.

properties.name: Baeyer
properties.proposer: Heinrich Hinze, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named after Johann Jacob Baeyer (1794-1885) who initiated the European longitude measuring project "Europaische Gradmessung". Baeyer put forward visionary ideas concerning international co-operation in technical science.

properties.name: Bahama
properties.proposer: Roger C. Searle, Durham University, UK
properties.discoverer: Brackett Hersey et al., Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (WHOI), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Bahama Islands.

properties.name: Bahama
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from its location, as this feature trends along the Bahama Islands.

properties.name: Baldaque da Silva
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named after the Portuguese hydrographic survey vessel "Baldaque da Silva".

properties.name: Bando
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: "Bando" is the ancient name (back to as early as 7th century) of the Kanto Region that is currently known as the greater metropolitan Tokyo area. The basin is close to the Boso Peninsula, which is part of the Kanto Region.
properties.comments: Bando Basin is part of the Izu-Ogasawara Trench floor. It occupies the northernmost part of the trench, and has an elongated and flat-bottomed trough-like basin. This basin is the deepest sedimentary basin in the world, about 3000 m thick. Only this sect

properties.name: Bao Chuan
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: In 1928-30, the Dutch research vessel "Willebrord Snellius", en route to/from the East Indies, recorded a traverse that indicated (with sparse data) several deeps and moderate highs in this now-delineated complex. "Bao Chuan" means "Noble Ship" in Chines

properties.name: Baoule
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: "Baoule" is the name of an ethnic group living in the central part of nearby Cote d'Ivoire. This is also the name of their dialect.

properties.name: Baranov
properties.history: Named after the Russian explorer of North America and Aleutian islands A. A. Baranov (1746-1819), founder of Russian settlements on the Aleutians islands and mainland Alaska (1799-1818).
properties.comments: Shown as Baranof Seachannel in ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Bartolomeu Dias
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named after the Portuguese explorer Bartolomeu Dias (c. 1450-1500).

properties.name: Basse-Terre
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Basse-Terre, Guadeloupe, France.
properties.comments: Taken from bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse bathymetrique de l'est-Caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No. 93 compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: Beauge
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named after Commandant Beauge, who compiled the first bathymetric chart of the Celtic margin between World War I and World War II.

properties.name: Bedaoch
properties.proposer: David K. Idip Jr. and Takamatsu Emesiochel, Territory and Boundary Task Force, Office of the President, Republic of Palau
properties.history: "Bedaoch" is the Palauan name for the White Capped Noddy, a bird endemic to the forests of Palau.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape.

properties.name: Beiral de Viana
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.comments: Name given by local fishermen. See J. Gormicho Boavida (1948).

properties.name: Belle-Ile
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of Belle-Ile, located west of the south coast of Brittany, France.
properties.comments: Shown as Belle-Ile Canyon in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Belochel
properties.proposer: David K. Idip Jr. and Takamatsu Emesiochel, Territory and Boundary Task Force, Office of the President, Republic of Palau
properties.history: "Belochel" is the Palauan name for the Micronesian Imperial Pigeon, which is a bird endemic to the forests of Palau.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape.

properties.name: Belov
properties.proposer: Garrik E. Grikurov, All-Russia Research Institute for Geology and Mineral Resources of the World Ocean (VNIIOkeangeologia)
properties.history: Named after Vasiliy Vasil'yevich Belov (1951-2000), a Russian Hydrographer. He spent many years as an officer with the North Hydrographic Expedition of the USSR Northern Fleet. He participated in several air expeditions and carried out oceanographic rese

properties.name: Berthois
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named after Mr. Berthois, one of the first authors of bathymetric synthetic maps of the north Bay of Biscay margins.

properties.name: Besnard
properties.proposer: Brazilian Navy Hydrographic Center of the Brazilian Hydrographic Office (DHN)
properties.history: Named after the French researcher Wladimir Besnard (1890-1960). In 1946 he organized the Instituto Paulista de Oceanografia, which was the first Brazilian institution dedicated to living resources, minerals and energy research in the Brazilian sea area.
properties.comments: This feature dislocates the Brazilian continental shelf and Besnard Bank. It has an elongated shape.

properties.name: Bibiariki
properties.proposer: Daniel Scheirer, Brown University, USA
properties.history: "Bibiariki" is a Pascuense term for "king of mountains". This ridge is the largest group of seamounts in this area.
properties.comments: 100% multibeam coverage (Seabeam 2000) and GPS navigation.

properties.name: Biib
properties.proposer: David K. Idip Jr. and Takamatsu Emesiochel, Territory and Boundary Task Force, Office of the President, Republic of Palau
properties.history: "Biib" is the Palauan name for the Palau Fruit Dove, which is a bird endemic to the forests of Palau. It is considered to be Palau's national bird.

properties.comments: "Courtown Cay" is named "Este Sudeste" (Cayos) on some nautical charts.

properties.name: Cretan-Rhodes
properties.proposer: Sevket Gucluer, Department of Navigation, Hydrography and Oceanography, Turkey
properties.history: Named from its geographical position, adjacent to the islands of Crete and Rhodes, Greece.

properties.name: Crozon
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Crozon, located on the western coast of Brittany, France.

properties.name: Crozon
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Crozon, located on the Western coast of Brittany, France.

properties.name: Cruzeiro do Sul
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Cruzeiro do Sul is the name of a five star constellation that indicates the South Pole (in English: South Cross). It is used as a national symbol by several southern nations and also appear in the Brazilian flag. The feature proposed is located in the Cr
properties.comments: Reference: Mohriak W. U., Nobrega M., Odegard M. E., Gomes B. S. and Dickson W. G. 2010. Geological and geophysical interpretation of the Rio Grande Rise, south-eastern Brazilian margin: extensional tectonics and rifting of continental and oceanic crusts

properties.name: Cunas
properties.proposer: Colombian Hydrographic Office (CIOH)
properties.history: "Cunas" is an Indian name.

properties.name: Curumani
properties.proposer: Colombian Hydrographic Office (CIOH)
properties.history: "Curumani" is an Indian name.

properties.name: Curumim
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Curumim is a Tupi-guarani word used to refer to indigenous childs. Tupi-guarani is one of the most important South America indigenous languages.
properties.comments: This feature has been mentioned in many scientific papers, publications and studies about the Brazilian continental margin, for instance, Schereiner et al. (2008), Almeida and Kowsmann (2014).

properties.name: Cuvier
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: "Cuvier" is a historical name for features in this area. Presumably named from the nearby coastal feature, Cape Cuvier, NW Australia. The name "Cuvier" originates from the French expedition led by Baudin in 1800-1803. Reportedly after Georges Cuvier, Fre
properties.comments: Incorrectly named Wallaby Plateau by Symonds and Cameron, 1977. The incorrect name appears on the AGSO bathymetric map "Hartog" which this feature was taken from.

properties.name: Cote d'Ivoire
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby country of Cote d'Ivoire.

properties.name: D'Artagnan
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named after D'Artagnan, one of the famous French musketeers, born in the nearby region of France.

properties.name: Daito
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of Daito, Japan.
properties.comments: Indistinct intersection with Kyushu-Palau Ridge at east end. Eastern limit is not obvious. Two islands near west end. Taken from Japanese Bathymetric Chart No. 6725. Shown as Daito Ridge in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Dampier
properties.history: Named after the British navigator and explorer William Dampier (1651-1715).
properties.comments: Taken from NZOI bathymetric map "Norfolk".

properties.name: Dangeart
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named after Mr. Dangeart, oceanographer and professor at Caen University.

properties.name: Dawson-Lambton
properties.proposer: Heinrich Hinze, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Name taken from the associated "Dawson-Lambton Glacier", which was named after Elizabeth Dawson-Lambton, benefactress of the Shackleton expeditions.

properties.name: Day
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named after Mr. A. Day, British geophysicist.

properties.name: De Santarem-Escobar
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named after the two Portugese mariners Joao de Santarem and Pedro Escobar who discovered Principe and Sao Tome in 1471.

properties.name: De Soto
properties.proposer: Jose Luis Frias Salazar, National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI), Mexico; and Lisa Taylor, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named after the Spanish explorer of the Gulf of Mexico, Hernando de Soto (1500-1542).

properties.name: Delesse
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named after Achille Delesse (1817-1881), French Hydrographer and author of one of the "first lithologic map of the French seas".
properties.comments: This feature has a very irregular outline and surface, as well as long and thin curving.

properties.name: Deroech
properties.proposer: David K. Idip Jr. and Takamatsu Emesiochel, Territory and Boundary Task Force, Office of the President, Republic of Palau
properties.history: "Deroech" is the Palauan name for the Little Pied Cormorant, which is a bird endemic to the forests of Palau.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape.

properties.name: Desecheo
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Desecheo Island, Puerto Rico.

properties.name: Diamantina
properties.history: Named from the Australian vessel H.M.A.S "Diamantina".
properties.comments: Not a Fracture Zone in customary sense of accepted terminology. This feature marks the break between "Broken Ridge" (actually a Plateau) and the northeast flank of Kerguelen Plateau. Much of this "zone" is represented by "Diamantina Escarpment," a more a

properties.name: Diamantina
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the Australian H.M.A.S "Diamantina".
properties.comments: This Escarpment runs along the whole of the south side of "Broken Ridge". Taken from the AGSO bathymetric map "Eyre".

properties.name: Dirck Hartog
properties.proposer: Rudi Markl, Columbia University, USA
properties.discoverer: Research vessels of the International Indian Ocean Expedition (IIOE)
properties.history: Named after Dirck Hartog, who was Captain of the V.O.C. ship "Eendracht" (1616) that made first landing in Southwest Australia, near Shark's Bay.
properties.comments: Shown as Hartog Ridge in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Discovery II
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the British research vessel "Discovery II" that crossed deep area in 1935-1937 and in 1961.
properties.comments: Exploration and delineation of this feature was conducted by SIO's research vessel "Melville" in 1978 and 1984.

properties.name: Doce
properties.proposer: Petroleo Brasileiro (Petrobras), Brazil
properties.history: Named from its likely association with the Doce River fluvial system during sea level falls.
properties.comments: Discovered during well drilling studies in the continental slope of the Brazilian margin in 2001.

properties.name: Doldrums
properties.proposer: Bruce Heezen, Columbia University, USA

properties.name: Dolphin
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: This name is possibly associated with the vessel HMS "Dolphin", which completed several round the world voyages in the 1760s under Commodore Byron.
properties.comments: This is a SW trending feature E of Challenger Plateau, separated from the plateau by Bellona Trough.

properties.name: Donghae
properties.proposer: Korea Committee on Geographical Names (KCGN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby city of Donghae, Republic of Korea.

properties.name: Donna
properties.proposer: James Hawkins, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after Donna Hawkins, wife of James Hawkins, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA.
properties.comments: Mapped by SIO's Research Vessel "Spencer F. Baird" in late 1960's.

properties.name: Douarnenez
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Douarnenez, on the western coast of Brittany, France.

properties.name: Drygalski
properties.proposer: Gleb B. Udintsev, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named after Erich Dagobert von Drygalski (1865-1949), leader of the first German Antarctic expedition on board "Gauss" (1901-1902).
properties.comments: Midpoint of this feature is on the eastern base of Bruce Ridge.

properties.name: Drygalski
properties.proposer: Heinrich Hinze, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named after Erich Dagobert von Drygalski (1865-1949), leader of the first German Antarctic expedition on board "Gauss" (1901-1902).

properties.name: Drygalski
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.discoverer: U.S. oceanographic research vessel "Eltanin"; and French research and supply vessel "Marion Dufresne"
properties.history: Named after Erich Dagobert von Drygalski (1865-1949), leader of the first German Antarctic expedition on board "Gauss" (1901-1902). Considerable scientific work was done on collections made in the Kerguelen ("Gaussberg") region.
properties.comments: These discoveries were made during the "Eltanin"'s 54th cruise and "Marion Dufresne"'s 67th cruise. This name supersedes, together with Chun Spur and William's Seamount, the former William's Seamounts at position 5320'S-8115'E.

properties.name: Du Couedic
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the adjacent Cape du Couedic, so named from the Baudin Expedition of 1802 after the French Naval Captain, Le Chevalier du Couedic.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO bathymetric map "Ceduna".

properties.name: Dubinin
properties.proposer: Vladimir G. Kort, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named after the Russian Polar Captain A. I. Dubinin (1808-1963). Dubinin was the captain of the research vessels "Lena" (1956-1958) and "Ob" (1958-1961).

properties.name: Dudek
properties.proposer: David K. Idip Jr. and Takamatsu Emesiochel, Territory and Boundary Task Force, Office of the President, Republic of Palau
properties.history: "Dudek" is the Palauan name for the White Tailed Tropical Bird, which is a seabird that can be found throughout Palau and the region.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape.

properties.name: Dusky
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Dusky Sound, New Zealand.
properties.comments:
A NE-SW trending ridge at the southern end of Fiordland Basin, offshore southwest New Zealand. References: Mitchell & Garlick, 2001 ("Dusky" Chart).
Adopted from the NZGB Gazetteer.

properties.name: DuToit
properties.proposer: Hugh W. Bergh and I. Norton, Wits Bernard Price Institute (BPI), South Africa
properties.discoverer: South African fisheries research vessel "Africana II"
properties.history: Named after Alex DuToit, South African geologist, a 1920-1930s pioneer in continental drift renaissance.
properties.comments: Mapped by the South African research vessel "Agulhas" and the SIO's research vessel "Melville" (1984).

properties.name: Dutton
properties.proposer: N. Christian Smoot, U.S. Naval Oceanographic Office (NAVOCEANO)
properties.discoverer: US Navy survey ship USNS  Dutton
properties.history: Named from the USNS  Dutton  (T-AGS-22), a US Navy survey ship which discovered the feature. She was one of the two workhorses of the early Pacific basin multibeam sonar surveys. The ship had been named after Benjamin Dutton Jr. (18831937), a US Navy Cap
properties.comments: Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: East Adare
properties.proposer: Fred J. Davey, Institute of Geological & Nuclear Sciences, New Zealand
properties.history: Named from the nearby Cape Adare, Antarctica.
properties.comments: It is the eastern margin ridge of a distinct rift feature north of Cape Adare. Two other parts of the rift have been named: the central low area has been named "Adare Trough" and the shallower western rift margin ridge has been named "West Adare Ridge".

properties.name: East Babeldaob
properties.proposer: David K. Idip, Jr., Territory and Boundary Task Force, Office of the President, Republic of Palau
properties.history: Named from its location, to the east of the nearby Babeldaob Island, the largest island in Palau.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape.

properties.name: East Cape
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the nearby East Cape, New Zealand.
properties.comments:
This feature extends 150 km NNE from the mid-continental slope off East Cape. It separates the 2400 m deep Raukumara Plain from the 4000-5000m deep Hikurangi Trench. 
References: Brodie, 1964 van der Linden, 1968 ("Cook" Chart); Baldwin & Lewis, 1991 ("C

properties.name: East Indiaman
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the special purpose armed merchant V.O.C (Dutch East India Company) sailing ships that were used in the west Europe - East Asian trade in the 17th-18th century for 200 years, the so-called "East Indiamen".
properties.comments: This NE-SW-trending feature contains two very distinct extensive elevations, Gulden Draak and Batavia, and 4-5 smaller linear elevations. It was explored by ships of the International Indian Ocean Expedition (IIOE), 1959-1965, in particular the U.S. Rese

properties.name: East Mariana
properties.comments: Shown as Mariana Ridge in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: East Mediterranean
properties.history: Named from its geographical position, in the eastern Mediterranean Sea.
properties.comments: Formerly, Mediterranean Ridge.

properties.name: East Pacific
properties.history: Named from its geographical position, in the eastern Pacific Ocean.

properties.name: East Scotia
properties.proposer: Roy A. Livermore, British Antarctic Survey (BAS), UK
properties.history: Named from its geographical position, east of Scotia Sea.

properties.name: East Sheba
properties.history: Named from the ancient kingdom of Sheba, in southern Arabia.
properties.comments: This is a sinuous mid-ocean ridge. Ref: Laughton, Whitmarsh and Jones, 1970.

properties.name: East Shoulder
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history:
The Godzilla Megamullion science team gave 14 names for the individual
topographic elements of the Godzilla Megamullion, such as "West Arm
Ridge", imitating the body parts of Godzilla from its back. Since this
feature is an elongated bathymetric high in
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape.

properties.name: East Tasman
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from its association with the East Tasman Plateau.

properties.name: Eastern Crozon
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Crozon, on the Western coast of Brittany, France.

properties.name: Ecuador
properties.proposer: Ecuador Hydrographic Office (INOCAR)
properties.discoverer: Peter Lonsdale, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby country of Ecuador.
properties.comments: This feature coincides with the collision area of the Carnegie Ridge with the continental slope. It is significantly lower than the Colombian Trench to the north and the Peru Trench to the south. This is due to the different tectonic processes which have

properties.name: Egeria
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the British survey vessel HMS "Egeria". En route to Polynesia, she took a deep sounding in this feature in the late 1800s.

properties.name: Egiazarov
properties.proposer: Garrik E. Grikurov, All-Russia Research Institute for Geology and Mineral Resources of the World Ocean (VNIIOkeangeologia)
properties.history: Named after Boris Khristoforovich Egiazarov (1918-1992), Russian Doctor of Geology and Mineralogy, Honoured Geologist of the RSFSR, the USSR State Prize winner. He worked for many years at the All-Russian Research Institute of Ocean Geology, ending as De

properties.name: Elcano
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after Juan Sebastian Elcano (1476-1526), a Spanish pilot sailing with Ferdinand Magellan, who brought the Victoria back to Portugal following the death of Magellan. The ship passed near this feature before rounding Cape of Good Hope and completing
properties.comments: This feature was discovered by various ships operating between South Africa and Crozet Archipelago. Formerly known as Del Cano Rise.

properties.name: Eleuthera
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Eleuthera Island, Bahamas.

properties.name: Emerald
properties.proposer: Steven C. Cande, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Emerald Basin. Vessel "Emerald" was in the region in 1821 and reported an Island, now known to be non existent.

properties.name: Emery
properties.proposer: James Robb, U.S. Geological Survey (USGS)
properties.history: Named after K. O. Emery (1914-1998), a U.S. geophysicist and marine geologist who studied submarine canyons worldwide at the University of Southern California and the Woods Hole Institution of Oceanography. He led major geological explorations and mapped

properties.name: Emperor
properties.proposer: Robert S. Dietz, U.S. Navy Electronics Laboratory (USNEL)
properties.history: Named for the Emperors of Japan.
properties.comments: Following an extended stay at the Japanese HO in 1953, Dietz recognized this major linear series appearing on Japanese HO charts of the 1930s and 1940s. Those nine peaks, all guyots are - from N to S - Tenji, Jimmu, Suiko, Nintoku, Jingu, Ojin, Kinmei, Y

properties.name: Endurance
properties.history: Named after Sir Ernest Shackleton's ship which was crushed by the Antarctic ice in November 1915.

properties.name: Endurance
properties.history: Named after Sir Ernest Shackleton's ship which was crushed by the Antarctic ice in November 1915.

properties.name: Endurance
properties.history: Named after Sir Ernest Shackleton's ship which was crushed by the Antarctic ice in November 1915.

properties.name: Engano
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Cabo Engano, on the east coast of Hispaniola (Dominican Republic).

properties.name: Equatorial
properties.history: Named from its geographical position, close to the Equator.
properties.comments: Formerly, Equatorial Mid-Ocean Canyon.

properties.name: Erebus
properties.proposer: Steven C. Cande, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the "Erebus", the main ship of Ross Expedition that explored this region in the 1840s. She sailed with Capt. James Ross to Antarctica in 1839-1843 and with Sir John Franklin to the Arctic in 1846-1848, then being abandoned in the ice.

properties.name: Eric Simpson
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after Eric S. W. Simpson (1924-1983), South Africa's premier marine geologist, organizer-director of University of Cape Town's oceanography program, international representative for South Africa (on GEBCO Committees and others).
properties.comments: Shown as Simpson Fracture Zone in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Erromango
properties.history: Named from the nearby Erromango Island, Vanuatu.
properties.comments: Taken from the 1995 "Seafloor Atlas of the South Pacific", SOPAC, Fiji

properties.name: Estremadura
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from the adjacent Portuguese Province of Estremadura.

properties.name: Eucla
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the nearby township of Eucla, the principal habitation on the coast of the Great Australian Bight near the Western Australia / South Australia border. The name was given by the explorer Edward John Eyre in 1841 to a bluff or headland and is re
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Eyre".

properties.name: Explora
properties.proposer: Heinrich Hinze, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named from the German research vessel "Explora", which carried out geophysical research work (1977-1980) which revealed this escarpment structure.

properties.name: Exuma
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Exuma Cays and Exuma Islands, Bahamas.

properties.name: Eyre
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Eyre Plateau/Terrace, so named after the British explorer Edward John Eyre (1815-1901), who crossed the Nullabor Plain on foot in 1841.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Eyre".

properties.name: Falkland
properties.history: Named from the nearby Falkland / Malvinas Islands.
properties.comments: The name "Malvinas Escarpment" is to be inserted under "Falkland Escarpment" on maps/charts. Coordinates revised at SCUFN-25 (2012).

properties.name: Falkland
properties.history: Named from the nearby Falkland / Malvinas Islands.
properties.comments: The name "Malvinas Fracture Zone" is to be inserted under "Falkland Fracture Zone" on maps/charts.

properties.name: Falkland
properties.history: Named from the nearby Falkland / Malvinas Islands.
properties.comments: The name "Malvinas Ridge" is to be inserted under "Falkland Ridge" on maps/charts.

properties.name: Falkland
properties.proposer: Robin K. H. Falconer, Institute of Geological and Nuclear Sciences (GNS Science), New Zealand
properties.history: Named from the nearby Falkland / Malvinas Islands.
properties.comments: The name "Malvinas Trough" is to be inserted under "Falkland Trough" on maps/charts.

properties.name: Falmouth
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Falmouth, Antigua and Barbuda.
properties.comments: Taken from Bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetrique de l'est-caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93, compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: Faro
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from the nearby port of Faro, Portugal.

properties.name: Farquhar
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Farquhar Group (of islands) and Farquhar Atoll, Seychelles.
properties.comments: Feature discovered during the Percy Sladen Trust Expedition.

properties.name: Fernando de Noronha
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Fernando de Noronha Ridge and Fernando de Noronha Archipelago.
properties.comments: Adopted from DHN. This feature is a scarp-like W-E trending rectilinear feature, located approximately 350 km E of the Fernando de Noronha Ridge.

properties.name: Fernando de Noronha
properties.history: Named from the nearby Fernando de Noronha Archipelago, Brazil.

properties.name: Fernao Oulmo
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France; and Portuguese Hydrographic Office (Instituto Hidrografico)
properties.history: Named after Fernao Oulmo, one of the first Terceira Islands settlers (Central Azores).

properties.name: Ferraz
properties.history: Named after the Brazilian hydrographer and oceanographer, Commander Luis Antonio de Carvalho Ferraz (1940-1982).

properties.name: Fifteen-Twenty
properties.comments: Shown as Barracuda Fracture Zone in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Filchner
properties.proposer: Heinrich Hinze, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby "Filchner Ice Shelf", which itself was named after Wilhelm Filchner (1877-1957), leader of the German Antarctic Expedition, 1911-1912.

properties.name: Fimbul
properties.proposer: Heinrich Hinze, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby "Fimbul Ice Shelf". The name "Fimbul" is a (Scandinavian) mythological topic.

properties.name: Fleming
properties.proposer: Norman Z. Cherkis, Naval Research Laboratory (NRL) / Five Oceans Consultants, USA
properties.history: Named after Henry Stanton Fleming, who was a research oceanographer at the Naval Research Laboratory.
properties.comments: This feature is located in the Brazil Basin within the Pernambuco Seamount Group.

properties.name: Flinders
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after Matthews Flinders (1771-1814), explorer of coasts of Australia and Tasmania (1795-1803), who passed near this feature en route from Australia to Isle de France (Mauritius) in 1804. He was interned on Mauritius 1804-1810.

properties.name: Florida
properties.proposer: Jose Luis Frias Salazar, National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI), Mexico; and Lisa Taylor, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby U.S. State of Florida.

properties.name: Florida
properties.proposer: Jose Luis Frias Salazar, National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI), Mexico; and Lisa Taylor, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby U.S. State of Florida.

properties.name: Florida
properties.proposer: Jose Luis Frias Salazar, National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI), Mexico; and Lisa Taylor, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: So named as the largest canyon cutting the West Florida Escarpment.

properties.name: Flying Fish
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Flying fish (family Exocoetidae) are very abundant and noticeable in these calm latitudes. Also, the harbour on nearby Christmas Island is called Flying Fish Cove.

properties.name: Fogo
properties.proposer: A. Ruffman, Geomarine Associates Ltd, NS, Canada
properties.history: "Fogo" is the Portuguese word for fire, and the seamounts in the area were born of fire.
properties.comments: The name Fogo Seamounts was retained by the proposer after more than a decade of scientific use. Adopted from the Canadian Geographical Names Data Base (CGNDB).

properties.name: Folin
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named after Leopold de Folin (1817-1896), French oceanographer who created the Marine Biarritz Museum.

properties.name: Foulwind
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with nearby Cape Foulwind, which Captain Cook named in 1770 after encountering rain, squalls, gales and sea swells there.
properties.comments: This feature forms a wide, flat-floored area with a bottom depth of 1000 m, offshore from the W coast of the South Island of New Zealand. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Foulwind' in 1979.

properties.name: Foundation
properties.proposer: Jacqueline Mammerickx, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named in recognition of U.S. National Science Foundation, frequent sponsor of seagoing research and exploration.

properties.name: Fowlers
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the adjacent Fowlers Bay, South Australia. The name originates from M. Flinders: Robert Fowler was the 1st Lieutenant of the ship "Investigator".
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Ceduna".

properties.name: Frederiksted
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA; and Advisory Committee on Undersea Features (ACUF) of the U.S. Board on Geographic Names
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Frederiksted, on the west end of St. Croix, U.S. Virgin Islands.

properties.name: Fujibakama
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: "Fujibakama" is the Japanese term for "throughwort" or "agueweed".

properties.name: Futuna
properties.history: Named from the nearby Futuna Island, Vanuatu.
properties.comments: Taken from the 1995 "Seafloor Atlas of the South Pacific", SOPAC, Fiji.

properties.name: Gabon
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby country of Gabon.

properties.name: Gaffney
properties.proposer: Craig Peterson, Naval Meteorology and Oceanography Command (NMOC), USA
properties.history: Named after Vice Admiral Paul Golden Gaffney II (1946-), U.S. Navy, whose distinguished naval career has been closely associated with ocean survey and research, culminating to Chief of Naval Research of the U.S. Navy (1996-2000).

properties.name: Gago Coutinho
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named after the Portuguese flying boat pilot Carlos Viegos Gago Coutinho (1869-1959) who carried out the first crossing of the South Atlantic in 1922.
properties.comments: This feature has several small and one large elevation on it : Josephine Banks at position 3645'N-1415'W.

properties.name: Gaillard
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named after Jean-Claude Gaillard (1945-1997), Engineer Hydrographer at the French Hydrographic Office (SHOM), who led several hydrographic/oceanographic campaigns in this area.

properties.name: Gakkel
properties.proposer: NIIGA, Russia
properties.history: Named after Ya.Ya. Gakkel (1901-1965), Russian Arctic explorer, who in 1948 predicted the existence of a transarctic ridge and contoured it on bathymetric maps, on the basis of bathymetric, hydrological and benthic data. He mapped this ridge from data of
properties.comments: Formerly, "Nansen Cordillera" and/or "Arctic Mid-Ocean Ridge".

properties.name: Galicia
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from the nearby Spanish province of Galicia.

properties.name: Gallieni
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.discoverer: French supply vessel "Gallieni"; and U.S. research vessels "Robert D. Conrad" and "Vema"
properties.history: Named from French supply vessel "Gallieni", TAAF re-supply vessel for French island program in SW Indian Ocean, 1960s - early 1970s. She logged more than 200,000 miles of geophysical profiling in SW Indian Ocean, 1967-1972.

properties.name: Gallieni
properties.proposer: Roland Schlich, Ecole et Observatoire de Physique du Globe (EOPG), France
properties.history: Named from French supply vessel "Gallieni", workhorse TAAF re-supply oceanographic research vessel that made several cruises to island bases, Indian Ocean, 1956-1972. It made extensive collections of bathymetric and magnetic data.

properties.name: Gambier
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the adjacent Gambier Islands, South Australia.
properties.comments: Taken from the bathymetric map "Ceduna".

properties.name: Gangneung
properties.proposer: Korea Committee on Geographical Names (KCGN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby city of Gangneung, South Korea.
properties.comments: This feature extends from the shelf downslope to the floor on the East. Some expression of the canyon extends onto the seafloor, eastward of the base of the slope.

properties.name: Gantheaume
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the adjacent Cape Gantheaume, South Australia.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Ceduna".

properties.name: Gardiner
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after J. Stanley Gardiner (1872-1946), a British noted scientist specializing on coral reefs. He led the 1905 Percy Sladen Trust expedition aboard the British vessel HMS "Sealark", 1905.

properties.name: Gaskell
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after Dr. Thomas Gaskell, geophysicist. He was senior scientist aboard the British vessel HMS "Challenger" on a 1950-1952 round-the-world research cruise.

properties.name: Gauss
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the German exploring vessel "Gauss", which visited this part of the Indian Ocean in the early 1900s.
properties.comments: Coordinates revised at SCUFN-13 (1999).

properties.name: Gazelle
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from the German ship "Gazelle" that devoted part of her campaign (1874-1876) to the SW Indian Ocean.
properties.comments:
This area was surveyed in 1995 by French research vessel "L'Atalante", with multibeam echosounder (Simrad EM12) and GPS navigation.
Coordinates revised at SCUFN-13 (1999).

properties.name: Geelvinck
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the "Geelvinck" ("Goldfinch" in Dutch language), Willem de Vlamingh's vessel in 1697-1698, when he visited St. Paul and Amsterdam Islands and the Southwest coast of Australia.

properties.name: Gengo
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: "Gengo" means a period of time in Japanese history.
properties.comments: Gengo seamounts' group includes a number of named seamounts.

properties.name: George
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the nearby George Sound, on adjacent mainland.
properties.comments: An almost N-S aligned ridge west of Bligh Basin offshore Fiordland. Reference: Garlick et al., 2001 (Milford Chart).

properties.name: Geraldton
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the nearby city of Geraldton, W. Australia.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Perth".

properties.name: Gil Vicente
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named after Gil Vicente (c. 1465-c. 1536), a noted Portuguese author (known as the Portuguese Shakespeare).

properties.name: Girdler
properties.proposer: James R. Heirtzler, Goddard Space Flight Center, USA
properties.discoverer: Robert L. Fisher and Andrew Goodwillie, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after Dr. Ronald W. Girdler (1930-2001) who was a pioneer marine geophysicist, long working specifically in the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden.

properties.name: Glacier
properties.comments: Taken from NZOI Bathymetric map "Balleny".

properties.name: Glendhu
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named after the locality of Glendhu on the adjacent mainland, New Zealand. "Glendhu" means "black rock" in Gaelic.
properties.comments: A ridge that trends NE-SW on the lower continental slope off the Wairarapa coast. Reference: Mitchell, 1988 (Palliser Chart).

properties.name: Gloria
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France; and Portuguese Hydrographic Office (Instituto Hidrografico)
properties.history: Named from the towed multibeam echo-sounding equipment GLORIA, which was used extensively to survey this area.
properties.comments: Ref: Laughton A.S. et al. 1975: "mid-Atlantic to south-west Europe", sheet 3 (Scale 1:2,400,000 at 41N - C 6568).

properties.name: Gnitsevich
properties.proposer: Department of Navigation and Oceanography (DNO), Russia
properties.history: Named after Yevgeniy Kupriyanovich Gnitsevich (1928-2001), a Russian Hydrographer who served in the Pacific and Baltic Fleet hydrographic subdivisions for many years. Under his command, a detailed hydrographic survey of the Baltic Sea was carried out. He
properties.comments: The seamounts are located in the central part of the Atlantic Ocean, east of the Mid-Atlantic Ridge.

properties.name: Goitaca
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Goitaca refers to an individual of the Goitacas indigenous group, which lived in Brazil between the 2nd and 18th centuries. They were exterminated by a smallpox epidemic that was criminally spread among then by colonizers. The Goitacas used to occupy coa
properties.comments: This feature has a sinuous shape. It has been mentioned in many scientific papers, publications and studies on the Brazilian continental margin, such as Schereiner et al (2008) and Almeida & Kowsmann (2014).

properties.name: Golden Bo'sunbird
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the "Golden Bo'sunbird" (aka white-tailed tropic bird or Phaeton lepturus fulvus), a striking apricot-gold seabird believed endemic to Christmas Island.

properties.name: Gonzalo Velho Cabral
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France; and Portuguese Hydrographic Office (Instituto Hidrografico)
properties.history: Named after the Portuguese seaman Gonzalo Velho Cabral who colonized Santa Maria island (1432) then San Miguel (1434), in the Azores.
properties.comments: Steep 700-900 m decline, fairly linear. This is also the name of the SE Santa Maria Lighthouse.

properties.name: Gordienko
properties.proposer: Garrik E. Grikurov, All-Russia Research Institute for Geology and Mineral Resources of the World Ocean (VNIIOkeangeologia)
properties.history: Named after Pavel Afanas'yevich Gordienko (1913-1982), a Russian oceanologist at the Arctic and Antarctic Research Institute (AARI) and Yu.M.Shokal'skiy Prize winner. He took part in many air and marine expeditions to the Arctic, including the drifting o

properties.name: Gorynych
properties.proposer: Galina V. Agapova and Ksenia O. Dobrolyubova, Geological Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences (GIN RAS)
properties.history: Named for the similarity of its shape to the well-known mythological three-headed character of Russian fairy tales.
properties.comments: The chain of 3 hills is located in the northern part of the Knipovich Ridge.

properties.name: Grand Cess
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named after the nearby Grand Cess River, in Liberia.

properties.name: Great Abaco
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from its geographical position as this feature is north of Abaco Island, Bahamas.
properties.comments: Also shown on Bathymetric chart of the Blake Escarpment at a scale of 1:1,000,000, compiled by W. P. Dillon of the U.S. Geological Survey (unpublished).

properties.name: Great Bahama
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Great Bahama Bank.
properties.comments: Also shown on Bathymetric chart of the Blake Escarpment at a scale of 1:100 000, compiled by W. P. Dillon of the U.S. Geological Survey (unpublished).

properties.name: Greenland-Spitsbergen
properties.proposer: Martin Klenke, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named from its geographical position, between Greenland and the Spitsbergen archipelago.

properties.name: Grimaldi
properties.proposer: International Hydrographic Organization (IHO), Monaco
properties.history: Named after the Monaco ruling family who has been supporting ocean sciences for a long time.

properties.name: Grossos
properties.proposer: Helenice Vital, Geology and Geophysics Laboratory of Rio Grande do Norte Federal University, Brazil
properties.history: Named from the nearby coastal city of Grossos, in the Brazilian State of Rio Grande do Norte.
properties.comments: This feature has a steepness of 25 to 35. The name first appeared in 2015 in a scientific paper from Almeida, N., Vital, H., and Gomes, M.: "Morphology of submarine canyons along the continental margin of the Potiguar Basin, NE Brazil".

properties.name: Grussai
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Grussai is a Tupi-guarani - one of the most important South American indigenous languages - word that means river of crabs.
properties.comments: This feature has been mentioned in many scientific papers, publications and studies on the Brazilian continental margin, such as Schereiner et al (2008) and Almeida & Kowsmann (2014).

properties.name: Guafo
properties.proposer: Hydrographic and Oceanographic Office  of the Chilean Navy (SHOA)
properties.history: Named after its proximity to the nearby Guafo Island.

properties.name: Guayanilla
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA; and Advisory Committee on Undersea Features (ACUF) of the U.S. Board on Geographic Names
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Guayanilla, Puerto Rico.

properties.name: Guilcher
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named after Mr. Guilcher, professor of geography at Brest University, who actively worked on the Bay of Biscaye.
properties.comments: Bounded by Guilcher Canyon to the West.

properties.name: Guilvinec
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby fishing harbour of Guilvinec, on the southwestern coast of Brittany, France.

properties.name: Guinea
properties.history: Named from its position, in the Gulf of Guinea.

properties.name: Hahajima
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Japanese island of Hahajima.
properties.comments: This is an elongated feature, with two peaks.

properties.name: Hakateka
properties.proposer: Daniel Scheirer, Brown University, USA
properties.history: "Hakateka" is a Pascuense term for "many corners" or "multiple corners", describing the changes of orientation of the volcanoes within the chain.
properties.comments: 100% multibeam coverage (Seabeam 2000) and GPS navigation.

properties.name: Hallett
properties.proposer: Steven C. Cande, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from nearby "Cape Hallett", on Victoria Land, Antarctica. Thomas R. Hallett was purser on James Clark Ross's Erebus, 1839-1843.

properties.name: Hammondsport
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.comments: This name first appeared on Chart BA214 dated 17 December 1954, as being reported in 1944.

properties.name: Hanna
properties.comments: Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Haru-No-Nanakusa
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: "Haru-No-Nanakusa" means "the seven flowers of Spring" in Japanese.

properties.name: Hatherton
properties.history: Named after Dr. Trevor Hatherton, former Director of Geophysics Division, DSIR (subsequently became part of the NZ Institute of Geological and Nuclear Sciences), Wellington, New Zealand.
properties.comments: Taken from NIWA 1:1,000,000 "Esperance" sheet. This feature consists in a group of five seamounts, separated from each other by the deep flat ocean floor between the Kermadec Trench to the west and the Louisville Seamount Chain to the east.

properties.name: Hauraki
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Hauraki Gulf. A Maori proverb about Hauraki refers to the wind that rises moaning from the sea, and it can also be translated as "the arid north wind" or it may be a personal name.
properties.comments: This feature is located offshore from the NE coast of the North Island of New Zealand. It curves around the western and northern sides of Barrier Bank and extends to Hauraki Trough. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Poo

properties.name: Hauturu
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: "Hauturu" is the Maori name for Little Barrier Island and means "resting place of the winds".
properties.comments: A ridge on the southern side of the Ngatoro Basin (outer eastern Hauraki Gulf). Reference: Wright, 1989 ("Cuvier" Chart).

properties.name: Hawaiian
properties.history: Named from the nearby Hawaiian Islands, USA.

properties.name: Hayes
properties.proposer: Fred J. Davey, Institute of Geological & Nuclear Sciences, New Zealand
properties.history: Named after Dr. Dennis Hayes, a marine geophysicist and professor at Columbia University who worked in and published extensively on the Antarctic region with the NSF USNS Eltanin program in the 1960s through 1980s. He has worked in the Ross Sea and co-au
properties.comments: This feature is linear.

properties.name: Heemskerck
properties.proposer: James R. Cochran, Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory (L-DEO), Columbia University, USA
properties.history: Named from the "Heemskerck", one of the vessels of Abel Janszoon Tasman (1603-1659), the famous Dutch explorer who discovered Tasmania and New Zealand in 1642.

properties.name: Heezen
properties.proposer: Jacqueline Mammerickx, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after Bruce Charles Heezen (1924-1977), an American geologist. He worked with oceanographic cartographer Marie Tharp at Columbia University to map the Mid-Atlantic Ridge during the 1950s.
properties.comments: One of four major fracture zones in South Pacific (others are Menard, Tharp, Udintsev) named for significant marine geologists.

properties.name: Heirtzler
properties.proposer: Steven C. Cande, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA; William F. Haxby, Lamont-Doherty Geological Observatory (L-DGO), Columbia University, USA; and C. Raymond, USA
properties.history: Named after James R. Heirtzler, a pioneer in the theory of seafloor spreading.

properties.name: Hellenic
properties.history: Named from the nearby country of Greece (Hellas in romanized Greek).

properties.name: Henry
properties.comments: Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Hermine
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby and long standing Hermine Bank.
properties.comments: This feature joins Shamrock Canyon complex, near 4740'N-0845'E.

properties.name: Herodotus
properties.history: Named after the ancient Greek historian Herodotus who was born in Halicarnassus, Caria (modern day Bodrum, Turkey) and lived in the 5th century BC (c. 484 BC - c. 425 BC). He has been called the "Father of History" since he was the first historian known

properties.name: Herrmann
properties.proposer: Colin Summerhayes, Scott Polar Research Institute, UK
properties.history: Named after Dr. Ernst Herrmann (1895-1970), the geologist and geographer for the 3rd German Antarctic Expedition aboard the M.V. Schwabenland (December 1938-April 1939). He obtained a PhD in Geology from the university in Berlin, then became a voluntary
