properties.comments: Continuous trough with steep sides, > 25. Surveyed during Expeditions ANT IX/3, X/2 and XIX/2.

properties.name: Hikunui
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Hikunui Island, east of Coromandel Peninsula, North Island of New Zealand.
properties.comments: This feature lies between Hikunui Valley to the N and Ngatoro Basin to the S, in the outer Hauraki Gulf/Bay of Plenty region. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Cuvier' in 1989.

properties.name: Hikunui
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Hikunui Island, east of Coromandel Peninsula, North Island of New Zealand.
properties.comments: This is a NE-SW aligned feature between a group of knolls to the N, and Hikurangi Ridge to the S. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Cuvier' in 1989.

properties.name: Hikurangi
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Hikurangi Plateau.
properties.comments: This is a flat-floored feature extending eastward from offshore Mahia Peninsula. It is incised at the southern end of the Hikurangi Plateau. References: Lewis 1994; ("Lachlan" Chart); Carter 1995; CANZ 1997 ("NZ Region" Chart).

properties.name: Hikurua / de Surville
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Hikurua / de Surville Cliffs on the adjacent mainland. Jean-Francois-Marie de Surville (1717-1770) was a French merchant captain with the French East India Company who commanded a voyage of exploration to the South Pacific.
properties.comments: This is a narrow NE trending canyon, located approximately 30 km N of northernmost New Zealand. The name first appeared on Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'North Cape' in 1990.

properties.name: Hillary
properties.history: Most likely named after Sir Edmund Hillary who, with Sherpa Tensing, were the first to reach the summit of Mount Everest.

properties.name: Hirondelle
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France; and Portuguese Hydrographic Office (Instituto Hidrografico)
properties.history: Named from "Hirondelle", the first oceanographic vessel of Prince Albert I of Monaco, who gave the feature this name [See Richard J. 1909 "L'Oceanographie" Paris].
properties.comments: This feature results from the grouping in 2002 of former L'Hirondelle Norte Basin and L'Hirondelle Sur Basin.

properties.name: Hokitika
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named after the nearby locality of Hokitika and Hokitika River, New Zealand. "Hokitika" means "return directly" in Maori.
properties.comments:
A canyon complex originating off the Hokitika River, West Coast, South Island, and wandering across the continental shelf and slope until merging with the Cook Canyon to form the Cook Channel. 
References: Brodie, 1964 Krause & Cullen, 1970 ("Bounty" Cha

properties.name: Honeycomb
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the nearby land feature Honeycomb Rock.
properties.comments: A depression between two ridges, Glendhu to the north and Honeycomb to the south. Reference: Mitchell, 1988 (Palliser Chart).

properties.name: Horizon
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the U.S. research vessel "Horizon" (SIO, 1962: Lusiad Expedition) which, together with the U.S. research vessel "Argo", discovered and explored this feature.
properties.comments: Discovered during the Lusiad Expedition.

properties.name: Hotu
properties.proposer: Daniel Scheirer, Brown University, USA
properties.history: Hotu is the first half of the Pascuense name Hotu Matua who was the legendary Polynesian leader who brought the first settlers to Easter Island. Matua Ridge is adjacent to Hotu Ridge.
properties.comments: 100% multibeam coverage (Seabeam 2000) and GPS navigation.

properties.name: Houtman
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the adjacent Houtman Abrolhos Islands, Western Australia.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Perth".

properties.name: Houtz
properties.proposer: Fred J. Davey, Institute of Geological & Nuclear Sciences, New Zealand
properties.history: Named after Dr. R. Houtz, a marine geophysicist who carried out some of the extensive marine geophysical research in the Ross Sea and the Southern Oceans in the 1960s through 1980s while on the research staff of Lamont Doherty Geological Observatory of C
properties.comments: This is a linear feature.

properties.name: Hovgaard
properties.proposer: Martin Klenke, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named after Andreas Peter Hovgaard (1853-1910), Danish meteorologist and member of the Danish expedition to the Kara Sea, first International Polar Year, 1882-1883.
properties.comments: This feature consists in two segments more or less parallel to the trend of the fracture zone.

properties.name: Huitoto
properties.proposer: Colombian Hydrographic Office (CIOH)
properties.history: "Huitoto" is an Indian name.

properties.name: Hurihuri
properties.proposer: Daniel Scheirer, Brown University, USA
properties.history: "Hurihuri" is a Pascuense term for "continuous rolling", related to a consequence of the incessant trade winds at this latitude.
properties.comments: 100% multibeam coverage (Seabeam 2000) and GPS navigation.

properties.name: Hurunui
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the Hurunui settlement and river nearby to the north of Pegasus Bay, New Zealand.
properties.comments:
This feature is incised into the continental slope off northern Canterbury. It extends northeastwards to the southern end of the Hikurangi Trough. 
Reference: Herzer & Carter, 1983 ("Pegasus" Chart).

properties.name: Hydrate
properties.history: Named thus because the sediments of this feature contain a lot of gas hydrates.
properties.comments: Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Iceland-Faeroe
properties.history: Named from its location between the Faroe Islands (Denmark) and Iceland.

properties.name: Icelandic
properties.comments: Shown as Iceland Plateau in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Igyuwon
properties.proposer: Korea Committee on Marine Geographical Names (KCMGN)
properties.history: Named after the Korean governor, I Gyu-Won (1833~1901), who supported navigation and commerce for the fishermen of Ulleung Do (Ulleung Island)
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape in the SSW-NNE direction and an irregular topographic relief at the summit. It may have been formed by volcanic eruptions at different intervals.

properties.name: Indigirka
properties.history: Named from the Indigirka River, in NE Siberia, Russia.
properties.comments: Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Indomed
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the "Indomed" Expedition, carried out in 1977-79 by U.S. research vessel "Melville" of the Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA.

properties.name: Indus
properties.history: Named from the nearby Indus River, one of the chief rivers of southern Asia.

properties.name: Indus
properties.history: Named from the nearby Indus River, one of the chief rivers of southern Asia.
properties.comments: Formerly, The Swatch Trough. Shown as The Swatch in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Institut Okeanologii
properties.proposer: Gleb B. Udintsev, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named from the Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Science which operated in the northwest Pacific Ocean in 1949.
properties.comments: Shown as IO Rise in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Inuwashi
properties.proposer: Yasuhiko Ohara, Japan Hydrographic and Oceanographic Department (JHOD)
properties.history: "Inuwashi" is the Japanese for golden eagle. A bird is relevant to the name of the nearby Oki-no-Tori Shima Island, which includes a "bird" (= "tori") within its name.
properties.comments: Reference: Ohara et al., 2011, Tectonics of unusual crustal accretion in the Parece Vela Basin, in Y. Ogawa et al. (eds), Accretionary prisms and convergent margin tectonics in the Northwest Pacific Basin, Modern Approaches in Solid Earth Sciences, 8, Sp

properties.name: Investigator
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from Indian Research Commission vessel R.I.M.S. "Investigator" (fisheries research) 1880s-1920s, that explored Bay of Bengal and northeast Indian Ocean.
properties.comments: This feature was delineated and explored by U.S. research vessels "Argo" and "Horizon", of the Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), during the  International Indian Ocean Expedition (IIOE) 1960-1965, also by other IIOE ships.

properties.name: Investigator
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the U.S. NOAA ship "Investigator".

properties.name: Io
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of Io, Japan.

properties.name: Iro
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.comments: Taken from Japanese Bathymetric Chart No. 6602. Shown as Iro Canyon in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Iselin
properties.proposer: Steven C. Cande, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after Columbus Oswald Iselin II, who worked at the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (WHOI), USA.

properties.name: Itapemirim
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Named from the city of Itapemirim, in the Espirito Santo State, Southeast of Brazil, located at the mouth of Itapemirim River. Itapemirim is a Tupi-guarani - one of the most important South America indigenous languages - word that means small rock.
properties.comments: This feature has been mentioned in many scientific papers, publications and studies on the Brazilian continental margin, such as the REMAC Project: Geomorphology of the Brazilian Continental Margin and adjacent oceanic areas (1979).

properties.name: Jacksonville
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named in association with the adjacent Jacksonville Fracture Zone, which itself was named from the nearby city of Jacksonville, USA.

properties.name: Jaguey
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Punta Jaguey on southwest coast of Puerto Rico.

properties.name: Jan Mayen
properties.history: Named from the nearby Norwegian island of Jan Mayen.

properties.name: Jan Mayen
properties.history: Named from the nearby Norwegian island of Jan Mayen.

properties.name: Japan
properties.history: Named from the nearby State of Japan.

properties.name: Japan
properties.history: Named from the nearby country of Japan.

properties.name: Japaratuba
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Named from the nearby city and river of Japaratuba, in the north of Sergipe State, Brazil.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated and meandered shape, and a steepness of 5 to 8. It is the continuity on the seafloor of Japaratuba river on the continent. The canyon is known since the 1970's and has been mentioned in many scientific papers and publication

properties.name: Java
properties.history: Named after the nearby island of Java, in Indonesia.

properties.name: Jeju
properties.proposer: Korea Committee on Marine Geographical Names (KCMGN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Jeju Island (Jeju Do, in Korean language).
properties.comments: This feature is a relatively shallow, wide depression adjacent to the north and eastern sides of Jeju Island. It appears to drain the continental shelf, and it likely did so during the last low-stand of sea level, creating an estuarine environment. The f

properties.name: John Harrison
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA; and Desmond P.D. Scott, UK
properties.history: Named after John Harrison (1693-1776), the lone English genius who developed the first marine chronometers, thereby solving the greatest scientific problem of his time, the measurement of longitude at sea, or on land, after a sea voyage.

properties.name: Johs van Hurtere
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France; and Portuguese Hydrographic Office (Instituto Hidrografico)
properties.history: Named after Johs Van Hurtere (1430-1495), a Flemish navigator, who led the first settlers of Faial Island (previously called New Flanders). He was the father-in-Law of Martin Behaim.

properties.name: Joao de Lisboa
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from the Portuguese hydrographic survey vessel "Joao de Lisboa".

properties.name: Jugam
properties.proposer: Korea Committee on Marine Geographical Names (KCMGN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby village of Jugam, on northernmost Ulleung Do, Korea, an island close to this feature.
properties.comments: This feature is located in the middle part of Ulleung Plateau. It is elongated in the NE-SW Direction. The summit has an irregular topographic relief with 4 seamounts. General shape is a linear alignment of 4 discrete seamounts.

properties.name: Kaede
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: "Kaede" is the Japanese term for "maple tree".

properties.name: Kaimei
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from its geographical location, between Kaiosei Seamount and Meiosei Seamount. "Kaimei" is a blend word of "Kaiosei" and "Meiosei". "Kaiosei" and "Meiosei" mean Neptune and Pluto in Japanese, respectively.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongted and linear shape. It is interpreted as resulting from a rifting of the proto Kyushu-Palau Ridge. All undersea features around the Kyushu-Palau Ridge are named after stars and planets. The single position is that of the shallo

properties.name: Kaipara
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with other Kaipara features on the adjacent New Zealand mainland. Lit. "kai": to eat, "para": fern root or a type of fish. Since fern root was a diet staple of Maori, "para" is more likely to refer to a freshwater fish, similar to ko
properties.comments:
This feature forms a NE-SW trending indentation off the continental shelf, NW of the North Island of New Zealand, in the Tasman Sea. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS)
chart 'Kaipara' in 1984.

properties.name: Kaipara
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with other Kaipara features on the adjacent New Zealand mainland. Lit. "kai": to eat, "para": fern root or a type of fish. Since fern root was a diet staple of Maori, "para" is more likely to refer to a freshwater fish, similar to ko
properties.comments: This feature forms a NE-SW trending indentation off the continental shelf, NW of the North Island of New Zealand, in the Tasman Sea. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Kaipara' in 1984.

properties.name: Kaitoku
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the Japanese fishery vessel "Kaitoku". She witnessed the first major eruption. "Kaitoku" designates an era of Japanese history.

properties.name: Kaiwhata
properties.history: Named from the nearby Kaiwhata River, New Zealand.
properties.comments: Taken from NIWA 1:1,000,000 "Cook" sheet. Feature located on the upper continental slope, 20 km off the Wairarapa coast, New Zealand.

properties.name: Kakeroma
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Kakeroma Islands, Japan.
properties.comments: This feature is arcuate and concave to north. Taken from Japanese Bathymetric Chart No. 6725.

properties.name: Kalinago
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named after the Kalinago (also called Island Caribs or simply Caribs), an indigenous people of the Lesser Antilles in the Caribbean.
properties.comments: Taken from Bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetrique de l'est-caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No. 93, compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: Kangaroo
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the adjacent Kangaroo Island, South Australia.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Ceduna".

properties.name: Karin
properties.comments: Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer. This name has been used since 1970s by workers studying Geology of Line Islands (Kiribati).

properties.name: Karitane
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the Karitane settlement on the adjacent mainland, New Zealand (the correct orthography has a macron on the 2nd [a]).
properties.comments:
This feature is the southern tributary that flows northwards into the North Bounty Channel. 
Reference: Carter & Carter, 1981 ("Oamaru" Chart).

properties.name: Karitane
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the Karitane settlement on the adjacent mainland.
properties.comments:
A canyon that forms one of the tributaries of the North Channel of the Bounty Trough.
References: Brodie, 1970 (Otago Chart); Carter & Carter, 1981 (Oamaru Chart); Carter, 1986 (Otago Chart).

properties.name: Karpas
properties.proposer: Sevket Gucluer, Department of Navigation, Hydrography and Oceanography, Turkey
properties.history: Named from the nearby Karpas Peninsula, in north east Cyprus.

properties.name: Katsuura
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby city of Katsuura, a renown fishery town in the Boso Peninsula, near Tokyo, Japan.
properties.comments: This feature is one of the many submarine channels that drain into the Sagami Trough as tributary channels. It is closely located to the southeast of the Boso Peninsula, near Tokyo. The easternmost end of the canyon flows in Katsuura Basin.

properties.name: Katsuura
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby city of Katsuura, a renown fishery town in the Boso Peninsula, near Tokyo, Japan.
properties.comments: This feature is located at the mouth of Boso Canyon. It has an oval shape. Multibeam surveys were conducted by Japanese survey vessel "Takuyo" in Nov. 2001, Feb. 2005, Jul. 2005, Oct. 2006 and Sep. 2007.

properties.name: Kazahayahoshi
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Kazahayahoshi Seamount. "Kazahayahoshi" is a term of a traditional Japanese dialect meaning "Southern Cross".
properties.comments: At around this latitude (15N), the Southern Cross can be seen even in the Northern Hemisphere. Accordingly, a number of undersea features on and around Kyushu-Palau Ridge are named from Japanese traditional dialect terms designating the Southern Cross.

properties.name: Keathley
properties.proposer: Jose Luis Frias Salazar, National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI), Mexico; and Lisa Taylor, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the U.S. research vessel "Keathley".

properties.name: Kedam
properties.proposer: David K. Idip Jr. and Takamatsu Emesiochel, Territory and Boundary Task Force, Office of the President, Republic of Palau
properties.history: "Kedam" is the Palauan name for the Frigate Bird, which is a seabird that can be found throughout Palau and the region.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape.

properties.name: Kensakiboshi
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from its geographical location, to the northeast of Kensakiboshi Seamount. "Kensakiboshi" is one of the Japanese dialect names that means the Big Dipper.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated and linear shape. It is interpreted as resulting from a rifting of the proto Kyushu-Palau Ridge. All undersea features around the Kyushu-Palau Ridge are named after stars and planets. The single position is that of the shall

properties.name: Kerama
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of Kerama, Japan.
properties.comments: Taken from Japanese Bathymetric Chart No. 6315.

properties.name: Kerama
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the Kerama Islands (Retto in Japanese), located to the west of Okinawa Island. The major islands of the archipelago include Tokashiki Island, Zamami Island, Yakabi Island, and Aka Island.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape and is a multiple aggregate of linear features.

properties.name: Kermadec
properties.history: Named after the nearby Kermadec Islands.

properties.name: Kermadec
properties.history: Named from the nearby Kermadec Islands, New Zealand.
properties.comments: Occasional very deep soundings by HMS "Egeria".

properties.name: Kikai
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Kikai Island, Japan.
properties.comments: Taken from Japanese Bathymetric Chart No. 6725.

properties.name: Kinan
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the district of Kinan, in the nearby island of Honshu, Japan.
properties.comments: Taken from Japanese Bathymetric Chart No. 6725.

properties.name: Kita-Amami
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Amami Island, Japan ("Kita" means "North", in Japanese).
properties.comments: Taken from Japanese Bathymetric Chart No. 6725.

properties.name: Kita-Amami
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Amami Island, Japan ("Kita" means "North", in Japanese).
properties.comments: Significant lineation. Shown as Kita Amami Escarpment in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Kita-Daito
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of Daito, Japan ("Kita" means "North", in Japanese).
properties.comments: This feature includes many elevations; irregular. Taken from Japanese Bathymetric Chart No. 6725.

properties.name: Klenova
properties.proposer: Garrik E. Grikurov, All-Russia Research Institute for Geology and Mineral Resources of the World Ocean (VNIIOkeangeologia)
properties.history: Named after the Russian marine geologist and explorer, Professor Mariya Vasil'yevna Klenova (1898-1976), doctor of geology and Honoured Scientist of the RSFSR (Russian Soviet Federated Socialist Republic), author of "Marine geology" (1948), "Geology of t

properties.name: Knights
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Poor Knights Islands lying to the SW, which were named by Capt. Cook in 1769, possibly in reference to a popular English dish at the time of Cook's voyages.
properties.comments: This is a NE-SW sloping feature, located on the Northland Plateau approximately 80 km NE of Cape Brett, offshore from the North Island of New Zealand. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Poor Knights' in 1995.

properties.name: Knipovich
properties.proposer: V. D. Dibner, NIIGA, Russia; and Vladimir M. Litvin, Polar Research Institute of Marine Fisheries and Oceanography (PINRO), Russia
properties.history: Named after the Russian Academician N. M. Knipovich (1862-1939), ichthyologist and hydro-biologist.

properties.name: Kokugan
properties.proposer: Yasuhiko Ohara, Japan Hydrographic and Oceanographic Department (JHOD)
properties.history: "Kokugan" is the Japanese for "Brant goose". A bird is relevant to the name of the nearby Oki-no-Tori Shima Island ("tori" means "bird" in Japanese).
properties.comments: Reference: Ohara et al., 2011, Tectonics of unusual crustal accretion in the Parece Vela Basin, in Y. Ogawa et al.  (eds), Accretionary prisms and convergent margin tectonics in the Northwest Pacific Basin, Modern   Approaches in Solid Earth Sciences, 8,

properties.name: Konotori
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: "Konotori" is the Japanese for a stork. A bird is relevant to the name of the nearby Oki-no-Tori Shima Island, which includes a "bird" (= "tori") within its name.
properties.comments:
The fracture zones within the Parece Vela Fracture Zone Province have names after birds.
Reference: Ohara et al., 2011, Tectonics of unusual crustal accretion in the Parece Vela Basin, in Y. Ogawa et al. (eds), Accretionary prisms and convergent margin t

properties.name: Konstantinov
properties.proposer: Russian Federal Research Institute of Fisheries and Oceanography (VNIRO)
properties.history: Named after the Russian biologist Dr. K. G. Konstantinov (1918-1983), who worked in the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans.

properties.name: Koppe
properties.proposer: Heinrich Hinze, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named after Carl Koppe (1844-1910), a German cartographer and geodesist who developed an empirical formula for the accuracy of topographic maps.

properties.name: Kosminskaya
properties.proposer: Gleb B. Udintsev, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named after the Russian Professor I. P. Kosminskaya (1916-1996), pioneering marine geophysicist, specialist in deep structure of lithosphere of oceans and continents.

properties.name: Kraul
properties.proposer: Colin Summerhayes, Scott Polar Research Institute, UK
properties.history: Named after the German Captain Otto Kraul (1892-1972), the ice pilot on the MV "Schwabenland" during the 3rd German Antarctic Expedition (December 1938-April 1939). He was a seasoned polar whaler - 47 years old - who had sailed most of the seven seas. Th
properties.comments: Continuous trough with steep sides, >20. Surveyed during Expeditions ANT IX/3, X/2 and XIX/2.

properties.name: Kucherov
properties.proposer: Garrik E. Grikurov, All-Russia Research Institute for Geology and Mineral Resources of the World Ocean (VNIIOkeangeologia)
properties.history: Named after Ivan Petrovich Kucherov (1912-1993), a Russian hydrographer. In 1934-1940 he took part in hydrographic surveys in the Arctic Ocean seas. As head of the Russian HO's charts division (1954-1971), he initiated the preparation and systematic publ

properties.name: Kuenen
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.discoverer: Research vessels of the International Indian Ocean Expedition (IIOE)
properties.history: Named after Philip Henry Kuenen (1902-1976), Professor of Geology at Groningen, Netherlands in 1930s-1960s. He was the marine geologist aboard "Willebrord Snellius" 1929-1930 and did marine fieldwork throughout the Indonesian Archipelago.

properties.name: Kumano
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby city and land area of Kumano, Japan.
properties.comments: Relief (at five locations, NE to SW): 800, 600, 400, 500, and 300 m.

properties.name: Kurchatov
properties.proposer: Gleb B. Udintsev, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named after the Russian Academician Igor V. Kurchatov (1902-1960), physicist and prominent figure in atomic theory and technology in Russia. He was Director of the Russian Atomic Energy Institute (1943-1960). He developed a system for protecting ships ag

properties.name: Kurchatov
properties.proposer: Aleksandr V. Zhivago, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.discoverer: Russian research vessels "Akademic Kurchatov" and "Dmitriy Mendeleev"
properties.history: Named from the Russian research vessel "Akademik Kurchatov" that investigated this feature closely.

properties.name: Kurentsov
properties.proposer: Russian Federal Research Institute of Fisheries and Oceanography (VNIRO)
properties.history: Named after the Russian entomologist, A. I. Kurentsov (1896-1975), who studied the Pacific region.

properties.name: Kuril-Kamchatka
properties.proposer: Gleb B. Udintsev, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named from its geographic location, as this feature represents a single structure between the Kuril islands and the Kamchatka peninsula.
properties.comments: Shown as Kuril Trench in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Kvitkuven
properties.proposer: Heinrich Hinze, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby "Kvitkuven Ice Rise".

properties.name: Kyushu-Palau
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby islands of Kyushu (Japan) and Palau.
properties.comments: This is the northern portion of the ridge. Taken from Japanese Bathymetric chart No. 6725.

properties.name: Kure
properties.proposer: Sevket Gucluer, Department of Navigation, Hydrography and Oceanography, Turkey
properties.history: Named from the nearby town and distric of Kure, Turkey.
properties.comments: Formerly, West Pontic Escarpment. Shown as West Black Sea Escarpment in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: L'Astronome
properties.proposer: Louis Geli, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: "L'Astronome" is a character of "Le Petit Prince", one of Antoine de Saint-Exupery's most famous books. The parable with "L'Astronome" expresses the fact that science without wisdom and human concern leads to the ruin of the soul.
properties.comments: Linear valley offsetting two segments of the Pacific Antarctic Ridge. Average depth near the central point is about 3000 m.

properties.name: L'Atalante
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the French research vessel "L'Atalante" that ran a key seismic profile across this feature.

properties.name: L'Esperance
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France; and Portuguese Hydrographic Office (Instituto Hidrografico)
properties.history: Named after "L'Esperance", one of the two SHOM (French Hydrographic and Oceanographic Service) survey vessels that surveyed the ridge axial zone (35-41N) in 1990, 1991 and 1992.
properties.comments: This is an isolated group of seamounts.

properties.name: La Bourdonnais
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after Bertrand Francois (Mahe) de la Bourdonnais (1699-1753), Governor-General of Mascarenhas (1735-1746) who was a premier figure in history of the region: sailor, pioneer, hydrographer, visionary engineer and administrator, soldier in south India

properties.name: La Confiance
properties.history: Named from the French ship "La Confiance", a converted escort vessel which carried out hydrographic surveys in the area during the 1960s.
properties.comments: Five seamounts lie on this ridge ("Oio Seamount," "Oa Seamount," "Itata'e Seamount," "Otaha Seamount" and "Ua'ao Seamount").

properties.name: La Coruna
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from the nearby Spanish town and port of La Coruna.

properties.name: La Desirade
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby French island of La Desirade.
properties.comments: Taken from Bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetriquede l'est-caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93 compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: La Desirade
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby French island of La Desirade.
properties.comments: Taken from Bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetrique de l'est-caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93 compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: La Ligua
properties.proposer: Hydrographic and Oceanographic Office  of the Chilean Navy (SHOA)
properties.history: Named from the nearby La Ligua River, Chile.

properties.name: La Rochelle
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby city of La Rochelle, on the Atlantic coast of France.

properties.name: La Romanche
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named from the French survey vessel "La Romanche" which first sounded in what was called the Romanche Deep in the 1880's.
properties.comments: Previously, One South Fracture Zone, then Romanche Fracture Zone.

properties.name: La Rose
properties.proposer: Louis Geli, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named after a character of "Le Petit Prince", one of Antoine de Saint-Exupery most famous books. La Rose (the rose) symbolizes the gracious fragility of women. The parable with La Rose represents the necessity of taking care of your love in order to keep
properties.comments: Linear valley offsetting two segments of the Pacific Antarctic Ridge. Depths near the central point range between 3000 and 3500 m.

properties.name: La Reunion
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.discoverer: British submarine HMS "Acheron" and various vessels en route Cape Town - Mauritius
properties.history: Named from the nearby French island of La Reunion.
properties.comments: This feature was mapped with traverses of vessels of the IIOE 1960-1965, or naval ships en route from Cape Town-Mauritius to/from Cape of Good Hope during Suez Canal closure, 1950-1960s. It complements and intersects the Mauritius Trench, a similar featu

properties.name: Labrador
properties.history: Named from the nearby territory of Labrador, Canada.

properties.name: Lachlan
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.discoverer: New Zealand hydrographic survey vessel HMNZS "Lachlan"
properties.history: Named from the New Zealand Hydrographic Survey Vessel HMNZS "Lachlan" from which this feature was discovered.
properties.comments: A ridge on the outer continental shelf off Hawke Bay, New Zealand. Trends south westwards, from a point about 15 km south of Mahia Peninsula, for a distance of about 25 km. References: Pantin, 1963, 1966; Pantin, 1966 ("Mahia" Chart); Lewis, 1976 ("Turna

properties.name: Lage
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named after the nearby port of Lage, Spain.

properties.name: Lagos
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from the nearby Portuguese port of Lagos.

properties.name: Laiib
properties.proposer: David K. Idip Jr. and Takamatsu Emesiochel, Territory and Boundary Task Force, Office of the President, Republic of Palau
properties.history: "Laiib" is the Palauan name for the Nicobar Pigeon, which can be found throughout Palau.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape.

properties.name: Lamar Hayes
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after Lamar Hayes, a marine drilling engineeer who pioneered deep sea drilling techniques on 14 cruises aboard U.S. research vessels "Glomar Challenger" and "Joides Resolution". He died aboard the latter vessel in 1988 near this feature.

properties.name: Lamjaybir
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby locality of Lamjaybir, Western Sahara.

properties.name: Lampaul
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the town of Lampaul, located on the western coast of Brittany, France.

properties.name: Langseth
properties.proposer: Bernard J. Coakley, University of Alaska at Fairbanks, USA
properties.history: Named after Dr. Marcus Langseth (1932-1997) of Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory (L-DEO, USA), who designed Arctic Basin submarine scientific research programmes in the 1990s.

properties.name: Langseth
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after Marcus G. Langseth (1932-1997), USA. He was Chief Scientist aboard L-DGO's research vessel "Vema" (leg 20-09) in August-September 1964 when this feature was discovered and briefly surveyed.

properties.name: Lavaud
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: It is likely that the feature was named after Charles Francois Lavaud (1798-1878) who was a hydrographic surveyor and the King's Commissioner for the French settlement at Akaroa on the SE coast of the South Island of New Zealand.
properties.comments: This feature is located approximately 100 km SE of Banks Peninsula. It reaches depths of 1000 m on the outer continental slope of New Zealand. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Banks' in 1977.

properties.name: Lazarev
properties.proposer: Vladimir G. Kort, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named after the Russian explorer Admiral M. P. Lazarev (1788-1851), leader of the First Russian Antarctic Expedition (1819-1821), as commander of the ship "Mirny". The expedition discovered the Antarctic continent and several islands in the near-Antarcti

properties.name: Lazaro Cardenas
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA; and E. Aguayo, Instituto de Ciencias del Mar y Limnologia, UNAM, Mexico
properties.history: Named after Lazaro Cardenas, former President of Mexico (in the 1940s), who sponsored development in this coastal region.
properties.comments: Shown as Lazaro Cardenas Canyon in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Le Croisic
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Le Croisic, located west of Saint-Nazaire on the south-western coast of Brittany, France.

properties.name: Le Geographe
properties.proposer: Louis Geli, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Le Geographe is a character of "Le Petit Prince", one of Antoine de Saint-Exupery's most famous books. The parable with "Le Geographe" symbolizes the imperious necessity of being closed to human concerns when exploring the earth.
properties.comments: Linear valley offsetting two segments of the Pacific Antarctic Ridge. Average depth near the central point is about 3000 m.

properties.name: Le Petit Prince
properties.proposer: Louis Geli, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Le Petit Prince is one of Antoine de Saint-Exupery's most famous books. The book, a wonderful travel in a world of poetry, innocence and spirit, is a source of dream for every child from France.
properties.comments: The trace of this fossil fracture zone is visible on a swath profile on crust older than 3 Ma near 6250'S, 15100'W. It is a linear valley that used to offset the axis of the Pacific Antarctic Ridge. The fracture zone disappeared 3 Ma ago, after a clockwi

properties.name: Le Renard
properties.proposer: Louis Geli, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Le Renard is a character of "Le Petit Prince", one of Antoine de Saint-Exupery's most famous book. Le Renard (the fox in French) is the companion of the Small Prince. It symbolizes friendship.
properties.comments: Linear valley offsetting two segments of the Pacific Antarctic Ridge. Depths near the central point range between 3000 and 3500 m.

properties.name: Le Trou sans Fond
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Name taken from the "Carte generale de la Coste de Guinee", compiled by Ing. Ordinaire J. N. Bellin (1746) and reproduced in "Hydrographie Francoise" (1750). First used in the scientific litterature by J. Y. Buchanan, 1887 as "Bottomless Pit".

properties.name: Lena
properties.proposer: O. A. Borschevsky, NIIGA, Russia
properties.history: Named from the Russian icebreaker research vessel "Lena" that discovered this feature when participating in the first Soviet Antarctic IGY Expedition.

properties.name: Lena
properties.proposer: O. A. Borschevsky, NIIGA, Russia
properties.history: Named from the Russian icebreaker research vessel "Lena" that discovered this feature when participating in the First Soviet Antarctic IGY Expedition.

properties.name: Liliuokalani
properties.proposer: Jacqueline Mammerickx, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after Queen Liliuokalani, the last ruling monarch of Hawaii. She resisted heroically the efforts towards annexation. She abdicated on June 24, 1895.
properties.comments: Formerly, Northwest Hawaiian Ridge. Shown as Northwest Hawaiian Ridge in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Lincoln
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the adjacent Port Lincoln, South Australia.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Ceduna".

properties.name: Lindi
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from the nearby Lindi Bay, Tanzania.

properties.name: Litke
properties.proposer: Galina V. Agapova, Geological Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences (GIN RAS)
properties.history: Named after the Russian explorer of the Arctic seas, Academician Admiral F. P. Litke (1797-1882), the founder of the Russian Geographical Society and participant in the round-the-world expedition led by V. M. Golovnin (1817-1819).

properties.name: Litke
properties.proposer: NIIGA, Russia
properties.history: Named after the Russian explorer of the Arctic seas, Academician Admiral F. P. Litke (1797-1882), the founder of the Russian Geographical Society and participant in the round-the-world expedition led by V. M. Golovnin (1817-1819).

properties.name: Little Abaco
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Little Abaco Island, Bahamas.
properties.comments: Also shown on Bathymetric chart of the Blake Escarpment at a Scale of 1:1,000,000, compiled by W. P. Dillon of the U.S. Geological Survey (unpublished).

properties.name: Loiza
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby river of Rio Grande de Loiza, in Puerto Rico, which feeds this feature.

properties.name: Lomonosov
properties.proposer: Mikhail M. Somov, Arctic and Antarctic Research Institute (AANII), Russia
properties.history: Named after the Russian Academician M. V. Lomonosov (1711-1765), who predicted the existence of a rise in the central Arctic. He founded Moscow University.

properties.name: Lomonosov
properties.proposer: Mikhail M. Somov, Arctic and Antarctic Research Institute (AANII), Russia
properties.history: Named after the Russian Academician M. V. Lomonosov (1711-1765), who predicted the existence of a rise in the central Arctic. He founded Moscow University.

properties.name: Lord Howe
properties.history: Named from the nearby Lord Howe Island, Australia.

properties.name: Lord Howe
properties.history: Named from the nearby Lord Howe Island, Australia.

properties.name: Lost Dutchmen
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA; and Rudi Markl, Columbia University, USA
properties.history: Name commemorates at least seven ships of the Dutch East India Company (V.O.C., for "Vereenigde Oostindische Compagnie"), lost, mostly shipwrecked on desolate west coast of Australia before invention of chronometer to establish longitude.
properties.comments: This feature was delineated by SIO's research vessels "Argo" and "Horizon", and Australian vessel HMAS "Gasgoyne".

properties.name: Lowreenne
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS) on behalf of Neville Exon, Australian Geological Survey Organisation (AGSO)
properties.history: Named after an Aboriginal band of south-west tribe, from Low Rocky Point, Tasmania, Australia.
properties.comments: Formerly, Lowreenne Seamounts.

properties.name: Mabahiss
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the Egyptian research vessel "Mabahiss", employed on 1933-1934 John Murray Expedition in the Western Indian Ocean.
properties.comments: This feature was recognized and delineated by SIO's "Argo" and other vessels of the International Indian Ocean Expedition (IIOE) 1960-1965.

properties.name: Macau
properties.proposer: Helenice Vital, Geology and Geophysics Laboratory of Rio Grande do Norte Federal University, Brazil
properties.history: Named from the nearby coastal city of Macau, in the Brazilian State of Rio Grande do Norte. The term Macau originates from the Chinese "A-ma-ngao" which means shelter or port.
properties.comments: This feature has a steepness of 25 to 35. The name first appeared in 2015 in a scientific paper from Almeida, N., Vital, H., and Gomes, M.: "Morphology of submarine canyons along the continental margin of the Potiguar Basin, NE Brazil".

properties.name: Mackenzie
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Mackenzie Bay (Yukon, Canada) in the Beaufort Sea.
properties.comments: Formerly, Mackenzie Canyon. Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Macquarie
properties.proposer: Robin K. H. Falconer, Institute of Geological and Nuclear Sciences (GNS Science), New Zealand
properties.history: Named from the nearby Macquarie Island, Australia.
properties.comments: Formerly, Macquarie Ridge Complex.

properties.name: Madden
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Madden Basin and Madden Canyon, which were named after Admiral Sir Charles Madden (1906-2001), Chief of New Zealand Naval Staff.
properties.comments: This feature is located approximately 60 km E-SE of Cape Turnagain, offshore from the E coast of the North Island of New Zealand. It is the gentle-sided lower part of Madden Canyon that falls as deep as 2000 m. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathy

properties.name: Malaguana-Gadao
properties.proposer: Patricia Fryer, University of Hawaii, USA
properties.history: This name in the Chamorro culture commemorates two legendary Guamian chiefs: Malaguana and Gadao.
properties.comments: The pair was selected in a contest among Micronesian school children.

properties.name: Mameyes
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA; and Advisory Committee on Undersea Features (ACUF) of the U.S. Board on Geographic Names
properties.history: Named from the nearby Rio Mameyes, Puerto Rico.

properties.name: Man
properties.proposer: Galina V. Agapova, Geological Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences (GIN RAS)
properties.history: Named after Captain I. A. Man (1903-1982) who led three Russian Antarctic expeditions at the occasion of the International Geophysical Year (1955-1958).

properties.name: Man of War
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the "Portuguese man of war", a kind of jellyfish which is found in this area.
properties.comments: Taken from Bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetrique de l'est-caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93, compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: Marcus-Wake
properties.proposer: Jacqueline Mammerickx, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.comments: Name given to a group of seamounts between Pigafetta and Ptolemy basins and the Mariana Trench. Shown as Marcus-Wake Seamounts in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Mariana
properties.history: Named from the nearby Mariana Islands.
properties.comments: The Mariana Trench had been known, sounded and explored by several ships, beginning in the 1870s, including HMS Challenger, 1873-1876, for which its deepest pocket, Challenger Deep, is named. Active exploration of Challenger Deep occured in 1959, 1965, 1

properties.name: Marie-Galante
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Caribbean island of Marie-Galante, Guadeloupean archipelago, France.
properties.comments: Taken from Bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetrique de l'est-caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93, compiled by Phillipe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: Mariner
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.comments: Taken from Bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetrique de l'est-caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93, compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: Marquesas
properties.history: Named from the nearby Marquesas Islands, French Polynesia.

properties.name: Mary Celeste
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the American merchant brigantine "Mary Celeste", also known as "mystery ship". Originally named "Amazon" under the British flag. The ship is famous for having been discovered on 5 December 1872 at about 100 nautical miles southwest of Sao Migu
properties.comments: Discovered, mapped, dredged by SIO's research vessel "Argo" (1968) on Circe Expedition 1968-1969.

properties.name: Mason
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Mason Bay on the adjacent Stewart Island / Rakiura. Mason was one of the crew of the "Pegasus" on its first voyage through Foveaux Strait in the early 19th century.
properties.comments: This feature is incised into the outer continental shelf and upper continental slope approximately 30km W of Stewart Island / Rakiura, offshore from the S coast of the South Island of New Zealand. It extends to the flank of Solander Trough. The name firs

properties.name: Matakaoa
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named after the nearby Matakaoa Point at Te Kaha and Tikitiki on the Bay of Plenty, east coast of New Zealand.
properties.comments:
A ridge north from East Cape peninsula. 
Reference: Blackmore and Wright, 1996 ("East Cape" Chart).

properties.name: Matua
properties.proposer: Daniel Scheirer, Brown University, USA
properties.history: "Matua" is the second half of the Pascuense name Hotu Matua who was the legendary Polynesian leader who brought the first settlers to Easter Island. Hotu Ridge is adjacent to Matua Ridge.
properties.comments: 100% multibeam coverage (Seabeam 2000) and GPS navigation.

properties.name: Maurice Hill
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after the British marine geophysicist Maurice N. Hill (1919-1966), at UK's Cambridge University, who planned/led early 1960s cruises in East Africa-Seychelles region.
properties.comments: This feature was discovered during the Lusiad Expedition, 1962-1963. Shown as M. N. Hill Ridge in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Mayor
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Mayor Island ('Tuhua' in Maori), which was named by Capt. Cook in 1769.
properties.comments: This is a NE trending feature, NE of Mayor Island (Tuhua) in outer Bay of Plenty, offshore from the North Island of New Zealand. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Bay of Plenty' in 1989.

properties.name: McArthur
properties.proposer: Albert E. Theberge, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), USA
properties.history: Named after the McArthur family, who has been active in Oregon mapping, surveying and feature nomenclature and terminology since 1850.

properties.name: McArthur
properties.proposer: Albert E. Theberge, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), USA
properties.history: Named after the McArthur family, who has been active in Oregon mapping, surveying and feature nomenclature and terminology since 1850.
properties.comments: Associated features include Astoria Canyon, Luce Ridge and Nehalem Bank.

properties.name: McDonald
properties.proposer: Heinrich Hinze, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby glaciological feature "McDonald Ice Rumple" (of the Brunt Ice Shelf), which was named after Allan McDonald of the British Association of Magallanes, Punta Arenas, Chile.

properties.name: McDougall
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named after John C. McDougall, New Zealand Oceanographic Institute (NOI), member of the Ross Sea and Balleny Islands Expedition in 1965.
properties.comments: This feature is parallel to, and 25 km to the E of, Macquarie Ridge between Macquarie Island and New Zealand. It is bounded to the W by the precipitous flank of Macquarie Ridge and to the E by the gentler flank of a 3400 m deep sill that separates it fro

properties.name: McMaster
properties.proposer: James Robb, U.S. Geological Survey (USGS)
properties.history: Named after Robert L. McMaster (1920-1993), an American marine geologist at the University of Rhode Island. He studied continental margin sediments and structure and submarine canyons. He guided many graduate students who have pursued these interests wor

properties.name: Medvezhy
properties.proposer: Galina V. Agapova, Geological Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences (GIN RAS)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Cape Medvezhy, Novaya Zemlya, Russia.

properties.name: Meihano
properties.proposer: Jean-Luc Sauvage, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Legend tells that young Meihano, after a dispute with his sister, tried to leave his island. At sea, the pirogues capsized and, when Meihano and his people were about to reach the shore, they were all changed into dolphins.

properties.name: Melville
properties.comments: Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Melville
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from U.S. research vessel "Melville", which dredged this huge chasm in 1970-1971, also recognized and mapped by U.S. research vessel "Argo" in 1968.
properties.comments: This feature was discovered by research vessel "Melville" during SIO's Antipode Expedition.

properties.name: Menard
properties.proposer: Jacqueline Mammerickx, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after Henry W. Menard (1920-1986), marine geologist at Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA, pioneer in Pacific Basin exploration.
properties.comments: One of four major fracture zones in South Pacific (others are Heezen, Tharp and Udintsev), named for significant marine geologists.

properties.name: Mendeleev
properties.proposer: Ya. Ya. Gakkel, NIIGA, Russia
properties.history: Named after the pioneer Russian chemist, Dmitry I. Mendeleev (1834-1907), author of the periodic classification of the chemical elements (1869).

properties.name: Mendocino
properties.proposer: Henry W. Menard, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby locality, cape and county of Mendocino, California, USA.
properties.comments: Explored/delineated by SIO's research vessel "Horizon" en route to/from 1950 Midpac Expedition. This feature became the "type locality" for the generic term "Fracture Zone" as recognized and defined by Menard in the 1950s.

properties.name: Meranti
properties.proposer: RAdm Dato' Hanafiah bin Hassan, National Hydrographic Centre (NHC), Malaysia
properties.history: Named from the meranti, a hardwood with soft characteristics. It has a straight grain with few colour variations, blending from reddish to golden brown with grey and yellow highlights. In Malaysia, the meranti is used in a wide variety of applications su
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape and a steepness of 10.

properties.name: Meriadzek
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Meriadzek is the name of an ancient saint of Cornwall, UK.

properties.name: Meteor
properties.history: This name commemorates extensive campaigns of German Research Vessel Meteor, 10-15 years after end of World War I.

properties.name: Mexico
properties.comments: Formerly, Sigsbee Deep.

properties.name: Mid-Adriatic
properties.history: Named for its geographical location in the central part of the Adriatic Sea.

properties.name: Mid-Atlantic
properties.history: Named from its location as this feature crosses the whole central Atlantic Ocean from North to South.

properties.name: Mid-Pacific
properties.proposer: Edwin L. Hamilton, U.S. Navy Electronics Laboratory (USNEL)
properties.history: This feature extends E-W in the central Pacific Ocean.
properties.comments: This very significant assemblage of seamounts and guyots was recognized/mapped/dredged in a joint summer 1950 Mid-Pac Expedition by SIO's R/V "Horizon" and USNEL's EPCE(R) 857. Formerly, Mid-Pacific Mountains or Moonless Mountains. Shown as Mid-Pacific M

properties.name: Middle America
properties.proposer: John G. Heacock, University of Colorado, USA; and J. Lamar Worzel, Columbia University, USA
properties.discoverer: U.S. Navy vessels en route Panama - California, 1920-1950
properties.history: Named from its location in Central America.
properties.comments: This extremely long, exceptionaly deep, seismically-active zone was first mapped in a series of geological-geophysical expeditions aboard SIO R/V "Horizon" (1954) and "Spencer F. Baird" (1953, 1954, 1956), following a 1952 reconnaissance by Fisher aboard

properties.name: Mikhailov
properties.proposer: Vladimir G. Kort, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named after the Russian painter Academician P. N. Mikhailov (1786-1840), participant in the first Russian Antarctic expedition (1820) on ship "Vostok". He prepared excellent detailed illustrations of the Antarctic coasts, which were used in Russian Saili

properties.name: Mikindani
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from the nearby coastal Swahili town of Mikindani in southeastern Tanzania.

properties.name: Minami-Amami
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named after the nearby Amami Oshima Island ("Minami" means "south" in Japanese).
properties.comments: This feature is a linear west-dipping escarpment, defining the western boarder of the Amami Sankaku Basin. Located to the south of Amami Rise.

properties.name: Minami-Okinawa
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Okinawa Island, Japan ("Minami" means "south" in Japanese).
properties.comments: This escarpment is an elongated, curved, steep, west-dipping feature, defining the western boarder of the Oki-Daito Rise.

properties.name: Mississippi
properties.history: Named from the nearby Mississippi River, USA.

properties.name: Mississippi
properties.proposer: Jose Luis Frias Salazar, National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI), Mexico; and Lisa Taylor, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Mississippi River, USA.

properties.name: Mocha
properties.proposer: Hydrographic and Oceanographic Office  of the Chilean Navy (SHOA)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Mocha Island, Chile.

properties.name: Moctezuma
properties.proposer: Jacqueline Mammerickx, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after the Moctezuma Aztec rulers, in nearby Mexico.

properties.name: Moeraki
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with other Moeraki features (Moeraki River, Lake Moeraki, Moeraki Bluffs and Moeraki Hill) on the adjacent New Zealand mainland. Lit. sleepy sky.
properties.comments:
This is the most northern feature in a series of canyons in the area. It is a 5 km wide, 500-800 m incised flat-bottomed canyon running across the continental shelf
and slope offshore from the W coast of the South Island of New Zealand. The name first ap

properties.name: Moeraki
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the land names Moeraki River, Lake Moeraki, Moeraki Bluffs and Moeraki Hill, on the adjacent New Zealand mainland. "Moeraki" translates from Maori to mean "sleepy sky".
properties.comments: This feature is the outer reaches of the Moeraki canyon complex originating off the Moeraki River, West Coast, forming a 5km wide 500-800m incised flat-bottomed canyon running across the continental shelf and slope until merging with the Haast Channel on

properties.name: Mogi
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named after Dr. Akio Mogi who had long worked for the Hydrographic Department of Japan. His research interests were mainly on morphological study of undersea features, including the concerned area (i.e., northern part of the Izu-Ogasawara Trench). This r
properties.comments: This feature is an even-shaped partial cone, located next to the Katsuura Basin, in the Izu-Ogasawara Trench floor. It is probably the deepest known fan in the world.

properties.name: Mokohinau
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Mokohinau Islands. "Mokohinau", a Maori word - "moko": lizard; "hinau": native tree, is also the name of a skink (type of lizard) found on these islands (the correct orthography has a macron on the [i]).
properties.comments: This is a NE trending feature, located in the outer Bay of Plenty region, E-NE of the North Island of New Zealand. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Cuvier' in 1989.

properties.name: Molinos
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Punta de Molinos, on the north west coast of Isla de Culebra, Puerto Rico.

properties.name: Molloy
properties.proposer: Martin Klenke, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named after Arthur E. Molloy, U.S. Navy research scientist who worked in the North Atlantic, North Pacific and Arctic Oceans, 1950-1970s.
properties.comments: Linear escarpment with irregular topography.

properties.name: Molloy
properties.proposer: Martin Klenke, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named after Arthur E. Molloy, U.S. Navy research scientist who worked in the North Atlantic, North Pacific and Arctic Oceans, 1950-1970s.
properties.comments: Irregular group of small elevations between "Spitsbergen Fracture Zone" and "Molloy Fracture Zone".

properties.name: Molokai
properties.proposer: Henry W. Menard, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.discoverer: U.S. research vessels "Horizon" and "Spencer F. Baird"
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of Molokai, Hawaii, USA.
properties.comments: Recognized and mapped by research vessels of the Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA, on California to Hawaii traverses in 1950s and 1960s.

properties.name: Mona
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Mona Island, Puerto Rico.

properties.name: Mona
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Mona Island, Puerto Rico.

properties.name: Monaco
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France; and Portuguese Hydrographic Office (Instituto Hidrografico)
properties.history: Named from the Principality of Monaco. This feature was discovered by Prince Albert 1er of Monaco.
properties.comments: Series of shoals appear on spur, extending SSE from Sao Miguel Island.

properties.name: Monowai
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the HMNZS "Monowai", a hydrographic survey vessel acquired by the Royal New Zealand Navy in 1977. The term Monowai is a compound of the Greek 'mono' (lit. 'one') and the Maori 'wai' (lit. 'water').
properties.comments: This is a rise on the seafloor that is located adjacent to, and S of, Monowai Valley, approximately 1000 km due W of the North Island of New Zealand. The name first appeared on Oceanic Bathymetry Series (OBS) chart 'Bellona' in 1977.

properties.name: Montebello
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Montebello Islands, NW Australia, so named by the Baudin expedition in 1802 after Jean Lannes, duc de Montebello, a successful Napoleonic general who later became a Marshal of France. For many years the name was spelt in two words b
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Cuvier".

properties.name: Montserrat
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby British island of Montserrat in the West Indies.
properties.comments: Taken from bathymrtric chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetrique de l'est-Caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93, compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: Moonless
properties.comments: Shown as Moonless Mountains in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Mor-Bihan
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: "Mor Bihan" means "small sea" in Breton language.

properties.name: Morelli
properties.proposer: Hans Werner Schenke, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named after Prof. Carlo Morelli (1917-2007), an outstanding Earth Scientist and an enthusiastic supporter of GEBCO and Ocean Mapping. He studied in Pisa at the Regia Scuola Normale Superiore where he obtained a degree in Mathematics and in Physics in 194
properties.comments: Elongated feature in E-W direction, with steepness > 27. Discovered during Expedition ANT-XXII/4.

properties.name: Moresby
properties.comments: Formerly, Moresby Channel.

properties.name: Moresby
properties.comments: Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Morgat
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Morgat, on the western coast of Brittany, France.

properties.name: Morozov
properties.proposer: Garrik E. Grikurov, All-Russia Research Institute for Geology and Mineral Resources of the World Ocean (VNIIOkeangeologia)
properties.history: Named after Gennadiy Alekseyevich Morozov (1926-1998), a Russian astronomer and gravimetrician. In 1947-1986 he worked at the North Hydrographic Expedition, in Novaya Zemlya, and took part in Arctic Ocean surveys through participation in 19 air expeditio

properties.name: Morris Jesup
properties.proposer: Marie Tharp and Bruce Heezen, Columbia University, USA
properties.history: Named after Morris Ketchum Jesup, an early-1900s sponsor of Robert Peary's Artic explorations.
properties.comments: Shown as Morris Jesup Rise in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Mossoro
properties.proposer: Helenice Vital, Geology and Geophysics Laboratory of Rio Grande do Norte Federal University, Brazil
properties.history: Named from the nearby city and river of Mossoro, in the Brazilian State of Rio Grande do Norte.
properties.comments: This feature has a sinuous shape and a steepness of more than 50. The name first appeared in 2015 in a scientific paper from Almeida, N., Vital, H., and Gomes, M.: "Morphology of submarine canyons along the continental margin of the Potiguar Basin, NE Br

properties.name: Mozambique
properties.comments: Shown as Natal Basin in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Mozambique
properties.proposer: Eric S. W. Simpson and E. Forder, University of Cape Town, South Africa; and J. K. Mallory, South African Navy Hydrographic Office (SANHO)
properties.history: Named from its geographical position, in the Mozambique Channel and close to the country of Mozambique.

properties.name: Mozambique
properties.proposer: Eric S. W. Simpson, University of Cape Town (UCT), South Africa
properties.history: Named from the nearby country of Mozambique.
properties.comments: Formerly, Mozambique Scarp.

properties.name: Mungo Park
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named after Mungo Park (1771-1806), a Scottish explorer who explored the course of the Niger between 1796 and 1805. This feature is located in the continuation of the Niger Fan.

properties.name: Murimotu
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Murimotu Island, New Zealand.
properties.comments: This feature comprises two narrow valleys on the NE facing continental slope, centred approximately 40 km N of Cape Reinga ('Te Rerengawairua' in Maori) and 70 km E of Manawatawhi / Three Kings Islands, NW of the North Island of New Zealand. The name fir

properties.name: Muroto
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Cape Muroto, Japan.
properties.comments: There is an S-shaped low outer feature on mid-slope.

properties.name: Murray
properties.proposer: Henry W. Menard, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.discoverer: U.S. research vessels "Horizon" and "Spencer F. Baird"
properties.history: Murray was an Admiral in the U.S. Coast & Geodetic Service (C&GS) before WWII.
properties.comments: One of four original fracture zones first studied and recognized by Menard. Others were "Clarion", "Clipperton" and "Mendocino".

properties.name: Murray
properties.comments: Arguably NE extension of Owen Fracture Zone. Southern of the two NE trending ridges bordering De Covilhao Trough.

properties.name: Murray
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Murray River, South Australia. One of a group of canyons named Murray Submarine Canyons by Sprigg (1947). He interpreted from the sparse data available that there were three canyons West, Central and East, and that they connected wi
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Ceduna".

properties.name: Musicians
properties.proposer: Henry W. Menard, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: A group of 25 seamounts in North Central Pacific, named by Menard & Associates after renown musicians of the classic era and contoured at SIO in the late 1950s.
properties.comments: See for comparison "Mathematicians Seamounts" and "Mapmakers Seamounts".

properties.name: Mussau
properties.history: Named from the nearby Mussau Island, the largest island of St. Matthias Islands, Papua New Guinea.

properties.name: Mahia
properties.proposer: A. Haanen, New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Mahia Peninsula, a geographic feature on the nearby mainland of New Zealand. Mahia Peninsula was so named because it resembled a place in the Maori homeland, Hawaiki.
properties.comments: This feature has a sinusoidal shape, with ~5 average slope.

properties.name: Nankai
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the Japanese marine area of Nankai, where this feature is located.
properties.comments: Asymmetrical shallow depression at foot of slope. Taken from Japanese Bathymetric Chart No. 6602. Although this feature is topographically a shallow basin, the long-standing generic term "Trough" is retained.

properties.name: Natal
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Named from the nearby city of Natal, Brazil.
properties.comments: Channel with V and asymmetrical shapes. This feature is located on the northeastern Brazilian continental margin.

properties.name: Natal
properties.history: Named from the nearby South African province of Natal (now merged with the KwaZulu province).

properties.name: Naturaliste
properties.proposer: Rudi Markl, Columbia University, USA
properties.discoverer: Research vessels of the International Indian Ocean Expedition (IIOE)

properties.name: Navarin
properties.proposer: D. E. Gershanovich, Russian Federal Research Institute of Fisheries and Oceanography (VNIRO)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Cape Navarin, Russian Federation.

properties.name: Nazare
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from the nearby Portuguese town of Nazare.

properties.name: Nazca
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA; and E. Schweigger
properties.discoverer: U.S. research vessels "Horizon" and "Spencer F. Baird"
properties.history: Named from the nearby coastal town of Nazca, Peru. This was proposed in IGY General Report No. 2 (1958) by R. L. Fisher.
properties.comments: This huge NE-trending structure was recognized, mapped, dredged on SIO's two-ship IGY Downwind Expedition (research vessels "Spencer F. Baird" and "Horizon") to the Southeast Pacific. Fisher was expedition leader and Schweigger was a senior Peruvian geol

properties.name: Naze
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby city of Naze, Japan.
properties.comments: This is a large broad valley deepening to southwest.

properties.name: Needwonne
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named after an Aboriginal band of south-west tribe, from Cox Bight, Tasmania, Australia.
properties.comments: Northerly trending feature forming westernmost part of western block of South Tasman Rise.

properties.name: Nemilov
properties.proposer: Department of Navigation and Oceanography (DNO), Russia
properties.history: Named after Captain 1st rank Sergey Konstantinovich Nemilov (1922-2008), a Russian Arctic researcher and hydrographer. From 1944 to 1969 he conducted surveys in the White and Barents seas. For many years he led high latitude air expeditions for the USSR

properties.name: Neptune
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Neptune Isles, South Australia.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Ceduna".

properties.name: Neumayer
properties.proposer: Heinrich Hinze, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named from the nearby German research station "Neumayer" at Ekstromisen, which itself was named after Georg Balthasar von Neumayer (1826-1909), German polar research scientist.

properties.name: Neva
properties.proposer: Galina V. Agapova, Geological Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences (GIN RAS)
properties.history: Named from the Russian ship "Neva". She crossed the Atlantic ocean in this area in 1803, during round-the-world expedition.

properties.name: New Caledonia
properties.history: Named after the nearby archipelago of New Caledonia, France.
properties.comments: Taken from New Zealand Oceanographic Institute (NZOI) Misc. Series No. 73.

properties.name: New Guinea
properties.proposer: V. F. Kanaev, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of New Guinea.

properties.name: Ngatoro
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named after the nearby land feature Ngatoro Peak on Whakaari / White Island. Its name in Maori means "resound". Name could be personal and shortened for Ngatoro-i-rangi a tipuna of the Arawa waka where after making landfall at Whangaparaoa, they went nor
properties.comments:
A canyon that lies at the southwestern end of Ngatoro Basin, northwest of Tauranga Trough. 
Reference: Wright, 1989 ("Cuvier" Chart).

properties.name: Ngatoro
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named after the nearby land feature Ngatoro Peak on Whakaari / White Island. Its name in Maori means "resound". Name could be personal and shortened for Ngatoro-i-rangi a tipuna of the Arawa waka where after making landfall at Whangaparaoa, they went nor
properties.comments:
A ridge with three main crests: Waioeka, Waitotahi, and Nukuhou Knolls, aligned NE-SW between the Tauranga Trough to the northwest and White Island Trough to the southeast. 
References: Pantin et al., 1973 (Bay of Plenty Chart) Wright, 1989 (Bay of Plent

properties.name: Nieuw Amsterdam
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: In 1633, Antonio Van Diemen visited the region. He named the northern island after his vessel "Nieuw Amsterdam". This fracture zone passes close to the island (today called "Amsterdam", French overseas territory).

properties.name: Niger
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby delta of Niger River.
properties.comments: Formerly, Niger Cone.

properties.name: Nikolay Dyatel
properties.proposer: Garrik E. Grikurov, All-Russia Research Institute for Geology and Mineral Resources of the World Ocean (VNIIOkeangeologia)
