properties.history: Named after Nikolay Nikolayevich Dyatel (1939-1991), Russian hydrographer at the North Hydrographic Expedition of the Russian Northern Fleet. In 1965-1970 he took part in the hydrographic works of the air expeditions in the Arctic high latitudes and coll

properties.name: Ninene
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named after an Aboriginal band of south-west tribe, from Port Davey, Tasmania, Australia.
properties.comments: This small feature lies immediately east of Needwonne Ridge.

properties.name: Ninetyeast
properties.proposer: Marie Tharp and Bruce Heezen, Columbia University, USA
properties.history: Named from its geographical position around the meridian 90E.
properties.comments: Correct spelling of this name is one word "Ninetyeast". It was coined by Tharp and Heezen when compiling their physiographic diagram of Indian Ocean (early 1960s), based on early indications from RIMS Fisheries cruises and HMS "Challenger" (1951-1952).

properties.name: Nishi-Shichito
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: "Shichito" designates a group of seven islands in this area ("Nishi" means "West" in Japanese).
properties.comments: This is the southern extension of Gengo Seamounts. Taken from Japanese Bathymetric Chart No. 6725. Shown as Nishi Shichito Ridge in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Ninos
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: This feature is named after the three Ninos brothers who sailed with Columbus. Juan Ninos was Christopher Columbus's favourite shipmate during his discovery voyage. He owned and sailed as master of the Nina. His brother, Peralonso Ninos, was the pilot of

properties.name: Noirmoutier
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the island of Noirmoutier, located south of the mouth of Loire River, off the western coast of France, in the Bay of Biscay.

properties.name: North Aegean
properties.proposer: Sevket Gucluer, Department of Navigation, Hydrography and Oceanography, Turkey
properties.history: Named from its geographical position in north Aegean Sea.
properties.comments: The trough runs into Saros Korfezi (Bay). Shown as Anatolian Trough in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: North Bounty
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with the Bounty Islands, which Lieutenant William Bligh named after his ship HMS Bounty.
properties.comments: Adopted from NZGB Gazetteer. This feature is the northernmost of three western tributaries of Bounty Channel, approximately 150 km offshore from the SE coast of the South Island of New Zealand. The name first appeared on Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) c

properties.name: North Brasilian
properties.comments: Shown as Belem Ridge and Parnaiba Ridge in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: North Maria
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Cape Maria van Diemen, New Zealand.
properties.comments: This ridge is one of the northern components of the Maria Ridge. It trends northwest offshore from northern New Zealand on the continental shelf. References: van der Linden, 1968 ("Three Kings" Chart); Mitchell & Eade, 1990 ("Three Kings" Chart).

properties.name: North Norfolk
properties.history: Named from the nearby Norfolk Island, Australia.
properties.comments: Taken from New Zealand Oceanographic Institute (NZOI) Misc. Series No. 73.

properties.name: North Paritu
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named after Paritu Rock which lies just off the adjacent land, New Zealand.
properties.comments: This ridge complex has a NE-SW alignment, separated from the South Paritu Ridge by the Paritu Trough. Reference: Arron & Lewis, 1991 ("Mahia" Chart).

properties.name: North Scotia
properties.history: Named from the Scotia Sea, of which it forms the northern border.
properties.comments: Shown as South Georgia Ridge in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: North Weddell
properties.history: Named after the British sailor, navigator and seal hunter James Weddell (1787-1834), who discovered the Weddell Sea during his Antarctic voyage 1822-1824.
properties.comments: Formerly, America-Antarctic Ridge. Shown as America-Antarctic Ridge in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Northwest Atlantic Mid-Ocean
properties.history: Named from its location in the North-West Atlantic Ocean.
properties.comments: Shown as Northwest Atlantic Mid-Ocean Canyon in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Norwegian
properties.proposer: V. A. Vasnetsov, Floating Marine Scientific Institute (Plavmornin), Russia
properties.history: Named from the nearby country of Norway.
properties.comments: Shown as Norwegian Trench in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Norwegian
properties.history: Named from the nearby country of Norway.

properties.name: Nouadhibou
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby city of Nouadhibou and the cape "Ras Nouadhibou", Mauritania.
properties.comments: Shown as Nouadhibou Canyon in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Nova-Canton
properties.proposer: Jacqueline Mammerickx, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.comments: Formerly, Nova Trough. Shown as Nova Trough in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Novara
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the Austrian research vessel "Novara" (1858-1859).

properties.name: Novaya Zemlya
properties.proposer: Ivan I. Mesyatsev, Floating Marine Scientific Institute (Plavmornin), Russia
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of Novaya Zemlya, Russian Federation.
properties.comments: Shown as East Novaya Zemlya Trough in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: NP-28
properties.proposer: Yngve Kristoffersen, University of Bergen, Norway
properties.history: Russian ice drift station North Pole 28 (NP-28) drifted across the feature in the summer of 1988 and recorded the seismic data that most clearly expresses the existence of the Seachannel.  The name "NP-28" is a tribute to the contribution of Russian ice

properties.name: Nullarbor
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Nullarbor Plain, Southern Australia, the treeless plain that forms the land backing the Great Australian Bight. Also a name of a homestead in that vicinity. So named by the explorer Alfred Delisser in "dog latin": Nulla - No and Arb
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Eyre".

properties.name: Nutibara
properties.proposer: Colombian Hydrographic Office (CIOH)
properties.history: "Nutibara" is an Indian name.

properties.name: Nuyts
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the Nuyts Archipelago, South Australia, so named by M. Flinders in 1802 after the Dutch explorer, diplomat, and politician Pieter Nuyts (1598-1655), who first examined the area in 1627.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Ceduna".

properties.name: Nwayfadh
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Nwayfadh, Western Sahara.

properties.name: Nzima
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: "Nzima" is the name of an ethnic group living in the nearby Ghana and Cote d'Ivoire. This is also the name of their dialect.

properties.name: O'Gorman
properties.proposer: Jacqueline Mammerickx, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.discoverer: Jacqueline Mammerickx, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after the Mexican painter and architect Juan O'Gorman (19051982). He created the mozaics on University of Mexico library. He belonged to the same school of artists as Siqueiro and Orozco.
properties.comments: Formerly, West and East O'Gorman Fractures Zones; combined into one single feature at SCGN/6 (1985). Shown as East O'Gorman Fracture Zone and West O'Gorman Fracture Zone in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Ob'
properties.proposer: Vladimir G. Kort, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named after the Russian research vessel "Ob'" that worked in these waters.
properties.comments: Discovered during the first Soviet Antarctic Expedition.

properties.name: Ob'
properties.proposer: P. L. Bezrukov and V. F. Kanaev, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named after the Russian ship "Ob" which discovered this feature while en route to Antarctica.
properties.comments: Formerly, Ob' Trench.

properties.name: Obruchev
properties.proposer: Gleb B. Udintsev, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named after the Russian geologist, Academician V. A. Obruchev (1863-1956).

properties.name: Oden
properties.proposer: Martin Jakobsson, University of New Hamphire, USA
properties.history: Named from the Swedish icebreaker "Oden" that discovered and mapped this feature during the expedition Arctic Ocean 96, arranged by the Swedish Polar Secretariat.
properties.comments: This is an obvious spur deviating from Lomonosov Ridge.

properties.name: Odet
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby river Odet, which flows through the city of Quimper, Brittany, France.

properties.name: Ogasawara
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of Ogasawara, Japan.
properties.comments: This feature contains one seamount and two knolls. Called Bonin Ridge in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Ogasawara
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of Ogasawara, Japan.

properties.name: Ojirowashi
properties.proposer: Yasuhiko Ohara, Japan Hydrographic and Oceanographic Department (JHOD)
properties.history: "Ojirowashi" is the Japanese term for "white-tailed eagle". A bird is relevant to the name of the nearby Oki-no-Tori Shima Island, which includes a "bird" ("tori", in Japanese) within its name.
properties.comments: Reference: Ohara et al., 2011 "Tectonics of unusual crustal accretion in the Parece Vela Basin, in Y. Ogawa et al.  (eds), Accretionary prisms and convergent margin tectonics in the Northwest Pacific Basin, Modern Approaches in Solid Earth Sciences", 8,

properties.name: Okains
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Okains bay on Banks Peninsula, New Zealand.
properties.comments:
A canyon incised into the continental slope, east of Pegasus Bay, northern Canterbury. 
Reference: Herzer & Carter, 1983 ("Pegasus" Chart).

properties.name: Oki-Daito
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Oki-Daito Island, Japan.
properties.comments: This is an elongated, linear, steep south-dipping feature, located in the northern part of the Philippine Basin.

properties.name: Okinoerabu
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of Okinoerabu, Japan.
properties.comments: This is the largest canyon along island arc. Taken from Japanese Bathymetric Chart No. 6315.

properties.name: Okushiri
properties.proposer: Yasuhiko Ohara, Japan Hydrographic and Oceanographic Department (JHOD)
properties.history: Named from the Japanese island of Okushiri, which is the emerged portion of the ridge.
properties.comments:
Minimum depth is "above sea level" (Okushiri Island).
References: 
Okamura et al., 2002, "Tectonic, geochemical and biological studies in the eastern margin of the Japan Sea: preliminary results of Yokosuka/Shinkai 6500 YK01-06 cruise", JAMSTEC Deep Sea

properties.name: Oleron
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the island of Oleron, located south east of the city of La Rochelle, on the western coast of France.

properties.name: Ometepec
properties.proposer: H. Sandoval and E. Aguayo, Instituto de Ciencias del Mar y Limnologia, UNAM, Mexico
properties.history: Named from the Mexican river "Ometepec", which flows into the head of this feature.
properties.comments: Mapped by R. L. Fisher on SIO's Toro Expedition (U.S. research vessel "Spencer F. Baird") in 1953.

properties.name: Ontong-Java
properties.proposer: Jacqueline Mammerickx, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby atoll of Ontong Java, Solomon Islands.
properties.comments: Formerly, Solomon Rise. Shown as Ontong Java Rise in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Ouessant
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Ushant Island ("Ouessant" in French), located west of Brittany, France.

properties.name: Owashi
properties.proposer: Yasuhiko Ohara, Japan Hydrographic and Oceanographic Department (JHOD)
properties.history: "Owashi" is the Japanese term for "Steller's sea eagle". A bird is relevant to the name of the nearby Oki-no-Tori Shima Island, Japan, which includes a "bird" ("tori" in Japanese) within its name.
properties.comments: Reference: Ohara et al., 2011, "Tectonics of unusual crustal accretion in the Parece Vela Basin", in Y. Ogawa et al. (eds),  "Accretionary prisms and convergent margin tectonics in the Northwest Pacific Basin", Modern  Approaches in Solid Earth Sciences,

properties.name: Owen
properties.proposer: Drummond H. Matthews, King's College, Cambridge, UK
properties.history: Named from the British ship HMS "Owen" that conducted extensive exploration in the northwest Indian Ocean.
properties.comments: Named by U.K. scientists during the International Indian Ocean Expedition (IIOE), 1960-1965. This feature includes Chain Ridge but not Murray Ridge.

properties.name: Pabillo
properties.proposer: Jose Luis Frias Salazar, National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI), Mexico; and Lisa Taylor, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Rio Pabillo, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.name: Pacific-Antarctic
properties.history: Named from its geographical position in the Southern part of the Pacific Ocean, close to Antarctica.

properties.name: Palau
properties.history: Named from the nearby Palau archipelago.
properties.comments: The Palau Trench was well known as a deep "trench" several decades before Research Vessel "Vityaz"'s visit in 1957. This name dates from the 1920s or 1930s.

properties.name: Paoanui
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Paoanui Point on the adjacent New Zealand mainland. Lit. "paoa": smoke; "nui": big.
properties.comments: This NE-SW trending feature is located approximately 80 km offshore from the E coast of the North Island of New Zealand on the lower continental slope. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Turnagain' in 1976.

properties.name: Paoanui
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Paoanui Point on the adjacent New Zealand mainland. Lit. "paoa": smoke; "nui": big.
properties.comments: This NE-SW trending feature is located approximately 70 km offshore from the E coast of the North Island of New Zealand on the middle continental slope. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Turnagain' in 1976.

properties.name: Papagayos
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the bird of same name. Papagayos are true parrots which are common in the Caribbean area and Central America.
properties.comments: Taken from bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetrique de l'Est-Caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93, compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others). Shown as Papagayo Ridge in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Papanui
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Papanui Inlet on the adjacent coast of New Zealand.
properties.comments: This feature is incised into the outer continental shelf and upper continental slope, between 20 km and 35 km offshore from the SE coast of the South Island of New Zealand. A tributary of Saunders Channel. The name first appeared on Coastal Bathymetry Se

properties.name: Parece Vela
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby atoll of Parece Vela, the original name of Oki-no-Tori Shima Island, Japan. "Parece Vela" is the Spanish term for "looks like a sail" (alluding to the original appearance of the reef). The atoll was discovered by the Spanish navigat
properties.comments:
This is the extinct spreading axis of the Parece Vela Basin. The name "Parece Vela Rift" first appeared in Mrozowski et al. (1979), then the feature was described in detail by Okino et al. (1998) and Ohara et al. (2001, 2003, 2011). 
Various surveys were

properties.name: Patia
properties.proposer: Daniel Scheirer, Brown University, USA
properties.history: "Patia" is a Pascuense term for "fork" or "harpoon", so named because this feature has a distinctive split in map view.
properties.comments: 100% multibeam coverage (Seabeam 2000) and GPS navigation.

properties.name: Paul du Chaillu
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named after Paul Belloni du Chaillu (1831-1907), a French-American explorer who explored what is now Gabon between 1856 and 1859.

properties.name: Pearson
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the adjacent Pearson Isles, South Australia.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Ceduna".

properties.name: Pegas
properties.proposer: Aleksandr Svarichevskiy, Pacific Oceanological Institute, Russia
properties.history: Named from the Russian research vessel "Pegas" that discovered this feature.

properties.name: Pegasus
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named after the nearby Pegasus Bay, New Zealand, that is at the head of the canyon.
properties.comments: A major canyon incised into the outer continental shelf and upper continental slope off northern Canterbury. Extends from 40 km northeast of Banks Peninsula, north- eastward to the southern end of the Hikurangi Trough, almost parallel with the northern C

properties.name: Pelsaert
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the adjacent Pelsaert Group of Islands, Western Australia.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Perth".

properties.name: Penhors
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the small village of Penhors, located near the southwestern coast of Brittany, France. It has a well-known chapel.

properties.name: Penmarc'h
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from Penmarc'h Cape (in French: "Pointe de Penmarc'h"), on the southwestern coast of Brittany, France.

properties.name: Perdido
properties.proposer: Jose Luis Frias Salazar, National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI), Mexico; and Lisa Taylor, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Perdido River, Perdido Bay and Perdido Cay, USA.

properties.name: Pernambuco
properties.history: Named from the nearby Brazilian State of Pernambuco.

properties.name: Pernambuco
properties.history: Named from the nearby Brazilian State of Pernambuco.
properties.comments: This is a huge feature. Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Persey
properties.proposer: Ivan I. Mesyatsev, Floating Marine Scientific Institute (Plavmornin), Russia
properties.history: Named from the first Russian research vessel "Persey" (1922-1941). She carried out 84 scientific cruises in the northern seas and sank after being bombed in the Kara Sea.

properties.name: Peru
properties.proposer: Oleg Kriljenko, Peruvian Hydrographic Office (DHN)
properties.discoverer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA; and L. Schwigger
properties.history: Named from the nearby country of Peru.
properties.comments: See also Peru-Chile Trench and Chile Trench.

properties.name: Peru-Chile
properties.history: Named from the nearby countries of Peru and Chile.
properties.comments: This very long trench had been recognized long (50 years) before exploration in detail by SIO's research vessels "Spencer F. Baird" and "Horizon" during the International Geophysical Year (IGY) 1957-1958. The joint (hyphenated) name has been in common us

properties.name: Pervenets
properties.proposer: B. N. Kotenev, Russian Federal Research Institute of Fisheries and Oceanography (VNIRO)
properties.history: Named from the Russian fishery research vessel "Pervenets" that discovered this feature.

properties.name: Petite Sole
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the so-called Sole sea area, off Brittany, France, where this feature is located.
properties.comments: One of the canyons debouching into Petite Sole Valley.

properties.name: Petite Sole
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the so-called Sole sea area, off Brittany, France, where this feature is located.
properties.comments: A segment of a canyon drainage system on the continental slope which joins the Shamrock Valley to the deep sea floor.

properties.name: Petrock
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named after the Cornish saint, St. Petrock, who lived in the Middle Ages.

properties.name: Petrov
properties.proposer: Gleb B. Udintsev, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named after the Russian Academician Boris N. Petrov (1913-1980), specialist in aerospace engineering.

properties.name: Pettersson
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France; and Portuguese Hydrographic Office (Instituto Hidrografico)
properties.history: Named after the Swedish oceanographer Otto Petterson (1848-1941). Teacher in Stockholm, he campaigned in support of the International Council for the Exploration of the Sea (ICES), which he chaired from 1905-1920. He also collaborated with HSH Prince Alb

properties.name: Philippine
properties.history: Named from the nearby country of Philippines.
properties.comments: This major trench was recognized before Emden's 1925 traverse.

properties.name: Pickersgill
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Pickersgill Harbour, a natural harbour on the SW coast of the South Island of New Zealand, which Captain Cook used as an anchorage and named after Richard Pickersgill (1749-1779) of the HMS Resolution.
properties.comments: This is an isolated feature trending NE-SW in Tasman Basin, approximately 380 km S-SW from the SW coast of the South Island of New Zealand. The name first appeared on Oceanic Bathymetry Series (OBS) chart 'Resolution' in 1972.

properties.name: Pico
properties.history: Named from the nearby Pico Island, Azores, Portugal.

properties.name: Pico
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France; and Portuguese Hydrographic Office (Instituto Hidrografico)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Pico Island, Azores, Portugal.

properties.name: Pierre Brazza
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named after Pierre Paul Francois Camille Savorgnan de Brazza (1852-1905), a French explorer who explored what is now Congo and the area in West Africa that is now Gabon, between 1875-1883.

properties.name: Pillsbury
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named from the ship "John Elliott Pillsbury", converted in 1963 as a general oceanographic research vessel by the University of Miami, USA (source: "Oceanographic Vessels of the World", Vol. III, 62.381).
properties.comments: This feature is a component of the Romanche Fracture Zone complex.

properties.name: Pitman
properties.proposer: Steven C. Cande, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA; William F. Haxby, Lamont-Doherty Geological Observatory (L-DGO), Columbia University, USA; and C. Raymond, USA
properties.history: Named after the American geophysicist Walter C. Pitman III (1931-), a pioneer in the theory of seafloor spreading.

properties.name: Pitman
properties.proposer: Steven C. Cande, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA; William F. Haxby, Lamont-Doherty Geological Observatory (L-DGO), Columbia University, USA; and C. Raymond, USA
properties.history: Named after the American geophysicist Walter C. Pitman III (1931-), a pioneer in the theory of seafloor spreading.

properties.name: Pobeda
properties.proposer: A. P. Lisitsyn, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of Pobeda, Antarctica.
properties.comments: Discovered during the first Soviet Antarctic Expedition.

properties.name: Pointe-Noire
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Pointe-Noire, Guadeloupe, France.
properties.comments: Taken from Bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetrique de l'est-Caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93, compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: Polarstern
properties.proposer: Heinrich Hinze, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named from the German research vessel "Polarstern", which carried out research work in the Weddell Sea from her first commissioning in 1982.

properties.name: Pole
properties.proposer: Bruce Heezen, Columbia University, USA
properties.history: Named for its proximity to the North Pole.

properties.name: Ponta do Mel
properties.proposer: Helenice Vital, Geology and Geophysics Laboratory of Rio Grande do Norte Federal University, Brazil
properties.history: Named from the nearby coastal town of Ponta do Mel, in the Brazilian State of Rio Grande do Norte. The name of the town results from its location on a promontory (ponta), and also from the large number of bees living in this area (mel is the Portuguese f
properties.comments: This feature has a steepness of 25 to 35. The name first appeared in 2015 in a scientific paper from Almeida, N., Vital, H., and Gomes, M.: "Morphology of submarine canyons along the continental margin of the Potiguar Basin, NE Brazil".

properties.name: Pornic
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Pornic, located north of "Baie de Bourgneuf", France

properties.name: Porpoise
properties.proposer: Kunio Yashima, Japan Hydrographic and Oceanographic Department (JHOD)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Porpoise Bay, Antarctica.
properties.comments: This is one of the largest canyons in the Wilkes Land Continental Margin.

properties.name: Porthos
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named after Porthos, one of the famous French musketeers, who was born in the nearby land region.

properties.name: Portimao
properties.proposer: Andre Roubertou, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Portuguese port of Portimao.

properties.name: Portlock
properties.history: Named from the nearby Portlock Island, Queensland, Australia.
properties.comments: Adopted from the ACUF Gazetter.

properties.name: Porto
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from the nearby city of Porto, Portugal.

properties.name: Porto do Mangue
properties.proposer: Helenice Vital, Geology and Geophysics Laboratory of Rio Grande do Norte Federal University, Brazil
properties.history: Named from the nearby coastal city of Porto do Mangue, in the Brazilian State of Rio Grande do Norte. Porto is the Portuguese for harbour and mangue that for mangrove.
properties.comments: This feature has a steepness of 25 to 35. The name first appeared in 2015 in a scientific paper from Almeida, N., Vital, H., and Gomes, M.: "Morphology of submarine canyons along the continental margin of the Potiguar Basin, NE Brazil".

properties.name: Pribilof
properties.proposer: B. N. Kotenev, Russian Federal Research Institute of Fisheries and Oceanography (VNIRO)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Pribilof Islands (USA). The islands themselves were named after the Russian navigator Gerasim L. Pribylov (?-1796), who discovered them in 1778.
properties.comments: Formerly, Pribylov Canyon.

properties.name: Prince Edward
properties.proposer: Marie Tharp and Bruce Heezen, Columbia University, USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby small volcanic island of Prince Edward. This name appeared on Heezen-Tharp province chart "Indian Ocean physiographic diagram".
properties.comments: Trend of this feature perceived in 1950s; mapped in 1970s by the South Africa's research vessels "RSA" and "Agulhas".

properties.name: Princesse Alice
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France; and Portuguese Hydrographic Office (Instituto Hidrografico)
properties.history: Named after Prince Albert I of Monaco's second ship "Princesse Alice" that discovered this feature.
properties.comments: This is an extensive feature; and deeper than usual "bank".

properties.name: Providencia
properties.proposer: Colombian Hydrographic Office (CIOH)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Providencia Island, Colombia.
properties.comments: Shown as San Andres Trough in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Puerto Rico
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of Puerto Rico (also called Porto Rico).
properties.comments: This trench, under this name, was explored and sounded by submarines making gravity studies in the 1930s, well before USS San Pablo operations.

properties.name: Pukapuka
properties.comments: Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Pukekura
properties.proposer: Mark Dyer, New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB); and Adam Greenland, New Zealand Hydrographic Office (LINZ)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Taiaroa Hill, which was originally called "Pukekura", meaning "red hill" in Maori language. Formerly, Taiaroa Canyon.
properties.comments: This feature is an E-W aligned canyon incised into the outer continental shelf, off Otago Peninsula, on the SE coast of the South Island of New Zealand. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart "Oamaru" in 1981.

properties.name: Pukeroro
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Pukeroro (hill) on the adjacent New Zealand mainland. Lit. "puke": hill; "roro": a mountain tree or the front end of a building.
properties.comments: This NE-SW trending feature is located on the lower continental shelf approximately 50 km offshore from the SE coast of the North Island of New Zealand. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Palliser' in 1988.

properties.name: Pukeroro
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history:
Named in association with Pukeroro (hill) on the adjacent New Zealand mainland.
Lit. "puke": hill; "roro": a mountain tree or the front end of a building.
properties.comments: This NE-SW trending feature is located on the lower continental shelf offshore from the SE coast of the North Island of New Zealand. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Palliser' in 1988.

properties.name: Puketuroto / Hoopers
properties.proposer: Mark Dyer, New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB); and Adam Greenland, New Zealand Hydrographic Office (LINZ)
properties.history: Named from the nearby bay and locality of Hoopers Inlet ("Puketuroto" in Maori language - "puke": hill; "tu": to stand; "roto": inland or lake), New Zealand. Dual name adopted by the New Zealand Geographic Board in 2014.
properties.comments: This feature forms at the confluence of several canyons at the foot of the steep upper continental slope, 70 km SE of Otago Peninsula and SE of the South Island of New Zealand. The name first appeared on Oceanic Bathymetry Series (OBS) chart 'Otago' in 1

properties.name: Puketuroto / Hoopers
properties.proposer: Mark Dyer, New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB); and Adam Greenland, New Zealand Hydrographic Office (LINZ)
properties.discoverer: New Zealand hydrographic survey vessel HMNZS "Lachlan"
properties.history: Named from the nearby bay and locality of Hoopers Inlet ("Puketuroto" in Maori language - "puke": hill; "tu": to stand; "roto": inland or lake), New Zealand. Dual name adopted by the New Zealand Geographic Board in 2014.
properties.comments:
This is a short feature that leads from the Otago shelf into the centre channel of Bounty Trough, to the SE of the South Island of New Zealand. The name first 
appeared on Oceanic Bathymetry    Series (OBS) chart 'Otago' in 1969.

properties.name: Pushcharovsky
properties.proposer: Geological Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences (GINRAS)
properties.history: Named after Professor Yurii Mikhailovich Pushcharovsky (1916-2018), a Russian Doctor of Geological and Mineralogical Sciences, and Academician of the Russian Academy of Sciences (RAS). From the early 1970s, he studied tectonics, magmatism, structural dev

properties.name: Puysegur
properties.proposer: Robin K. H. Falconer, Institute of Geological and Nuclear Sciences (GNS Science), New Zealand
properties.history: Named from the nearby Puysegur Point, on the Southwestern extremity of New Zealand.
properties.comments: Formerly, Puysegur Trough.

properties.name: Pahaoa
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Pahaoa (locality) and Pahaoa River on the adjacent New Zealand mainland. "Pahaoa": lit. a fortified village that has been surrounded or besieged. Note: there is a macron on the 1st "a".
properties.comments: This feature, slightly more than 50% beyond NZ's 12NM territorial limit, is located offshore from the SE coast of the North Island of New Zealand. It is incised into the outer continental shelf and continental slope, and is slightly expanded at its upper

properties.name: Porangahau
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Porangahau (locality), Porangahau River and Porangahau Stream on the adjacent New Zealand mainland. Lit. "po": night; "rangahau": pursuit. The inhabitants of Heretaunga once had to make a retreat from their enemies at this place
properties.comments: This NE-SW trending feature is located approximately 80 km offshore from the E coast of the North Island of New Zealand on the lower continental slope. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Turnagain' in 1976.

properties.name: Porangahau
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Porangahau (locality), Porangahau River and Porangahau Stream on the adjacent New Zealand mainland. Lit. "po": night; "rangahau": pursuit. The inhabitants of Heretaunga once had to make a retreat from their enemies at this place
properties.comments: This feature forms a flat-floored area at the lower end of Madden Canyon, on the lower continental slope, located approximately 70 km offshore from the E coast of the North Island of New Zealand. The name First appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (C

properties.name: Pukaki
properties.proposer: Mark Dyer, New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB); and Adam Greenland, New Zealand Hydrographic Office (LINZ)
properties.history: Named from the New Zealand vessel HMNZS "Pukaki", which did research in this area (the correct orthography has macrons on the [u], [a] and [i]).
properties.comments:
This feature is located 
offshore Banks Peninsula, on the central E coast of the South Island of New Zealand. It trends generally northwards from Mernoo Gap towards the S end of Hikurangi Trough where it joins Pegasus Canyon. The name first appeared on N

properties.name: Pukaki
properties.history: Named after the nearby Pukaki Bank, itself named from the New Zealand HMNZS "Pukaki" that surveyed the bank in 1950 (the correct orthography has macrons on the [u], [a] and [i]).
properties.comments: Shown on NIWA 1:1,000,000 "Bounty" sheet. Incised into the northern margin of the Campbell Plateau.

properties.name: Quebrada
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: This feature on the East Pacific Rise was discovered and delineated on 1969 Quebrada Expedition' research vessel "Spencer F. Baird", of the Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA.

properties.name: Quiberon
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Quiberon, on the south coast of Brittany, France.

properties.name: Quitasueno
properties.proposer: Colombian Hydrographic Office (CIOH)
properties.history: "Quitasueno" is an Indian name.

properties.name: Rael Kedam
properties.proposer: David K. Idip, Jr., Territory and Boundary Task Force, Office of the President, Republic of Palau
properties.history: Named from the namesake land feature Rael Kedam Ridge, which runs along the nearby island of Babeldaob, the largest island in the Palau archipelago.
properties.comments: This feature has a rather elongated shape.

properties.name: Raicho
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: "Raicho" is the Japanese term for "snow grouse" (Ptarmigan). A bird is relevant to the name of the nearby Oki-no-Tori Shima Island, Japan, which includes a "bird" ("tori", in Japanese) within its name.
properties.comments: Various surveys were conducted by Japanese survey vessels "Takuyo" and "Shoyo" from October 1993 to December 2005.

properties.name: Raitt
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after Russell W. Raitt (1907-1995), SIO marine seismologist and a major figure in development and shipboard employment of seismic methods to study entire crust. From 1949 to 1985, he undertook extensive and classic studies in Indian Ocean and the e

properties.name: Rakitu
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Rakitu Island, New Zealand. "Rakitu" is the Maori name for "Arid Island", so named by Capt. Cook on his impression of the soil.
properties.comments: This ESE-trending canyon leads to the Colville Ridge.  References: Carter, 1976 ("Cuvier" Chart); Wright, 1989 ("Cuvier" Chart).

properties.name: Randall
properties.proposer: Harley D. Nygren, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), USA
properties.discoverer: U.S. research vessels of the Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO)
properties.history: This name commemorates four members of the Randall family who have made many valuable contributions to the Mapping, Charting and Surveying Community. They all were cartographers and lexicologists in several United States civilian or military agencies in
properties.comments: Shown as Randall Seamount Group in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Rangi
properties.proposer: Daniel Scheirer, Brown University, USA
properties.history: "Rangi" is the Pascuense term for "sky". Several volcanoes in this feature have star-like radial patterns/structures.
properties.comments: 100% multibeam coverage (Seabeam 2000) and GPS navigation.

properties.name: Rano Rahi
properties.proposer: Daniel Scheirer, Brown University, USA
properties.history: "Rano Rahi" is the Pascuense term for "many peaks" or "many volcanoes".
properties.comments: Collective name for the undersea volcanoes found within this area. 100% multibeam coverage (Seabeam 2000) and GPS navigation.

properties.name: Rapuhia
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the New Zealand research vessel (DSIR) "Rapuhia", 1986-1992.
properties.comments:
Adopted from NZGB Gazetteer. This is a NW-SE trending continuous 
precipitous feature, on the E margin of Hikurangi Plateau, approximately 330 km NE of the most E part of the North Island of New Zealand. Its general trend deepens towards the NW as it lea

properties.name: Rassokho
properties.proposer: Department of Navigation and Oceanography (DNO), Russia
properties.history: Named after Admiral Anatoliy Ivanovich Rassokho (1914-2003), chief of the Head Department of Navigation and Oceanography of the Russian Federation Ministry of Defense. For his active participation in the creation of the Atlas of the Oceans as deputy mana
properties.comments: These are three isolated seamounts in the east sector of Gakkel Ridge. They are separated from each other by saddles with depths of 2649 and 3020 meters.

properties.name: Real
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Named from the nearby Real river and the city of Rio Real, in the Brazilian Bahia State.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape and a steepness of 4 to 10. It is the continuity on the seafloor of Real river on the continent. The canyon is known since the 1970's and has been mentioned in many scientific papers and publications. Ref. REMAC Projec

properties.name: Redonda
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of Redonda which belongs to Antigua and Barbuda, in the West Indies.
properties.comments: Taken from Bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetrique de l'est-Caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93, compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: Researcher
properties.proposer: Bastiaan J. Collette, Utrecht University, Netherlands
properties.history: Named from the U.S. research vessel "Researcher" that discovered this feature in 1971.

properties.name: Resolution
properties.comments: Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Rigault de Genouilly
properties.history: Named after the French Admiral Rigault de Genouilly (1807-1873) who became Minister of the Navy.
properties.comments: Two features lie on this ridge (Ari'i Moana Guyot and Punu Taipu Guyot).

properties.name: Riiser-Larsen
properties.proposer: Heinrich Hinze, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Riiser-Larsen Ice Shelf.

properties.name: Ritchie
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named after Rear Admiral G.S. Ritchie (1914-2012), Commanding Officer of New Zealand HMNZS "Lachlan" from 1954-57.
properties.comments: A ridge that lies east of the North and South Ritchie Troughs. This ridge has an almost direct N-S alignment and extends from a knoll-like crest in the north to Ritchie Banks in the south. Reference: Arron & Lewis, 1992 ("Mahia" Chart).

properties.name: Rochebonne
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Rochebonne is the name of rocky highs of the Armorican continental plateau and located 40 km SW of the city of Les Sables d'Olonne, France.

properties.name: Rockall
properties.history: Named from the nearby rocky islet of Rockall.

properties.name: Rockall
properties.history: Named from the nearby rocky islet of Rockall.

properties.name: Roncador
properties.proposer: Colombian Hydrographic Office (CIOH)
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Roncador Bank.

properties.name: Roncador
properties.proposer: Colombian Hydrographic Office (CIOH)
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Roncador Bank.

properties.name: Ronne
properties.proposer: Heinrich Hinze, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby "Ronne Ice Shelf", which itself was named after Edith Ronne, wife of Finn Ronne, exploration leader in this region 1947-1948.

properties.name: Roo
properties.proposer: Marie Tharp, Columbia University, USA
properties.history: This feature, in generalized form, appears on the Heezen/Tharp "Physiographic Diagram on the Indian Ocean" (Geol. Soc. Amer. 1965). There the name was placed by Marie Tharp in memory of the "Winnie the Pooh" personage.

properties.name: Ruatoria
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in associaiton with Ruatoria (locality) on the adjacent mainland of New Zealand. Ruatoria translates as 'the burial place of the chief, Toria.
properties.comments: This name was recorded in peer reviewed scientific journals in 1996 and 1998; subsequently in common use. Adopted from NZGB Gazetteer.

properties.name: Runaway
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Cape Runaway on the adjacent New Zealand mainland, which was named by Capt. Cook in 1769 after Maori in canoes, who had approached Cook's ship in a hostile way, hurried away after shots were fired at them.
properties.comments: This feature is a N-S trending downslope break off the shelf edge, located in the outer Bay of Plenty region, offshore from the E coast of the North Island of New Zealand. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Bay of Plenty

properties.name: Ruru
properties.proposer: Daniel Scheirer, Brown University, USA
properties.history: "Ruru" is a Pascuense term for "shake". There was a teleseismically detected earthquake swarm very near this feature.
properties.comments: 100% multibeam coverage (Seabeam 2000) and GPS navigation.

properties.name: Ryabov
properties.proposer: Garrik E. Grikurov, All-Russia Research Institute for Geology and Mineral Resources of the World Ocean (VNIIOkeangeologia)
properties.history: Named after Vsevolod Alekseyevich Ryabov (1927-1981), a Russian engineer in gravimetry at the North Hydrographic Expedition. He took part in many air expeditions in the high latitudes at the Northern Fleet Hydrographic Service and contributed greatly to

properties.name: Ryan
properties.proposer: James Robb, U.S. Geological Survey (USGS)
properties.history: Named after William B. F. Ryan, (1939-), a marine geologist and senior research geologist at the Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory (L-DEO) and adjunct professor of earth and environmental sciences at Columbia University; an authority on mid-ocean ridges,

properties.name: Re
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the island of Re, located a few kilometres west of La Rochelle, on the west coast of France.

properties.name: Reinga
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Cape Reinga (locality) and Cape Reinga / Te Rerenga Wairua on the adjacent New Zealand mainland. Lit. leaping place, where the spirits depart for the afterlife. There is a macron on the "e".
properties.comments: This NW-SE trending feature extends from 200 km to 400 km NW of Cape Reinga / Te Rerenga Wairua, located between the S end of Norfolk Ridge and South Maria Ridge. The name first appeared on Oceanic Bathymetry Series (OBS) chart 'Three Kings' in 1968.

properties.name: Saba
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Saba Island, Netherlands.
properties.comments: Taken from a bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetrique de l'est-Caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93, compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: Sables-d'Olonne
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of "Les Sables-d'Olonne", located on the Atlantic coast of France, NW of the city of La Rochelle.

properties.name: Sadko
properties.proposer: Galina V. Agapova, Geological Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences (GIN RAS)
properties.history: Named from the Russian research vessel "Sadko" (1930-1935), of the Polar Floating Research Institute (PFRI) and that discovered this feature.
properties.comments: This feature is a shallow linear depression extending from the base of the continental slope to Shakin Hill at the south-east end of Gakkel Ridge. Its topography may suggest "Seachannel" but there are no levees obvious even in this sedimented region.

properties.name: Sagittarius
properties.comments: Formerly, Sagittarius Channel.

properties.name: Sagres
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from the Portuguese town of Sagres, a major locality in the history of exploration where Henry the Navigator had his "school".

properties.name: Saharan
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Saharan Seamounts.

properties.name: Sahul
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Sahul Shelf.

properties.name: Saikaido
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: "Saikaido" is the old name of the nearby island of Kyushu, Japan.

properties.name: Saint-Exupery
properties.proposer: Louis Geli, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named after Antoine de Saint-Exupery (1900-1944), French writer and aviator. His life was a permanent search for the human soul and his writings, mostly related to his experience as an aircraft pilot, influenced and inspired many young people, not only i
properties.comments: Linear valley offsetting two segments of the Pacific Antarctic Ridge. Average depth near the central point is about 3000 m.

properties.name: Saint-Nazaire
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the city of Saint-Nazaire, located on the mouth of Loire River, on the western coast of France.

properties.name: Salas y Gomez
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher and Dale C. Krause, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.discoverer: U.S. research vessels "Horizon" and "Spencer F. Baird"
properties.history: Named after a Spanish pilot, Jose Salas Valdes, who discovered the islet on 23 August 1793. Subsequently, 18/19 October 1805, this island was discovered again by the Spanish navigator Jose Manuel Gomez.
properties.comments: Linear chain of connected seamounts with one emergent peak, the islet Sala y Gomez [Chile: uninhabited].

properties.name: Salvador Correia
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from three Portuguese Hydrographic Survey Ships, with name "Salvador Correia".

properties.name: San Agustin
properties.proposer: Colombian Hydrographic Office (CIOH)
properties.history: Name given by the Spanish to one of the main Colombian indigenous groups, which was located in the South of the country, in the central chain of mountains.

properties.name: San Juan
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby city of San Juan, Puerto Rico.
properties.comments: This feature is right of the coast from San Juan.

properties.name: San Salvador
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby San Salvador Island, Bahamas.

properties.name: SANAE
properties.history: Named from the nearby South African research station SANAE (South African National Antarctic Expedition).

properties.name: Santa Maria
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France; and Portuguese Hydrographic Office (Instituto Hidrografico)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Santa Maria Island (Eastern Azores Group), Portugal.
properties.comments: These are minor elevations, with one "seamount" (1000-1100 m) on small rise of intermediate depth (about 1600 m). Named by Laughton et al. 1975.

properties.name: Santos
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Named from its geographical location, on the sedimentary basin of the nearby Brazilian city of Santos, in the State of Sao Paulo.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated and meandered shape.It is described as an along-isobath channel situated in the transition from the middle to the lower slope (Duarte & Viana, 2016).

properties.name: Sardino-Balearic
properties.history: Named from the nearby islands of Sardinia (Italy) and Baleares (Spain).

properties.name: Saunders
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Cape Saunders on the adjacent New Zealand mainland, which was named in 1770 by Captain Cook in honour of Admiral Sir Charles Saunders who commanded the fleet in which Cook served at the capture of Quebec in 1759, and who became
properties.comments: This feature is located offshore from the SE coast of the South Island of New Zealand. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Otago' in 1969.

properties.name: Saunders
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Cape Saunders on the adjacent New Zealand mainland, which was named in 1770 by Captain Cook in honour of Admiral Sir Charles Saunders who commanded the fleet in which Cook served at the capture of Quebec in 1759, and who became
properties.comments: This feature is aligned E-W and located offshore from the SE coast of the South Island of New Zealand. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Otago' in 1986.

properties.name: Saya de Malha
properties.history: The bank was named by Portuguese explorers 500 years ago, who encountered the bank on the voyage between the Cape of Good Hope and India.
properties.comments: This feature is the largest submerged bank in the world.

properties.name: Sculpin
properties.proposer: Jacqueline Mammerickx, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the fish of same name. Sculpins are numerous in this area.

properties.name: Seal
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Seal Bay, South Australia.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Ceduna".

properties.name: Sealark
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the British vessel HMS "Sealark" (Captain Boyle Somerville) that carried out Percy Sladen Trust investigations of northwest Indian ocean coral atolls and banks, about 1905.

properties.name: Sechosech
properties.proposer: David K. Idip Jr. and Takamatsu Emesiochel, Territory and Boundary Task Force, Office of the President, Republic of Palau
properties.history: "Sechosech" is the Palauan name for the White Tern, which is a seabird that can be found throughout Palau and the region.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape.

properties.name: Seelig
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Probably named after Walter Roy Seelig (1920-2005), who was the National Science Foundation Representative in Christchurch during eleven United States Antarctic Research Program austral deployments between 1971 and 1986. In 1964-65 he was scientific coor
properties.comments: This feature is located in the Southern Ocean, southeast of Buckle Island, Balleny Islands. The name first appeared on Island Bathymetry Series (IBS) chart 'Buckle Island' in 1969.

properties.name: Sein
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the island of Sein, located west of Brittany, France.

properties.name: Sen'ko
properties.proposer: Garrik E. Grikurov, All-Russia Research Institute for Geology and Mineral Resources of the World Ocean (VNIIOkeangeologia)
properties.history: Named after Pavel Kononovich Sen'ko (1916-2000). He participated in many Russian arctic expeditions and air expeditions in the high latitudes. He took part in the "Sever-2" expedition, which resulted in his name appearing in the Guinness Book of Records.

properties.name: Senchura
properties.proposer: Department of Navigation and Oceanography (DNO), Russia
properties.history: Named after Captain 1st rank Leonid Ivanovich Senchura (1919-2008), a Russian hydrographer. From 1941 to 1966, he was involved in planning researches in the Arctic ocean for the Northern hydrographic expedition. He developed new methods of research and l

properties.name: Setubal
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from the nearby port and bay of Setubal, Portugal.

properties.name: Shackleton
properties.history: Named after Sir Ernest Shackleton (1874-1922), arguably the greatest British Antarctic Explorer of all time.

properties.name: Shamrock
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from HMS "Shamrock", British research / hydrographic vessel.
properties.comments: Intermediate section of the Shamrock Canyon/Shamrock Seachannel system.

properties.name: Shamrock
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from HMS "Shamrock", British research / hydrographic vessel.
properties.comments: This feature includes Shamrock Valley.

properties.name: Shatsky
properties.proposer: Gleb B. Udintsev, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named after the Russian geologist and tectonicist, Academician N. S. Shatsky (1895-1960).

properties.name: Shenhu
properties.proposer:
Guangzhou Marine Geological 
Survey, China
properties.history: Named from the nearby Shenhu Shoal.
properties.comments: This feature consists of 16 canyons, the largest one being 38 km long and 8 km wide, with relief of 245 m. Production of natural gas hydrate was successfully tested in this area by China Geological Survey in 2017. The name Shenhu Shoal has been in use by

properties.name: Shichito-Iojima
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: "Shichito" designates a group of seven islands in this area. "Iojima" means "Island of Io," "Io" being a nearby island and "Jima" the Japanese term for "island".
properties.comments: This feature contains 15 seamounts, 5 knolls and 3 banks. Shown as Iwo Jima Ridge in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Shichiyo
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: "Shichiyo" is the Japanese term for "seven days of the week".

properties.name: Shinjuboshi
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Shinjuboshi Seamount. "Shinjuboshi" is the Japanese term for the Spica, the brightest star in the Virgo, in one of the Japanese dialects.

properties.name: Shio-No-Misaki
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named after the nearby Cape Shio-No-Misaki.
properties.comments: Relief (at four locations): 200 m, 500 m, 300 m, and 400 m. Poorly defined in deeper section. Taken from Japanese Bathymetric Chart No. 6602.

properties.name: Shirshov
properties.proposer: Gleb B. Udintsev, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named after the Russian hydrobiologist, Academician P. P. Shirshov (1905-1953).

properties.name: Shmakov
properties.proposer: Garrik E. Grikurov, All-Russia Research Institute for Geology and Mineral Resources of the World Ocean (VNIIOkeangeologia)
properties.history: Named after Konstantin Andreyevich Shmakov (1929-1993), Russian astronomer with the North Hydrographic Expedition. From 1964, he carried out astronomic referencing of hydrographic and gravimetric works, as part of air expeditions in high latitudes, thus
properties.comments: This is a major feature, steep and sinuous.

properties.name: SHOM
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France; and Portuguese Hydrographic Office (Instituto Hidrografico)
properties.history: Named from the French Hydrographic Office (in French: "Service Hydrographique et Oceanographique de la Marine", abbreviated as SHOM) that carried out detailed surveys of the Azores region.

properties.name: Sierra Leone
properties.history: Named from the nearby country of Sierra Leone.

properties.name: Siqueiros
properties.proposer: Henry W. Menard, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after the Mexican artist David Alfaro Siqueiros (1896-1974).

properties.name: Skiros
properties.proposer: Sevket Gucluer, Department of Navigation, Hydrography and Oceanography, Turkey
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of Skiros (also, Skyros), Greece.
properties.comments: Formerly, North Skiros Basin.

properties.name: Skosyrev
properties.proposer: Garrik E. Grikurov, All-Russia Research Institute for Geology and Mineral Resources of the World Ocean (VNIIOkeangeologia)
properties.history: Named after Rear Admiral Nikolay Vasil'yevich Skosyrev (1910-1985), Russian hydrographer. In 1932-1939 he took part in hydrographic expeditions in the Arctic Ocean. During WWII, he led the Hydrographic Service and, in 1947-1967, he was Chief of the North

properties.name: Smith
properties.proposer: Advisory Committee on Undersea Features (ACUF), of the Board on Geographic Names, USA
properties.history: Named after Rear Admiral Paul A. Smith (?-1978) of the United States Coast and Geodetic Survey (C&GS), a pioneer bathymetrist, being the first to contour the slopes of Bogoslof Island. He published "Atlantic Submarine Valleys" with A. C. Veatch in 1939,
properties.comments: This feature has an average steepness of 4%. It is located in the northern Gulf of Alaska.

properties.name: Smith
properties.proposer: Albert E. Theberge, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), USA
properties.history: Named after Rear Admiral Paul A. Smith (?-1978) of the United States Coast and Geodetic Survey (C&GS), a pioneer bathymetrist, being the first to contour the slopes of Bogoslof Island. He published "Atlantic Submarine Valleys" with A. C. Veatch in 1939,
properties.comments: This feature has a steepness ranging from 25% to 50%. It is located in the northern Gulf of Alaska.

properties.name: Soeboshi
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from its geographical location, to the northeast of Soeboshi Seamount. "Soeboshi" is one of the Japanese dialect names that means Alcor, which is close to the Mizar of the Big Dipper.
properties.comments: This feature is interpreted as resulting from a rifting of the proto Kyushu-Palau Ridge. The single position is that of the shallowest point. All undersea features around the Kyushu-Palau Ridge are named after stars and planets.

properties.name: Sofu
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: "Sofu" means "widow" in Japanese.
properties.comments: The borders of this depression are irregular in shape and depth. Taken from Japanese Bathymetric Chart No. 6725.

properties.name: Sombrero
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Sombrero Island, British overseas territory of Anguilla.
properties.comments: Taken from Bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetrique de l'est-Caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93, compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: Sonja
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the tender "Sonja" to German research vessel "Sonne".
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Cuvier".

properties.name: Sonne
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the German research vessel "Sonne" that surveyed this feature.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Cuvier".

properties.name: Sorlingues
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Scilly Islands, UK ("Iles Sorlingues" in French).

properties.name: South Bounty
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with the Bounty Islands, which Lieutenant William Bligh named after his ship HMS "Bounty".
properties.comments:
Adopted from NZGB Gazetteer. This feature is the southernmost of three W tributaries of Bounty Channel, approximately 150 km offshore from 
the SE coast of the South Island of New Zealand. The name first appeared on Oceanic Bathymetry Series (OBS) chart

properties.name: South New Hebrides
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA; and Harry H. Hess, Princeton University, USA
properties.history: Named from its geographical position, on the south of New Hebrides (now, Vanuatu).
properties.comments: Delineated in 1962 by U.S. research vessel "Spencer F. Baird", Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), Proa Expedition. Shown as New Hebrides Trench in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: South Norfolk
properties.history: Named from the nearby Norfolk Island, Australia.
properties.comments: Taken from New Zealand Oceanographic Institute (NZOI) Misc. Series No. 73. Shown as Gazelle Basin in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: South Orkney
properties.proposer: A. F. Treshnikov, Arctic and Antarctic Research Institute (AANII), Russia
properties.history: Named from the nearby South Orkney Islands.
properties.comments: Feature labeled incorrectly as "Orkney Deep" on GEBCO 5.16 and 5.18.

properties.name: South Paritu
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the nearby land feature Paritu (misc. place), New Zealand.
properties.comments: An undersea ridge south of the head of the Paritu Trough that is aligned NE-SW. Reference: Arron & Lewis, 1991 ("Mahia" Chart).

properties.name: South Sandwich
properties.history: Named from the adjacent South Sandwich Islands, UK.

properties.name: South Sandwich
properties.history: Named from the adjacent South Sandwich Islands, UK.

properties.name: South Scotia
properties.history: Named from the Scotia Sea, of which it forms the southern border.
properties.comments: Formerly, Scotia Ridge.

properties.name: South Shetland
properties.history: Named from the adjacent South Shetland Islands.
properties.comments: Formerly, South Shetland Trench.

properties.name: South Tasman
properties.history: Named from its geographical position, south of Tasmania, Australia.

properties.name: South Tasman
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from its association with the South Tasman Rise.

properties.name: Southeast Indian
properties.history: Named from its geographical position, in the southeastern part of the Indian Ocean.

properties.name: Southwest Indian
properties.history: Named from its location in the southwestern part of the Indian Ocean.

properties.name: Southwest Pacific
properties.proposer: Robin K. H. Falconer, Institute of Geological and Nuclear Sciences (GNS Science), New Zealand
properties.history: Named from its geographical position, in the southwestern part of the Pacific Ocean.
properties.comments: Formerly, Southwestern Pacific Basin.

properties.name: Spencer
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Spencer Gulf, so named by M. Flinders in 1802 in honour of the respectable noble man George Spencer, 4th Duke of Marlborough (1739-1817), who presided at the Board of Admiralty when the voyage was planned and the ship
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Ceduna".

properties.name: Spiess
properties.proposer: Peter Lonsdale, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after Dr. Fred N. Spiess (1919-2006), whose first geophysical research took place in this area.

properties.name: Spinola
properties.comments: Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Spitsbergen
properties.proposer: Martin Klenke, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named from the nearby Spitsbergen archipelago, Norway.

properties.name: Spitsbergen
properties.proposer: Martin Klenke, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named from the nearby Spitsbergen archipelago, Norway.

properties.name: Sprigg
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named after Reginald (Reg) C. Sprigg (1919-1994), geologist with the South Australian Geological Survey.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Ceduna".

properties.name: St. Anna
properties.proposer: Ivan I. Mesyatsev, Floating Marine Scientific Institute (Plavmornin), Russia
properties.history: Named from the Russian vessel "Svyataya Anna" ("St. Anna" in Russian) that got stuck in the ice in the Kara Sea, during the Russian expedition (1912-1914), under G. L. Brusilov.
properties.comments: Formerly, Svyataya Anna Trough.

properties.name: St. Barthelemy
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby St. Barthelemy Island, France.
properties.comments: Taken from Bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetrique de l'est-Caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document NO.93. Compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: St. Croix
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of St. Croix, U.S. Virgin Islands.
properties.comments: Taken from Bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetrique de l'est-Caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document NO.93. Compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others). Shown as Saint Croix Ridge in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: St. Geran
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the "St Geran", the most famous ship in history of nearby Mauritius which, whilst bringing colonists, was shipwrecked in 1744 on fringing reef of island's east coast. "St Geran", with 110 crew and colonists aboard and cargo of iron sugar cauld

properties.name: St. Helena
properties.history: Named from the nearby St. Helena Island, UK.

properties.name: St. Kitts
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of St. Kitts, in the West Indies.
properties.comments: Taken from Bathymetric Chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetrique de l'est-caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93, compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others). Shown as Saint Kitts Valley in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: St. Peter
properties.proposer: Galina V. Agapova, Geological Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences (GIN RAS)
properties.history: Named from the Spanish ship "St. Peter" that investigated the area near "St. Paul Islands", together with ship "St. Paul", in the XVIth century.

properties.name: Strakhov
properties.proposer: Galina V. Agapova, Geological Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences (GIN RAS)
properties.history: Named after the Russian academician Nicolai M. Strakhov (1907-1978), lithologist, founder of the Russian school of marine sedimentology; also from the research vessel "Akademik N. Strakhov" that explored and mapped this feature.
properties.comments: Also known as Four North Fracture Zone (due to its location on the parallel 4N).

properties.name: Stromboli
properties.history: Named from the nearby island and volcano of Stromboli, Italy.
properties.comments: Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Subantarctic
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.comments: This feature extends from the eastern end of the Chatham Rise, south-westwards for 1200 km to the southern end of the Campbell Plateau. It is the south-eastern boundary of the New Zealand Plateau and part of the western boundary of the Southwest Pacific

properties.name: Sue
properties.proposer: Colombian Hydrographic Office (CIOH)
properties.history: "Sue" is an Indian name, which was assigned to the sun by the major indigenous group Chibcha.

properties.name: Sunda
properties.history: Named from the nearby Sunda islands and Sunda Strait, Indonesia.
properties.comments: This feature was studied in some detail in 1920s-1930s by Dutch geodesist F. A. Vening Meinesz, who made classic pendulum gravity measurements in a Dutch submarine. Shown as Java Trench in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Supan
properties.proposer: Jorn Hatzky, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named after Alexander Supan (1847-1920), a marine cartographer and longtime publisher of the scientific journal "Petermanns Geographische Mitteilungen". He was involved in the foundation of GEBCO and was the first to introduce the naming convention curre

properties.name: Suruga
properties.proposer: Kunio Yashima, Japan Hydrographic and Oceanographic Department (JHOD)
properties.history: Named from the historical name - Suruga - of a local Japanese province.
properties.comments: This feature is a long depression located at the boundary between the Philippine Sea and Eurasia Plates.

properties.name: Svendsen
properties.proposer: Thomas J. Osborne, AT&T Submarine Systems, USA
properties.history: Named after Carl Svendsen, a retired U.S. mariner and survey engineer with AT&T, who surveyed many routes for submarine cable systems.

properties.name: Sverdrup
properties.history: Named after Harald Ulrik Sverdrup (1888 - 1957), a Norwegian oceanographer and meteorologist who made a number of important theoretical discoveries in these fields. He was director of the Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO, USA) from 1936 to 1948.
properties.comments: This feature was mapped in 2017 with multibeam system by the Argentinian research vessel "Ara Austral".

properties.name: Swan
properties.proposer: Jose Luis Frias Salazar, National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI), Mexico; and Lisa Taylor, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Swan Islands, off the coast of Honduras.

properties.name: Sao Francisco
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Named from the nearby Sao Francisco river, on the continent. This name is well known since the 70's and has been mentioned in many scientific papers and publications, for instance in "REMAC Project - Geomorphology of the Brazilian Continental Margin and
properties.comments: This is an elongated and meandered feature.

properties.name: Sao Gabriel
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from one of Vasco da Gama's ship.

properties.name: Sao Miguel
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France; and Portuguese Hydrographic Office (Instituto Hidrografico)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Sao Miguel Island, Azores, Portugal.
properties.comments: This is a small feature, well-bounded. Name taken from Searle R. 1980: "Tectonic pattern of the Azores spreading centre and triple junction", Earth and Planetary Science Letters, 51:415-434 (fig.1, p. 416).

properties.name: Sao Paulo
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Sao Paulo Plateau, over which this feature is located.
properties.comments: This feature is linear with an elongated shape. The name has been in use since the 1970s and mentioned in many scientific papers and publications, for instance the REMAC Project - Geomorphology of the Brazilian Continental Margin and adjacent oceanic are

properties.name: Sao Paulo
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Sao Paulo Plateau, of which this feature is the marginal escarpment.
properties.comments: This feature is characteristically linear, with an elongated shape. The name has been in use since the 1970s and mentioned in many scientific papers and publications, for instance for the REMAC Project - Geomorphology of the Brazilian Continental Margin

properties.name: Sao Pedro
properties.proposer: Andre Roubertou, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby coastal town of Sao Pedro de Muelo, Portugal.

properties.name: Sao Rafael
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from one of Vasco da Gama's ships.

properties.name: Sao Tome
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Named from its geographic location, on the shelf break in front of Sao Tome Cape, a peninsula in the north of Rio de Janeiro State, Brazil. This feature was formed by accumulation of sediments from the Paraiba do Sul River.
