properties.comments: This feature has a sinuous shape. It has been mentioned in many scientific papers, publications and studies on the Brazilian continental margin, such as Viana et al (2002), Schereiner et al (2008), and Almeida & Kowsmann (2014).

properties.name: Sao Vicente
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from the nearby Cape St. Vincent ("Cabo de Sao Vicente" in Portuguese), the southwesternmost point in Portugal.

properties.name: Tabajara
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history:
Tabajara is known as a historic indigenous group that lived in coastal areas of the Northeast of Brazil.
The Tabajara group originated as a subdivision of the Tupi people. This is a historical classification for indigenous groups which demonstrated a rec
properties.comments: This feature has been mentioned in many scientific papers, publications and studies on the Brazilian continental margin, such as Schereiner et al (2008), and Almeida & Kowsmann (2014).

properties.name: Tabou
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Tabou River, in Cote d'Ivoire.

properties.name: Tadjura
properties.history: Named from the nearby town and gulf of Tadjura (or Tadjoura), Djibouti.
properties.comments: Located in the west end of the Gulf of Aden. Shown as Tadjoura Trough in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Taieri
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Taieri River on the adjacent New Zealand mainland. "Taieri" can translate to mean "shining river" or "to smash or pulp", or it may also derive from "Makotaieri", lit. an edible fish that occurs locally.
properties.comments: This feature trends NW-SE on the upper continental slope 40 km south of Otago Peninsula, and offshore from the SE coast of the South Island of New Zealand. It is one of the tributaries of Bounty Sea Channel. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymet

properties.name: Taieri
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Taieri River on the adjacent New Zealand mainland. "Taieri" can translate to mean "shining river" or "to smash or pulp", or it may also derive from "Makotaieri", lit. an edible fish that occurs locally.
properties.comments: This feature trends NW-SE on the lower continental slope, SW of Otago Peninsula, and offshore from the SE coast of the South Island of New Zealand. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Otago' in 1986.

properties.name: Taipaka
properties.proposer: Daniel Scheirer, Brown University, USA
properties.history: "Taipaka" is a Pascuense term for "calm seas".
properties.comments: 100% multibeam coverage (Seabeam 2000) and GPS navigation.

properties.name: Taitimu / Caswell
properties.proposer: Mark Dyer, New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB); and Adam Greenland, New Zealand Hydrographic Office (LINZ)
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Caswell Sound ("Taitimu" in Maori language - "tai": tide; "timu": to ebb). Dual name adopted by the New Zealand Geographic Board in 2014. Caswell Sound was probably named after the British Captain George Caswell, who
properties.comments: This flat topped and oblong feature is a large N-S trending ridge that is the westward border of Fiordland Basin, to the SW of New Zealand's South Island. The name first appeared on Oceanic Bathymetry Series (OBS) chart 'Resolution' in 1972.

properties.name: Tamoio
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Tamoio refers to an individual of the Tupinambas indigenous group that occupied coastal areas from the North of Sao Paulo State to Cabo Frio city, in the Rio de Janeiro State, and Vale do Paraiba region, Southeast of Brazil. Tamoio is a word from the Tup
properties.comments: This feature has been mentioned in many scientific papers, publications and studies on the Brazilian continental margin, such as Schereiner et al (2008), and Almeida & Kowsmann (2014).

properties.name: Tancho
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: "Tancho" is the Japanese term for "crane". A bird is relevant to the name of the nearby Oki-no-Tori Shima Island, which includes a "bird" ("tori", in Japanese) within its name.
properties.comments: Various surveys were conducted by Japanese survey vessels "Takuyo" and "Shoyo" from October 1993 to December 2005.

properties.name: Tane-Yaku
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby islands of Tane and Yaku, Japan.
properties.comments: This is a south extension of Kyushu. Taken from Japanese Bathymetric Chart No. 6725.

properties.name: Tanoudert
properties.proposer: Olivier Parvillers, French Hydrographic Office (SHOM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Tanoudert, in Mauritania.

properties.name: Tasman
properties.proposer: Neville Exon, Australian Geological Survey Organisation (AGSO)
properties.history: Named after the Dutch explorer Abel Janszoon Tasman (1603-1699), who discovered Tasmania and New Zealand in 1642.

properties.name: Tataweka
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the smaller, "Tataweka", of two islands at the entrance to Manaia Harbour, an inlet on the western coast of Coromandel Peninsula, New Zealand.
properties.comments: Incised into the outer continental shelf approximately 90 km NW of Great Barrier Island. Reference: Wright, 1999 ("Cuvier" Chart).

properties.name: Tauranga
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Name from the city of Tauranga on the adjacent mainland, New Zealand. Lit. sheltered anchorage or landing place for canoes.
properties.comments: This north trending feature forms an extension further to the SW of the Tauranga Canyon. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Bay of Plenty' in 1973.

properties.name: Tauranga
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Name from the city of Tauranga on the adjacent mainland, New Zealand. Lit. sheltered anchorage or landing place for canoes.
properties.comments: This narrow NE-trending feature is located in the outer Bay of Plenty area. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Bay of Plenty' in 1973.

properties.name: Taurus
properties.comments: Formerly, Taurus Channel.

properties.name: Tayrona
properties.proposer: Colombian Hydrographic Office (CIOH)
properties.history: "Tayrona" is an Indian name.

properties.name: Te Motu-o-Kura
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Motuokura (island), New Zealand. Literally "te": the; "motu": island; "o": of/belonging to; "Kura": personal name.
properties.comments: This feature trends NE-SW and is located approximately 80 km NE of Cape Turnagain, offshore from the E coast of the North Island of New Zealand. It was first depicted on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Turnagain' in 2002.

properties.name: Tehuantepec
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the Tehuantepec Gulf and the city of Tehuantepec, Mexico. This pre-Colombian name designated the place where the Tepehuanos people lived.
properties.comments: Formerly, Tehuantepec Ridge. Recognized and delineated by SIO's Research Vessel "Spencer F. Baird" in 1956.

properties.name: Temimino
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Temimino refers to an individual of the indigenous group Temiminos, that occupied coastal areas of the Brazilian States of Rio de Janeiro and Espirito Santo. Temimino is a word from the Tupi indigenous language that means descendant. The Temiminos were c
properties.comments: This feature has been mentioned in many scientific papers, publications and studies on the Brazilian continental margin, such as Schereiner et al (2008), and Almeida & Kowsmann (2014).

properties.name: Tenkai
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from its geographical location, between Tennosei Seamount and Kaiosei Seamount. "Tenkai" is a blend word of "Tennosei" and "Kaiosei". "Tennosei" and "Kaiosei" mean Uranus and Neptune in Japanese, respectively.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated and curved shape. It is interpreted as resulting from a rifting of the proto Kyushu-Palau Ridge. All undersea features around the Kyushu-Palau Ridge are named after stars and planets. The single position is that of the shall

properties.name: Tenmei
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: "Tenmei" designates an era of the Japan history.

properties.name: Tenryu
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Tenryu River, in Japan.
properties.comments: Relief: 400-300-700-1200 m down Canyon; constant deepening to south. Taken from Japanese Bathymetric Chart No. 6602. Shown as Tenryu Canyon in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Ter Tholen
properties.proposer: Daniel Scheirer, Brown University, USA
properties.history: Named from the vessel "Ter Tholen" that accompanied the "Zeewolf" (name also used for an adjacent Fracture Zone) on a 1617-1618 Dutch voyage which, independently, discovered Amsterdam and St. Paul Islands.

properties.name: Terror
properties.proposer: Steven C. Cande, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: "Terror" was the name of the second vessel of the Ross Expedition, which explored these waters in the 1840s. She sailed with Capt. James Ross to Antarctica in 1839-1843 and with Sir John Franklin to the Arctic in 1846-1848, then being abandoned in the ic

properties.name: Tetyaev
properties.proposer: All-Russia Research Institute for Geology and Mineral Resources of the World Ocean (VNIIOkeangeologia) and NPO Severomorgeologiya, Russia
properties.discoverer: Russian research vessels "Pavel Bashmakov" and "Geolog Dmitriy Nalivkin"
properties.history: Named after M. M. Tetyaev (1882-1956), one of the founders of the Russian tectonic school.

properties.name: Tharp
properties.proposer: Jacqueline Mammerickx, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after the American geologist and oceanographic cartographer Marie Tharp (1920-2006) who, in partnership with Bruce Heezen, created the first scientific map of the entire ocean floor. Tharp's work revealed the presence of the Mid-Atlantic Ridge, cau
properties.comments: This is one of four major fracture zones in South Pacific (others are Heezen, Menard, Udintsev) named for significant marine geologists.

properties.name: Three Kings
properties.history: Named from the nearby Three Kings Islands ("Eyland Drie Coningen" in Dutch language), New Zealand, so named by Abel Tasman who sighted them in 1643 during the season of Epiphany, which celebrates the three magi or kings worshipping the infant Jesus.

properties.name: Tierra del Fuego
properties.proposer: Walter Reynoso-Peralta, GEBCO/Nippon Foundation Training Program Alumni
properties.history: Named from the nearby Isla Grande de Tierra del Fuego, on the southernmost extremity of the American continent.
properties.comments: Feature protruding from the continental shelf with general orientation NW-SE and steepness of approx. 65 on the western side and of 45 on the eastern side.

properties.name: Timor
properties.history: Named from the nearby Timor Island.

properties.name: Tintamarre
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby small island of Tintamarre, part of the French overseas collectivity of Saint Martin.
properties.comments: Taken from Bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetrique de l'est-Caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93, compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: Tokara
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Tokara Island, Japan.
properties.comments: This feature is broad and deepens throughout. Taken from Japanese Bathymetric Chart No. 6725.

properties.name: Toki
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: "Toki" is the Japanese term for "crested ibis". A bird is relevant to the name of the nearby Oki-no-Tori Shima Island, which includes a "bird" ("tori", in Japanese) within its name.
properties.comments: Various surveys were conducted by Japanese survey vessels "Takuyo" and "Shoyo" from October 1993 to December 2005.

properties.name: Toki
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: "Toki" means "winter season" in Japanese. This feature includes names relating to the winter season, such as Shosetsu Seamount, Koshogatsu Seamount, Shogatsu Seamount, Yabuiri Seamount, Toji Seamount, Daikan Seamount and Shokan Seamount.

properties.name: Tonbi
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Cape Tonbi, Japan.
properties.comments: This is a small depression.

properties.name: Tonga
properties.history: Named from the nearby Tonga Archipelago.

properties.name: Tonga
properties.history: Named from the nearby Tonga Archipelago.
properties.comments: Deep water south and east of the Tonga Islands has been known since the 1880s. This area has been studied by ships of Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), commencing with research vessels "Horizon" and "Spencer F. Baird" in 1952. This is the site o

properties.name: Toogee
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named after an Aboriginal tribe of south-west Tasmania, Australia.
properties.comments: This feature is a well-defined NE/SW trending ridge, south-west of Tasmania.

properties.name: Topgallant
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the adjacent Topgallant Islands, South Australia.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Ceduna".

properties.name: Tore
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named from the geometric description of the feature (ring-shaped).
properties.comments: Shown as Tore Seamount in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Toroko
properties.proposer: Daniel Scheirer, Brown University, USA
properties.history: "Toroko" is the Pascuense term for "wild grasses", which is the dominant flora on Easter Island.
properties.comments: 100% multibeam coverage (Seabeam 2000) and GPS navigation.

properties.name: Tortola
properties.proposer: Philippe Bouysse, French geological survey (BRGM)
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of Tortola, British Virgin Islands.
properties.comments: Taken from Bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetrique de l'est-Caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93, compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: Toyama
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby city of Toyama, on the central west coast of Honshu Island, Japan.
properties.comments: This seachannel is a prominent bathymetric feature that extends from Toyama Bay for 750 km through Toyama Trough to Yamato Basin and Japan Basin. It is fed with sediment from the 3000 m high Japan Alps. The gradient of the seachannel changes at 3840'N wh

properties.name: Trident
properties.proposer: Anthony S. Laughton, Institute of Oceanographic Sciences (IOS), UK
properties.comments: Series of elevations (800-400-300-1400 m) in an E-W direction. Low ridge. Ref: Laughton A. S. et al, 1975, Mid-Atlantic Ridge to South West of Europe, Sheet 3 (Scale 1:2,400,000 at 41N), C6568.

properties.name: Trindade
properties.history: Named from the nearby Brazilian island of Trindade.
properties.comments: Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer. Also known as Columbia Channel.

properties.name: Tristan da Cunha
properties.history: Named from the nearby British archipelago of Tristan da Cunha.

properties.name: Trobriand
properties.history: Named from the nearby Papua New Guinean archipelago of Trobriand, itself named after Denis de Trobriand, first lieutenant of the French explorer Bruni d'Entrecasteaux, onboard the French ship "L'Esperance" in 1793.
properties.comments: Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Tugela
properties.history: Named from the nearby Tugela River, in KwaZulu-Natal Province, South Africa.

properties.name: Tulum
properties.proposer: Jose Luis Frias Salazar, National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI), Mexico; and Lisa Taylor, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: "Tulum" is the name of local Mayan ruins, in the Yucatan Peninsula, Mexico.

properties.name: Tunebos
properties.proposer: Colombian Hydrographic Office (CIOH)
properties.history: "Tunebos" is an Indian name.

properties.name: Tupinamba
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Tupinamba refers to all Brazilian indigenous groups that spoke variations of the Tupi language during the first stages of the Brazilian colonization period in the 16th century and lived in coastal areas. For many years they were considered extinct, howev
properties.comments: This feature has been mentioned in many scientific papers, publications and studies on the Brazilian continental margin, such as Schereiner et al (2008), and Almeida & Kowsmann (2014).

properties.name: Tupiniquim
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Tupiniquim refers to a Brazilian indigenous group that belongs to the Tupi Nation (Indigenous people that spoke the Tupi language and lived in the Brazilian coast in the 16th century). They were the first indigenous group that the Portuguese colonizers m
properties.comments: This feature has been mentioned in many scientific papers, publications and studies on the Brazilian continental margin, such as Schereiner et al (2008), and Almeida & Kowsmann (2014).

properties.name: Turnagain
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the nearby land feature Cape Turagain, New Zealand.
properties.comments: On the upper continental slope from 25 km to 30 km SSE of Cape Turnagain, southern Hawkes Bay land District. Trends generally obliquely to the regional slope. References: Pantin, 1963 ("Turnagain" Chart); Lewis, 1976 ("Turnagain" Chart).

properties.name: Turanganui
properties.history: Turanganui is an indigenous Maori word meaning literally 'great standing'. It is a shortened version of the Maori name (Turanganui-a-Kiwa) for the area of the associated land feature, Gisborne, New Zealand.
properties.comments: This is a large feature trending W-E offshore from Gisborne on the east coast of the North Island of New Zealand. Adopted from the NZGB Gazetteer.

properties.name: Uchupi
properties.proposer: James Robb, U.S. Geological Survey (USGS)
properties.history: Named after Elazar Uchupi, (1928-), a geologist at the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (WHOI). He created the first comprehensive bathymetric contour map of the US Atlantic continental margin in 1965 and has conducted extensive marine geological res

properties.name: Udintsev
properties.proposer: Jacqueline Mammerickx, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after the Russian marine scientist Gleb Udintsev (1923-), from the Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Science, a leading specialist in geomorphology and tectonics of Ocean floor. He participated in more than 50 sea expeditions such a
properties.comments: One of four major fracture zones (others are Heezen, Menard and Tharp) in South Pacific, named after significant marine geologists.

properties.name: Uek
properties.proposer: David K. Idip Jr. and Takamatsu Emesiochel, Territory and Boundary Task Force, Office of the President, Republic of Palau
properties.history: "Uek" is the Palauan name for the Purple Swamphen, which can be found throughout Palau.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape.

properties.name: Ulerratel
properties.proposer: David K. Idip Jr. and Takamatsu Emesiochel, Territory and Boundary Task Force, Office of the President, Republic of Palau
properties.history: "Ulerratel" is the Palauan name for the Slaty-Legged Crake, which can be found throughout Palau.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape.

properties.name: Uljin
properties.proposer: Korea Committee on Geographical Names (KCGN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Uljin county (Uljin-gun in Korean) in Republic of Korea.
properties.comments: This feature has a V-shape and a steepness of 2 to 7.

properties.name: Ulsan
properties.proposer: Korea Committee on Marine Geographical Names (KCMGN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Ulsan Hang (Ulsan harbour), Republic of Korea.
properties.comments: This feature is located about 55 km east of Ulsan harbour, starting from the coast of the Korean peninsula. The estuarine appearance of the feature on the continental shelf gradually becomes a relatively narrow depression with steep sides and a substanti

properties.name: Umnak
properties.history: Named after the nearby island of Umnak, one of the Fox Islands of the Aleutian Islands, Alaska, USA.

properties.name: Umvoto
properties.proposer: Christopher J. H. Hartnady, University of Cape Town (UCT), South Africa
properties.history: Named from a Xhosa woman's "respect" or "avoidance" name for water.

properties.name: Uruti
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from Uruti Point on the adjacent New Zealand mainland. Lit. "uru": grove; "ti": cabbage tree. There is a macron on the "i".
properties.comments: This NE-SW trending feature on the continental slope, is located 40 km offshore from the SE coast of the North Island of New Zealand. The crest is generally between 900m and 1100 m deep. The ridge defines the seaward edge of Uruti Basin. The name first a

properties.name: Usan
properties.proposer: Korea Committee on Marine Geographical Names (KCMGN)
properties.history: "Usan" is the ancient name of the nearby Ulleung Do (Ulleung Island, Republic of Korea), prior to the 5th Century of the Common Era.
properties.comments: This is an elongated feature on the southern part of Ulleung Plateau. It lies East-West, with a summit of irregular topographic relief.

properties.name: Usan
properties.proposer: Korea Committee on Marine Geographical Names (KCMGN)
properties.history: "Usan" was the name of the nearby Ulleung Do (Ulleung Island, Republic of Korea), before the 5th century.
properties.comments: This feature is an elongated depression characterized by a flat bottom with steep sides. It divides the Korea Plateau into two area: Gangwon Plateau and Ulleung Plateau.

properties.name: Usan
properties.proposer: Korea Committee on Marine Geographical Names (KCMGN)
properties.history: "Usan" was the name of the nearby Ulleung Do (Ulleung Island, Republic of Korea), before the 5th century.
properties.comments: This feature has a steep slope. It is located on the western edge of the Ulleung Plateau.

properties.name: Uyeda
properties.proposer: N. Christian Smoot, U.S. Naval Oceanographic Office (NAVOCEANO)
properties.history: Named after Dr. Seiya Uyeda (1929-), a Japanese geophysicist, Professor Emeritus at the Earthquake Research Institute, University of Tokyo; Director of the International Frontier Research Group on Earthquakes, of RIKEN (Institute of Physical and Chemical

properties.name: Valdivia
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named after the Spanish conquistador Pedro Gutierrez de Valdivia (1497-1553) and the nearby Valdivia River.

properties.name: Valencia
properties.history: Named from the nearby city and province of Valencia, Spain.

properties.name: Valle-Inclan
properties.proposer: Jean-Rene Vanney, University of Paris IV, France
properties.history: Named after the Spanish/Galician dramatist and novelist Ramon Maria del Valle-Inclan y de la Pena (1866-1936).

properties.name: Vaza-Barris
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Named from the nearby Vaza-Barris river, which crosses Bahia State and reach out the Atlantic ocean in Sergipe State, Brazil.
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated and meandered shape, and a steepness of 5 to 10. It is the continuity on the seafloor of Vaza-Barris river on the continent. It is formed of several minor canyons running into the main one. The group of canyons is known sinc

properties.name: Vema
properties.history: Named from the U.S. research vessel "Vema", with the Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory (L-DEO), Columbia University, USA, from 1951 to 1980s.
properties.comments: Formerly, Vema Channel.

properties.name: Vema
properties.history: Named from the U.S. research vessel "Vema", with the Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory (L-DEO), Columbia University, USA, from 1951 to 1980s.

properties.name: Vema
properties.proposer: Bruce Heezen and John E. Nafe, Columbia University, USA
properties.history: Named from the U.S. research vessel "Vema", research ship of the Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory, Columbia University, NY, from 1951 to 1980s, and that discovered this feature in 1958.
properties.comments: This name, early given quite loosely, actually designates a fracture zone on the Central Indian Ridge. However, there already is a Vema Fracture Zone in the North Atlantic, so this traditional name has been retained.

properties.name: Vening Meinesz
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.discoverer: Research vessels of the International Indian Ocean Expedition (IIOE)
properties.history: Named after Felix A. Vening Meinesz (1887-1966), pioneer Dutch geodesist who conducted pendulum gravity measurements throughout the Indonesian region on Dutch submarines in the 1920s-1030s. Delineated by ships of the International Indian Ocean Expedition
properties.comments: The group is distinct from Shcherbakov Seamount, 1055'S - 10440'E.

properties.name: Vernadsky
properties.proposer: V. N. Syrskiy, MGI, Russia
properties.history: Named after the Russian geochemist, Academician V. I. Vernadsky (1863-1945), and the Russian research vessel "Akademik Vernadsky" that explored this feature.

properties.name: Viaud
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named after Gustave Viaud (1838-1865), older brother and sometime inspiration of "Pierre Loti" (Louis marie Julien Viaud), who was buried at sea near there in March 1865.

properties.name: Victor Hensen
properties.proposer: Werner Hieke, University of Munich, Germany
properties.history: Named from the German research vessel "Victor Hensen", Bremerhaven, Germany, that discovered this feature.

properties.name: Victoria
properties.proposer: Jacqueline Mammerickx, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.discoverer: Roger Larson and Thomas Chase, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the ship "Victoria", one of originally five ships of Magellan's fleet, the only one to complete the 1519-1522 circumnavigation.

properties.name: Vieux-Fort
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Vieux-Fort, Guadeloupe Island, France.
properties.comments: Taken from Bathymetric chart entitled: "Esquisse Bathymetrique de l'est-Caraibe, 1984" (accompanying BRGM Document No.93, compiled by Philippe Bouysse and others).

properties.name: Vinogradov
properties.proposer: Gleb B. Udintsev, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named after the Russian geochemist, Academician A. P. Vinogradov. He was Director of the the Vernadsky Institute of Geochemistry of the USSR Academy of Sciences.

properties.name: Virgin Islands
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA; and Advisory Committee on Undersea Features (ACUF) of the U.S. Board on Geographic Names
properties.history: Named from the nearby U.S. Virgin Islands.

properties.name: Visscher
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from Frans Jacobszoon Visscher, chief pilot of Tasman's vessels "Heemskerck" and "Zeehan", 1642-43.
properties.comments:
Located on the New Zealand continental slope, from 60 km to 120 km off northwestern Nelson land District. 
References: van der Linden, 1966 ("Egmont" Chart); Baldwin & Lewis, 1991 ("Cook" Chart).

properties.name: Vityaz
properties.proposer: V. F. Kanaev, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named from the Russian research vessel "Vityaz" that explored this feature.

properties.name: Vityaz
properties.proposer: Gleb B. Udintsev, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named from the Russian research vessel "Vityaz" that discovered this feature.

properties.name: Vityaz
properties.proposer: Gleb B. Udintsev, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named from the Russian research vessel "Vityaz" that discovered and explored this feature.

properties.name: Vitoria
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Named from the nearby city of Vitoria, capital of the Brazilian State of Espirito Santo.
properties.comments: This feature has a sinuous shape. It has been mentioned in studies on the Brazilian continental margin, such as Schereiner et al (2009).

properties.name: Vitoria-Trindade
properties.proposer: Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation (DHN), Brazil
properties.history: Named from its geographical position, between the city of Vitoria, capital of the state of Espirito Santo, and the island of Trindade, Brazil.
properties.comments: Formerly, Vitoria-Trindade Seamounts.

properties.name: Vlamingh
properties.proposer: Daniel Scheirer, Brown University, USA
properties.history: Named after Willem de Vlamingh (1640-1698), Senior Commander of the 1696-1697 Dutch expedition to this area. He was also Captain of "Geelvinck" which name has been given to an adjacent Fracture Zone.

properties.name: Voronin
properties.proposer: Nikolay N. Zubov, Floating Marine Scientific Institute (Plavmornin), Russia
properties.history: Named after V.I. Voronin (1890-1952), captain of the Russian ice-breaker fleet.

properties.name: Waiatoto
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the nearby New Zealand land features Waiatoto (place), Waiatoto Lagoon, Waiatoto River, Waiatoto Saddle.
properties.comments: A canyon originating off the Waiatoto River, West Coast, wandering along the Westland shelf until it merges into Milford Basin and then onto the Haast Channel. References: NIWA Chart Misc. Series No. 91; Beggs et al. 2006; Neil 2008.

properties.name: Waiatoto
properties.proposer: Mark Dyer, New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB); and Adam Greenland, New Zealand Hydrographic Office (LINZ)
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Waiatoto Canyon with which the feature has geomorphological kinship. "Waiatoto" is a Maori word - "wai": water; "a": of; "toto": blood. Formerly, Haast Channel.
properties.comments: This feature is on the outer reaches of the complex beyond Milford Basin to the SW of the South Island of New Zealand. It continues north-westwards after merging with Moeraki Channel complex at around 4330'S, 16630'E in 4100 metres of water. The name fir

properties.name: Wairaka
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Wairaka Statue (site) on the adjacent mainland. Wairaka saved the canoe Mataatua from being swept away on the tide when it arrived from Hawaiki, the ancestral homeland of Maori.
properties.comments: This feature, aligned NE-SW, lies E of Ngatoro Ridge, offshore from the E coast of the North Island of New Zealand. It crests at 1400 m at its S end. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS) chart 'Bay of Plenty' in 1989.

properties.name: Waitaki
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Waitaki River on the adjacent New Zealand mainland. Lit. "wai": river, "taki" (tangi): noisy or weeping.
properties.comments: This feature trends NW-SE on the continental shelf and upper continental slope, SW of Banks Peninsula and offshore from the E coast of the South Island of New Zealand. It has narrow and steep sides. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series

properties.name: Waitaki
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Waitaki River on the adjacent New Zealand mainland. Lit. "wai": river, "taki" (tangi): noisy or weeping.
properties.comments: This feature is the N tributary flowing S into North Bounty Sea Channel, on the outer continental slope, SW of Banks Peninsula and offshore from the E coast of the South Island of New Zealand. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (CBS)

properties.name: Wallabi
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named after the adjacent Wallabi Group of Islands, Western Australia.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Perth".

properties.name: Wallaby
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: "Wallaby" is a historical name for features in this area. Named by Symonds and Cameron in 1977.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Hartog".

properties.name: Wallaby-Cuvier
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: "Wallaby" and "Cuvier" are historical names for features in this area.
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric map "Hartog" (however shown as Wallaby-Zenith Fracture Zone on that map).

properties.name: Walvis
properties.history: Named from the nearby town of Walvis Bay, in Namibia.

properties.name: Wangdol
properties.proposer: Korea Committee on Geographical Names (KCGN)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Wangdol Reef (Wangdol Cho in Korean). Wangdol is the Korean for "great stone".
properties.comments: This feature has a V-shape and a steepness of 10.

properties.name: Watu Norte
properties.proposer: Petroleo Brasileiro (Petrobras), Brazil
properties.history: Named to point out its likely association with the nearby Doce River fluvial system during sea level falls. The specific term "Watu" means "wide river or sweet river" in the language of the local Botocudos. The Botocudos belong to a great Indian nation w
properties.comments: Feature discoverered in 2006 during geohazards studies in continental slope of Brazilian margin.

properties.name: Watu Sul
properties.proposer: Petroleo Brasileiro (Petrobras), Brazil
properties.history: Named to point out its likely association with the nearby Doce River fluvial system during sea level falls. The specific term "Watu" means "wide river or sweet river" in the language of the local Botocudos. The Botocudos belong to a great Indian nation w
properties.comments: Feature discovered in 2006 during geohazards studies in continental slope of Brazilian margin.

properties.name: Wayuu
properties.proposer: Colombian Hydrographic Office (CIOH)
properties.history: named for the indigenous Wayuu people of Colombia. "Wayuu" is an Indian name.

properties.name: Wegener
properties.proposer: Hans Werner Schenke, Alfred-Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research (AWI), Germany
properties.history: Named after the German polar scientist Alfred Lothar Wegener (1880-1930).

properties.name: West Adare
properties.history: Named from the nearby Cape Adare, Antarctica.
properties.comments: Formerly, Adare Ridge. It is the western margin ridge of a distinct rift feature north of Cape Adare. Two other parts of the rift have been named: the central low area has been named "Adare Trough" and the eastern rift margin ridge has been named "East A

properties.name: West Aves
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named in association with the nearby Aves Ridge, of which the apron is due west.

properties.name: West Cayman
properties.proposer: Jose Luis Frias Salazar, National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI), Mexico; and Lisa Taylor, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named for its geographical position, west of the Cayman Islands.

properties.name: West Florida
properties.proposer: Jose Luis Frias Salazar, National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI), Mexico; and Lisa Taylor, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from its geographical position, west of Florida, USA.
properties.comments: Shown as Florida Escarpment in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: West Mariana
properties.history: Named from its location, west of the Mariana Islands.

properties.name: West Melanesian
properties.proposer: V. F. Kanaev, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named from its geographical position, north of the west Melanesian area of the South Pacific.
properties.comments: Wrongly shown as "Manus Trench" on GEBCO 5.10.

properties.name: West Sheba
properties.history: Named from the ancient kingdom of Sheba, in southern Arabia.
properties.comments: This is a sinuous mid-ocean ridge. Ref: Laughton, Whitmarsh and Jones, 1970.

properties.name: West Shoulder
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN)
properties.history:
The Godzilla Megamullion science team gave 14 names for the individual
topographic elements of the Godzilla Megamullion, such as "West Arm
Ridge", imitating the body parts of Godzilla from its back. Since this
feature is an elongated bathymetric high in
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape.

properties.name: Western
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from its location in the western part of the Ross Sea.
properties.comments: This feature is located in McMurdo Sound, north of West Dailey Isle, Antarctica. The name was recorded in a scientific journal in 1983 and first appeared on NIWA Misc chart 'McMurdo Sound' in 1985.

properties.name: Western
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from its location in the western part of the Ross Sea.
properties.comments: This feature is located in McMurdo Sound, east of Bowers Piedmont Glacier, Victoria Land, Antarctica. The name was recorded in a scientific journal in 1983 and first appeared on NIWA Misc chart 'McMurdo Sound' in 1985.

properties.name: Western Crozon
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from its geographical position, west of the town of Crozon, on the Western coast of Brittany, France.

properties.name: Whakatane
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named from the nearby New Zealand land features, Whakatane (locality) and Whakatane River.
properties.comments:
Two sea valleys trending NE off the continental shelf merging into the Tauranga Canyon. 
References: Pantin et al. 1973 ("Bay of Plenty" Chart); Wright, 1989 ("Bay of Plenty" Chart); Baldwin & Lewis, 1991 ("Cook" Chart).

properties.name: Whidbey
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from the nearby Whidbey Isles, South Australia, so named by M. Flinders "after my worthy friend, the former Master-attendant at Sheerness".
properties.comments: Taken from the AGSO Bathymetric Map "Ceduna".

properties.name: Whiting
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA; and Advisory Committee on Undersea Features (ACUF) of the U.S. Board on Geographic Names

properties.name: Wildcat
properties.proposer: Advisory Committee on Undersea Features (ACUF), of the Board on Geographic Names, USA
properties.history: Named from the U.S. survey launch "Wildcat", commanded by Rear Admiral Paul A. Smith, U.S. Coast and Geodetic Survey (C&GS), during surveys of the Kenai Peninsula and other parts of southern Alaska in the 1920s.
properties.comments: This feature is located in the northern Gulf of Alaska. It has an average steepness of 4%.

properties.name: Willaumez-Manus
properties.history: Named from its geographical position, between Manus Island and Willaumez Peninsula, Papua New Guinea.
properties.comments: Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Wilshaw
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the British cable ship, CS "Edward Wilshaw" that made earliest shoal soundings of this very linear feature in 1954; confirmed by British cable ship CS "Stanley Angwin" in 1956.

properties.name: Wilson
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history: Named in association with Wilson Piedmont Glacier, which the British Antarctic Expedition (1910-1913) named after Dr Edward A Wilson (1872-1912), surgeon and artist with Scott's first expedition, and chief of the scientific staff with the second. Wilson
properties.comments: This feature is located in McMurdo Sound, southeast of Cape Roberts, Antarctica. The name was recorded in a scientific journal in 1991 and first appeared on NIWA Misc chart 'McMurdo Sound' in 1985.

properties.name: Wilson
properties.history: Named after Dr. Edward Wilson, medical officer on Scott's expeditions. A key member of Scott's Last Expedition. Died with Scott in 1913.

properties.name: Yalata
properties.proposer: J. J. Doyle, Australian Hydrographic Service (AHS)
properties.history: Named from "Yalata", the large area of Aboriginal Land bordering the adjacent coast and a small homestead in the viscinity, in South Australia. It is reported that "yalata" is an aboriginal word for "shellfish". Not to be confused with the nearby Yatala
properties.comments: Taken from the Bathymetric Map "Eyre".

properties.name: Yamato
properties.comments: Shown as Yamato Ridge on GEBCO Sheet 5.06.

properties.name: Yamato
properties.comments: Formerly, Tamato Ridge. Adopted from the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Yap
properties.history: Named from the nearby Yap Island, one of the Caroline Islands in the Federated States of Micronesia.
properties.comments: As for several other trenches in the Western Pacific, the existence of this feature was well known by the 1930s-1940s. Jamstec's Dr. Fujiwara submitted more precise depth figure in 1997. Significantly deeper depth of 8946 m was reported by the Japanese R

properties.name: Yelcho
properties.history: Named from the Chilean small steel-build steamer loaned to Shackleton to rescue his men from Elephant Island.

properties.name: Yeu
properties.proposer: Raymond Le Suave and Jean-Francois Bourillet, French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (IFREMER)
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of Yeu, located off the western coast of France.

properties.name: Yitong
properties.proposer:
Guangzhou Marine Geological 
Survey, China
properties.history: Named from the nearby Yitong Ansha (Helen Shoal), thus named by the Chinese government in 1983.
properties.comments: This feature has a steepness of 3 to 10. It comprises several canyons extending NW-SE.

properties.name: Yucatan
properties.proposer: Jose Luis Frias Salazar, National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI), Mexico; and Lisa Taylor, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Yucatan Peninsula, Mexico.

properties.name: Yucatan
properties.proposer: Jose Luis Frias Salazar, National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI), Mexico; and Lisa Taylor, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Yucatan Peninsula, Mexico.
properties.comments: Shown as Yucatan Escarpment in the ACUF Gazetteer.

properties.name: Yucatan
properties.proposer: Jose Luis Frias Salazar, National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI), Mexico; and Lisa Taylor, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA
properties.history: Named from the nearby Yucatan Peninsula, Mexico.

properties.name: Yujo-Friendship
properties.proposer: Japanese Committee on Undersea Feature Names (JCUFN), and Advisory Committee on Undersea Features (ACUF - of the US Board of Geographical Names)
properties.history: Named to honor the close relationship and cooperation between Japan and the USA. "Yujo" standing for "Friendship" in Japanese, "Yujo-Friendship" literarlly stands for close friendship between the two countries. This feature lies in an area where the Japa
properties.comments: This feature has an elongated shape.

properties.name: Yuma
properties.proposer: Troy L. Holcombe, National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), USA; and Advisory Committee on Undersea Features (ACUF) of the U.S. Board on Geographic Names
properties.history: Named from the nearby Rio Yuma, Dominican Republic.

properties.name: Yunaska
properties.history: Named from the nearby island of Yunaska, in the Aleutian Islands, Alaska, USA.

properties.name: Zapiola
properties.history: Named from the Argentinian  research vessel "Zapiola". She carried out many joint expeditions with the U.S. research vessel "Vema" (LDEO) in the South Atlantic Ocean in the 1960's and 1970's.

properties.name: Zavadovsky
properties.proposer: Vladimir G. Kort, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named after the Russian hydrographer I. I. Zavadovsky (1780-1821), participant in the Antarctic expedition of Bellingshausen (1819-1821) on the ship "Vostok".

properties.name: Zeehaen
properties.proposer: James R. Cochran, Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory (L-DEO), Columbia University, USA
properties.history: Named from the "Zeehaen", one of the vessels of Abel Janszoon Tasman (1603-1659), the famous Dutch explorer who discovered Tasmania and New Zealand in 1642.

properties.name: Zeewolf
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the "Zeewolf", one of the vessels of the 17th century Dutch East India Company that operated in this region. She was the first ship to visit St. Paul Island located 200-300 km southeast of this Fracture Zone.
properties.comments: This feature was discovered during the SIO's Monsoon Expedition.

properties.name: Zeewyk
properties.proposer: Robert L. Fisher, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), USA
properties.history: Named from the ship "Zeewyk" of the Dutch East India Company (VOC) (Captain Jan Steyns) that was wrecked in 1727 on Pelsaert group (about 2845'S) of Houfman Abrolhos Islands, off the west coast of Australia.

properties.name: Zenisu
properties.proposer: Kunio Yashima, Japan Hydrographic and Oceanographic Department (JHOD)
properties.history: Named from the pinacles ("zenisu" in Japanese) which are numerous in this area and are tectonically important.
properties.comments: This feature has irregular summits.

properties.name: Zenkevich
properties.proposer: Gleb B. Udintsev, Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IO RAS)
properties.history: Named after the Russian marine biologist, Academician L. A. Zenkevich (1889-1970), leader of many expeditions in the Arctic seas and the Pacific Ocean.

properties.name: Zhemchug
properties.proposer: B. N. Kotenev, Russian Federal Research Institute of Fisheries and Oceanography (VNIRO)
properties.history: Named from the Russian research vessel "Zhemchug" that explored this feature.

properties.name: Zhemchug
properties.proposer: D. E. Gershanovich, Russian Federal Research Institute of Fisheries and Oceanography (VNIRO)
properties.history: Named from the Russian research vessel "Zhemchug" that discovered and explored this feature.

properties.name: Zhenzhu
properties.proposer:
Guangzhou Marine Geological 
Survey, China
properties.history: Named from the nearby Zhenzhu River, a small river close to the Antarctic Great Wall Station,a scientific station established by China. The river was named by the Chinese Antarctic Research Team in February 1986 and accepted by SCAR. "Zhenzhu" means "Pea
properties.comments: This feature is adjacent to King George Island, with its N part extending to the South Shetland Trough. It slopes from S to N. It consists of nine canyons on the upper part, converging into one single canyon on the lower part.

properties.name: Zhilinsky
properties.proposer: Garrik E. Grikurov, All-Russia Research Institute for Geology and Mineral Resources of the World Ocean (VNIIOkeangeologia)
properties.history: Named after Anatoliy Kazimirovich Zhilinsky (1912-1993), Russian hydrographer, Chief of the North Hydrographic Expedition in 1953-1958, of a division of the Navy Hydrographic Department in 1958-1961, and of the Hydrographic Enterprise of the Maritime Fle

properties.name: Candarli
properties.proposer: Sevket Gucluer, Department of Navigation, Hydrography and Oceanography, Turkey
properties.history: Named from the Turkish research vessel "Candarli" that discovered this feature.

properties.name: Omakere
properties.proposer: New Zealand Geographic Board (NZGB)
properties.history:
Named in association with Omakere (locality and hill) and Omakere Stream on the adjacent New Zealand mainland.
Lit. "o": a place of; "makere": to be lost, abandoned or to die, ie. a place where someone was lost or died. Note: there is a macron on the "O"
properties.comments: This NE-SW trending feature is located on the middle part of the continental slope, approximately 75 km from Cape Kidnappers, offshore from the central E coast of the North Island of New Zealand. The name first appeared on NZ Coastal Bathymetry Series (C
